schema.name: Healthyfied Filipino Style Steak

recipeInstructions.text: Thinly slice the eggplant, tomatoes, onion, and cabbage. Cut the red bell pepper into strips.
Season the ribeye steak with salt and pepper on both sides.
Prepare a grill or skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the steak to your preferred doneness, about 4 minutes per side for medium-rare. Let it rest for 3 minutes, then slice against the grain.
Using the same skillet, reduce to medium heat. Add the sliced vegetables and sauté until they are soft and tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Serve the sliced steak topped with the sautéed vegetables.

schema.description: Dive into a guilt-free culinary adventure with our Healthyfied Filipino Style Steak! Tailored for health enthusiasts, this high-protein, low-carb, yet slightly high-sodium recipe brings a healthy twist to your meals without compromising flavor. Perfect for those on a journey for healthier alternatives.

schema.name: Healthyfied  Pinoy Style Meal

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) for baking the boneless milkfish (bangus).
Season the milkfish with coconut amino, garlic powder, thyme, and ground pepper.
Slice the eggplant, tomatoes, and red onion. Cut the young corn into bite-sized pieces.
In a baking dish, arrange the seasoned milkfish and surround it with the sliced eggplant, tomatoes, young corn, and red onion. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil.
Bake the assembled dish in the preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until the milkfish is cooked through.
While the fish is baking, trim and prepare the fresh string beans.
In a skillet, melt the butter over medium heat and sauté the string beans until tender, about 8 minutes.
Beat the eggs and season with a pinch of salt and pepper. In the same skillet, cook the beaten eggs until fully set to make scrambled eggs.

schema.description: Dive into a Healthyfied Pinoy Style Meal, intricately prepared to cater to those focusing on a high-protein, high-sodium, and high-fiber diet. This dish, rooted in the rich culinary traditions of the Philippines, combines the unique flavors of coconut amino, boneless milkfish (bangus), eggplant, young corn, tomatoes, red onions, and a selection of spices, promising a delicious venture into healthy eating.

schema.name: healthyfied salmon vegetable pancake (copy)

recipeInstructions.text: Start by dicing the bell pepper and chopping the red onion. Shred the red cabbage finely.
Drain and flake the pink salmon from the can.
In a large bowl, beat the eggs thoroughly.
To the beaten eggs, add diced bell pepper, chopped onion, shredded red cabbage, flaked pink salmon, tomato puree, and Kewpie Mayo. Mix well.
Melt the salted butter on a pan over medium heat. Pour the mixture into the pan, spreading evenly.
Cook the pancake for about 4 minutes on one side, then carefully flip it over.
Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the top and cook for another 4 minutes until the cheese is melted and the pancake is cooked through.

schema.description: Dive into a mouthwatering experience with our healthyfied salmon vegetable pancake! This recipe is a perfect blend of high-protein, low-carb, high-sodium, and high-fiber ingredients designed for those who love to keep their meals nutritious without sacrificing flavor. Featuring the goodness of pink salmon, mozzarella cheese, fresh veggies, and a touch of Kewpie Mayo, this dish brings a delightful fusion of tastes that makes eating healthy an absolute pleasure. Ideal for anyone following a diet focused on healthful recipes, this pancake promises a tasty and nourishing meal.

schema.name: S&r Meets Healthyfied

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the tomatoes, broccoli, and capsicums under cold water.
Chop the tomatoes, broccoli, capsicum green, and red capsicum into bite-sized pieces.
Grill the quarter pound beef patty according to your preference, usually taking about 4-6 minutes for a medium-cook.
As the beef patty cooks, prepare the tuna wrap by gently heating it on a pan for about 2 minutes, being careful not to dry it out.
Assemble your dish by placing the grilled beef patty and tuna wrap on a plate.
Surround the patty and wrap with the freshly chopped tomatoes, broccoli, and capsicums.

schema.description: Dive into the world of healthy eating without sacrificing taste with our 'S&r Meets Healthyfied' recipe. Perfect for those who are looking for high-protein and high-fiber options, this recipe combines the goodness of fresh vegetables like broccoli, capsicum, and tomatoes with the hearty satisfaction of a quarter pound beef patty and a tuna wrap. It's a unique blend that brings together health and flavor in each bite, making it an excellent choice for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes without compromise.

schema.name: healthyfied japchae

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Organic Green Peas under cold water.
Beat the Egg with 1 pinch of Salt and a 1/2 tsp of ground Black Pepper.
Mince the Garlic.
Rinse the Shirataki Tofu Spaghetti under cold water and drain well.
Chop the Red Onion.
In a skillet, heat the Butter over medium heat and cook the Egg to make a thin omelette, then slice it into strips, approximately 5 minutes.
In the same skillet, add the Sesame Oil and sauté the Garlic and Red Onion until soft, approximately 8 minutes.
Add the beef strips and season with the remaining Salt and Black Pepper, cooking until the beef is browned, about 10 minutes.
Combine the Shirataki Tofu Spaghetti, cooked beef, egg strips, and Organic Green Peas in the skillet.
Pour the Coconut Aminos over the mixture and toss well to combine. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, ensuring the flavors meld together.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthy twist on the traditional Korean favorite with this Healthyfied Japchae recipe. Packed with high-protein beef strips, high-fiber shirataki tofu spaghetti, and a variety of flavorful ingredients, this dish is perfect for those seeking healthy recipes without sacrificing taste. The use of coconut aminos and organic green peas adds a unique touch to this nutritious meal, making it suitable for health-conscious individuals looking for high-sodium options.

schema.name: Dory-ALog

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the 율무 (Job's Tears) under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the 율무 (Job's Tears) according to package instructions until tender, about 20 minutes, then set aside.
Slice the baby corn spears and chop the pechay.
Cut the whole fruit into wedges.
Season the cream dory fillet with salt and pepper to taste.
In a non-stick skillet, cook the cream dory fillet over medium heat until golden brown and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.
In a separate pan, lightly sauté the baby corn spears and chopped pechay for about 5 minutes.
Combine the cooked 율무 (Job's Tears) with the sautéed vegetables. Add the all-purpose pesto and mix until the ingredients are well coated.
Serve the pesto mix topped with the cooked cream dory fillet and garnish with the fruit wedges.

schema.description: Our Dory-ALog is a high-protein, high-sodium culinary delight that's been healthified for those who love to indulge in healthy recipes. Perfect for anyone looking to enrich their diet with nutritious, yet incredibly flavorful dishes.

schema.name: Healthyfied Kimchi Beef Rice
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp(s), Seeds, sesame seeds, whole, dried

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice (Job's Tears) under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, approximately 20 minutes, then set aside.
Finely dice the red onion and capsicum green. Mince the garlic.
Heat a pan over medium heat, add the ground beef and cook until browned, about 10 minutes.
To the pan, add the diced onion, capsicum, minced garlic, sesame seeds, ginger powder, salt, pepper, and coco sugar. Cook for another 5 minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened.
Stir in the kimchi and cook for an additional 5 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Combine the cooked beef mixture with the steamed Adlai Rice. Adjust seasoning to taste.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Kimchi Beef Rice is the perfect combination of savory, spicy, and hearty—a health-conscious take on traditional flavors. Packed with high-protein and reimagined with a high-sodium twist, this dish offers a delicious way to enjoy healthy recipes without sacrificing taste. Ideal for anyone looking to indulge in healthified recipes that are as nourishing as they are flavorful.

schema.name: healthyfied ice cream sandwich

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the Mike's Keto Bread if not pre-sliced.
In a bowl, beat the egg and mix with unsweetened almond milk.
Dip each slice of bread into the egg and almond milk mixture, ensuring both sides are well coated.
In a non-stick skillet over medium heat, cook the dipped bread slices for about 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
Allow the cooked bread slices to cool slightly.
Spread 1 tbsp of chocolate ice cream on one slice of the slightly cooled bread, then top with the other slice to form a sandwich.
Serve immediately or freeze for a firmer ice cream texture.

schema.description: Indulge in a guilt-free treat with our Healthyfied Ice Cream Sandwich, perfect for those following a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar diet. Enjoy the union of homemade Mike's Keto Bread with rich chocolate ice cream, offering a smarter choice for your dessert cravings.

schema.name: Healthyfied Cabbage Shanghai
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse and finely shred the cabbage. Cut the eggplant and carrots into thin strips. Crumble the silken tofu.
Whisk the eggs in a large mixing bowl.
Add the shredded cabbage, eggplant strips, crumbled tofu, shredded carrot, ground pork, salt, and ground black pepper to the bowl with the whisked eggs. Mix well.

Preheat a skillet over medium heat. Take spoonfuls of the mixture and form them into small rolls. Cook in batches, turning occasionally, until golden brown and the pork is fully cooked, about 8 minutes.

schema.description: Indulge in a wholesome and nutritious twist with our Healthyfied Cabbage Shanghai recipe. Perfect for those seeking high-protein and high-fiber meals, this dish is a savory delight that's both low in carbs and beautifully healthified. Whether you're on a quest for healthy recipes or looking to maintain a balanced diet without compromising taste, this creation promises to cater to your needs while satisfying your cravings.

schema.name: Healthyfied Broccoli Mango Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by hard boiling the eggs: place them in a pot of cold water, bring to a boil, then cover and remove from heat. Let them sit for 9 minutes, then transfer to cold water to cool.
While the eggs are cooking, wash the broccoli and mango. Cut the broccoli into bite-sized florets and dice the mango into cubes.
Thinly slice the red onion.
Once the eggs are cool, peel and chop them into pieces.
In a large salad bowl, combine the broccoli florets, diced mango, sliced red onion, chopped eggs, and longanisa (cut into bite-sized pieces if not already).
Season the salad with salt and pepper, then toss gently to ensure all ingredients are evenly mixed and coated.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Broccoli Mango Salad is a vibrant, high-protein, high-fiber dish perfect for those looking to enjoy healthy, flavorful meals. Incorporating the sweetness of mango with the crunch of fresh broccoli and the zest from red onions, this salad offers a delightful mix of textures and tastes. It's ideal for anyone following a health-conscious diet without compromising on taste.

schema.name: Healthyfied Naked Burrito

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the cauliflower under cold water and chop it into small pieces.
Dice the red capsicum and red onion.
In a pan, melt the butter over medium heat and sauté the cauliflower until it starts to soften, about 5 minutes.
Add the lean beef to the pan, breaking it apart with a spoon. Cook until browned, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the spices (marjoram, oregano, paprika, cumin), salt, and pepper. Cook for an additional 2 minutes to blend the flavors.
Add the diced capsicum and red onion to the pan. Cook until they are soft, about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle the Parmesan cheese over the burrito mix and stir until melted and well combined.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Naked Burrito packs a punch with its high-protein, high-fiber ingredients while keeping an eye on health. Seasoned with spices like marjoram, dried oregano, paprika, and cumin, it's a flavorful take on healthy eating. Perfect for those on a quest for Healthy Recipes that don't skimp on taste!

schema.name: Healthyfied Steamed Boneless Bangus

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Boneless Milkfish Belly under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
Finely chop the Garlic and Red Onion, and slice the Tomatoes into small pieces.
Season the Milkfish Belly with ground Pepper.
Heat the Extra-Virgin Olive Oil in a steamer over medium heat.
On the steamer tray, lay out the seasoned Milkfish Belly and top with the chopped Garlic, Onion, and Tomatoes.
Cover and steam for about 15 minutes or until the Milkfish Belly is fully cooked.

schema.description: This 'Healthyfied Steamed Boneless Bangus' is perfect for those looking for a high-protein, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar meal option. Crafted with health in mind, this recipe aligns with modern nutritional preferences, offering a delicious and nourishing dish that fits seamlessly into a healthy lifestyle.

schema.name: Adlai Arrozcaldo

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by dicing the red onion and carrots, mincing the garlic, and thinly slicing the ginger.
Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
In a large pot, combine the Adlai Rice with 6 cups of water, diced onion, minced garlic, and sliced ginger. Bring to a boil.
While the rice mixture is coming to a boil, season the boneless chicken thigh with ground pepper.
Once boiling, reduce the heat to a simmer and add the seasoned chicken thigh to the pot. Allow to simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked.
Remove the chicken from the pot, let cool, then shred it into bite-sized pieces.
Return the shredded chicken to the pot and add diced carrots. Cook for an additional 10 minutes, until the carrots are tender.
Season the arrozcaldo with lemon juice and additional ground pepper to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy your nutritious Adlai Arrozcaldo.

schema.description: This Adlai Arrozcaldo is a healthified twist on the classic Filipino comfort food, perfect for anyone looking for a high-protein, low-sodium, and low-sugar meal. Packed with nourishing ingredients like boneless chicken thigh, Adlai rice (Job's Tears), and a medley of vegetables, this recipe offers a hearty and flavorful dish that supports a healthy lifestyle.

schema.name: healthyfied chorizo sandwich

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the Iberico chorizo into thin slices.
Toast the keto friendly bread until crispy and golden brown.
Spread the Kewpie mayo evenly over one side of each slice of toasted bread.
Layer the sliced Iberico chorizo on one of the slices of bread, mayo side up.
Top the chorizo with the second slice of bread, mayo side down, to form a sandwich.

schema.description: This healthyfied chorizo sandwich is perfect for anyone following a high-protein, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. Featuring keto-friendly bread, exquisite Iberico chorizo, and creamy Kewpie mayo, it's an indulgent yet guilt-free option for health-conscious gourmets.

schema.name: Healthyfied Chicken Sandwich Filling

recipeInstructions.text: Finely dice the white onion.
Shred the cooked chicken breast into small pieces.
In a bowl, combine the diced onion, shredded chicken breast, organic coconut aminos, ground black pepper, salt, and mayonnaise.
Mix all the ingredients until well combined and the chicken is evenly coated with the mayonnaise and seasoning mixture.
Let the mixture rest in the refrigerator for about 15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Chicken Sandwich Filling is perfect for those looking for a high-protein, low-carb option. It's seasoned with just the right amount of spices and dressed with a touch of mayonnaise, making it a delicious addition to your healthy recipe collection. Whether you're on a health kick or just looking for something delicious and nutritious, this sandwich filling fits the bill.

schema.name: Healthyfied Tinola Manok

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the thigh fillets under cold water and pat dry with a paper towel.
Peel and slice the red onion. Peel and julienne the ginger root. Peel and mince the garlic.
Season the thigh fillets with salt and ground pepper evenly on both sides.
In a large pot, sauté the sliced onion, julienned ginger, and minced garlic until they are soft and aromatic, about 5 minutes.
Add the seasoned thigh fillets to the pot and sear each side for about 3 minutes, allowing them to brown slightly.
Fill the pot with enough water to cover the chicken, then bring to a boil. Lower the heat and let it simmer until the chicken is fully cooked, about 30 minutes.
Optional: Add your choice of leafy greens or papaya slices 10 minutes before finishing the cooking to incorporate more nutrients.

schema.description: Dive into a healthier version of a classic Filipino comfort food with this Healthyfied Tinola Manok. Brimming with high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar ingredients, it's a guilt-free delight for those seeking healthy yet hearty meals. Perfect for anyone looking to enjoy traditional flavors without compromising their dietary goals.

schema.name: Healthyfied Vegetable Platter

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 200°C (392°F).
Wash all the vegetables (eggplant, yellow zucchini, cauliflower, and broccoli) under cold water.
Cut the eggplant and yellow zucchini into 1/2 inch thick slices. Break the cauliflower and broccoli into medium-sized florets.
In a large mixing bowl, combine olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
Add the sliced eggplant, zucchini, and florets of cauliflower and broccoli into the bowl with the seasoning. Toss well to ensure all the vegetables are evenly coated.
Spread the seasoned vegetables on a baking tray in a single layer. Dot with butter.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes or until the vegetables are tender and slightly golden, turning halfway through the cooking time.

schema.description: Dive into a world of health with our Healthyfied Vegetable Platter, a recipe that is not just high in fiber but also delicately designed for those who cherish healthy eating. This platter combines the best of fresh vegetables including eggplant, yellow zucchini, cauliflower, and broccoli, all seasoned to perfection. Ideal for anyone looking for healthy and healthified recipes to add to their diet.

schema.name: PrepMeal Ham Cabbage Bowl

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the cabbage and carrots under cold water, then chop the cabbage and dice the carrots.
Peel and thinly slice the red onion. Mince the garlic.
In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the sliced onion and minced garlic for about 3 minutes, until softened.
Add the chopped cabbage and diced carrots to the skillet. Stir occasionally, cooking for about 10 minutes until the vegetables are tender.

While the vegetables are cooking, boil the eggs in a separate pot for 7 minutes for soft-boiled eggs, or 10 minutes for hard-boiled. Once cooked, remove from heat, cool in cold water, peel and set aside.
Cut the ham into bite-sized pieces and add to the skillet with the vegetables. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Slice the boiled eggs in half and serve on top of the ham and vegetable mixture.

schema.description: This PrepMeal Ham Cabbage Bowl is a powerhouse meal, perfect for those looking to enjoy a high-protein, high-fiber dish that doesn't skimp on flavor. Part of our Healthyfied Recipes collection, it combines the sweetness of honey smoked ham with the nutritious crunch of cabbage and carrots, making it not just a feast for the palate but also a boon for your health.

schema.name: Healthyfied Ginataang Kalabasa

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the green string beans thoroughly and cut them into 2-inch pieces.
Dice the ham into small cubes.
Peel the kabocha squash and cut into bite-sized pieces.
In a pan, sauté the diced ham until it's lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the kabocha squash to the pan, cover, and let it cook until it starts to soften, about 15 minutes.
Pour the coconut cream into the pan, mixing well with the ham and squash. Allow to simmer until the mixture thickens, about 10 minutes.
Add the green string beans and cook until they are tender but still crisp, about 5 minutes.
Crumble the cooked uncured bacon and sprinkle over the dish before serving.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Ginataang Kalabasa recipe is a revitalized version of a Filipino classic, tailored for those seeking high-protein and low-carb options without compromising on taste. Crafted for health-conscious individuals, this dish blends the richness of coconut cream with the natural sweetness of kabocha squash, enhanced by the savory notes of ham and uncured bacon, all while keeping an eye on your sodium intake.

schema.name: Bacon ALog

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, then set aside. This should take about 20 minutes.
Dice the carrots, red bell pepper, bell pepper, and red onion.
Mince the garlic.
In a skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove the bacon and set aside on a paper towel to drain the excess grease.
In the same skillet with the bacon grease, sauté the diced carrots, bell peppers, red onion, and minced garlic over medium heat until softened, about 5 minutes.
Chop the cooked bacon into small pieces.
Combine the cooked Adlai Rice, sautéed vegetables, and chopped bacon in a large bowl.
Crack the egg into the skillet and scramble until fully cooked, then stir into the rice mixture.

schema.description: Bacon ALog is a delightful twist on a healthy meal, incorporating nutritious ingredients like Adlai Rice, fresh vegetables, and the irresistible taste of bacon. This recipe is perfect for those following a low-sugar diet and seeking healthified versions of their favorite dishes.

schema.name: Hawaiian  Seafood Red Salad
recipeIngredient: 3 sticks (86 g), Ichiban Alaskan Crab Flavored

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the red cabbage, apple, and carrot into bite-sized pieces.
Drain the pineapple tidbits and tuna chunks from their water.
Shred the Ichiban Alaskan crab flavored sticks into small, thin pieces.
Steam the broccoli until it is tender and chop it into small pieces.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped cabbage, pineapple tidbits, shredded crab sticks, diced apple, steamed broccoli, tuna chunks, and diced carrot.
Toss the ingredients thoroughly to ensure they are well combined.

schema.description: Dive into a vibrant blend of flavors with our Hawaiian Seafood Red Salad. This healthified recipe brings together the crunch of red cabbage, the sweetness of pineapple and apples, the unique taste of Alaskan crab flavored sticks, along with the nutritious punch of steamed broccoli, carrots, and protein-rich tuna. It's a perfect harmony of taste and health, tailored for those looking for a high-protein, high-fiber meal that doesn't shy away from being deliciously indulgent. Whether you're on a journey to eat healthier or simply love experimenting with flavors, this salad is a delightful choice.

schema.name: Healthyfied Wagyupsal

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the sweet capsicum, orange capsicum, red mushrooms, tomatoes, and lettuce under cold water. Pat them dry.
Slice the sweet capsicum, orange capsicum, red mushrooms, and tomatoes into bite-sized pieces.
Mince the garlic finely.
Chop the fresh thyme and rosemary.
In a large bowl, mix the sliced vegetables, minced garlic, chopped thyme, chopped rosemary, and salt. Let it marinate for about 10 minutes.
Slice the Japanese Wagyu Kobe Beef into thin slices.
Preheat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill the marinated vegetables for about 5 minutes until they're slightly charred and tender, then remove and set aside.
In the same pan, grill the Wagyu beef slices for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they reach your desired doneness.
Serve the grilled Wagyu beef alongside the grilled vegetables, fresh lettuce, and kimchi. Enjoy your Healthyfied Wagyupsal.

schema.description: Indulge in a high-protein, low-carb, high-fiber, and high-sodium culinary masterpiece with our Healthyfied Wagyupsal recipe. Perfect for health-conscious individuals looking to enjoy luxurious flavors without guilt, this dish combines Japanese Wagyu Kobe Beef with a vibrant mix of fresh vegetables and kimchi. Each bite promises a burst of rich flavor and a multitude of health benefits, making it a standout addition to any healthy recipe collection.

schema.name: Healthyfied Beef Bellpepper Bolognaise

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the bell pepper under cold water, then dice it into small pieces.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the diced bell pepper to the skillet and sauté for about 5 minutes until slightly softened.
Increase the heat to medium-high and add the beef to the skillet. Cook for about 10 minutes, breaking it apart with a spatula until browned.
Season the beef and bell pepper mixture with salt, white pepper, thyme, basil, marjoram, and black pepper. Stir well to combine.
Pour in the water and add the bolognese sauce to the skillet. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve hot.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Beef Bellpepper Bolognaise brings a high-protein and low-carb delight to your table, perfect for health enthusiasts looking for low-sugar yet flavorful options. Each bite is an infusion of healthy and healthified ingredients designed to nourish your body and tantalize your taste buds with a blend of fresh herbs and robust flavors.

schema.name: Healthyfied Tuna Tomato Bowl

recipeInstructions.text: Prep the vegetables: wash and chop the Bok Choi, dice the eggplant, chop the tomatoes, finely slice the red onion, and mince the garlic.
Drain and flake the tuna.
In a bowl, mix the olive oil, lemon juice, marjoram, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
In a large skillet, heat a tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat and sauté the red onion and garlic until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the diced eggplant to the skillet and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Add the bok choy and chopped tomatoes to the skillet, cooking until the bok choy is wilted, about 5 minutes.
Finally, stir in the flaked tuna, warming it through.
Remove from heat and drizzle the dressing over the cooked mixture. Gently toss to combine.
Serve the Tuna Tomato Bowl warm.

schema.description: Dive into this 'Healthyfied Tuna Tomato Bowl', a splendid combination of high-protein, high-fiber goodness that makes it a perfect choice for those looking for healthy meal options. With robust flavors from fresh herbs and the tanginess of lemon juice, this dish promises to deliver on both taste and health.

schema.name: Healthyfied Mango Veggie wrap

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the cucumber under cold water, then slice into thin pieces.
Chop the lettuce into bite-size pieces.
Cut the mango into small, bite-size pieces.
Finely chop the red onion.
Lay the tortilla wrap flat on a clean surface.
Spread the labneh over the tortilla.
Arrange the lettuce, cucumber slices, mango pieces, and red onion on the tortilla.
Sprinkle the grated Parmesan cheese over the vegetables.
Carefully roll up the tortilla tightly to enclose the filling.
Cut the wrap in half diagonally and serve immediately.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Mango Veggie Wrap combines the sweetness of mango with fresh vegetables and a hint of Parmesan cheese, all wrapped in a soft tortilla. Perfect for those who love healthy recipes with a high-sodium twist.

schema.name: Healthyfied English Breakfast
recipeIngredient: 3 pat (1 inch sq, 1/2 inch high), Butter

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your skillet over medium heat and add 1 pat of butter.
Clean the mushrooms with a damp cloth and slice them.
Once the butter has melted, add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and sauté for 5 minutes until they're browned and tender.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, whole milk, coconut aminos, and Himalayan salt.

In another skillet, melt 2 pats of butter over medium heat. Once melted, pour in the egg mixture and let it sit without stirring for 1 minute. Continue cooking for 3 minutes, gently pulling the eggs from the edge towards the center, until the eggs are softly set.
Warm the cooked slices of uncured bacon in the microwave for about 20 seconds or in a skillet over medium heat for about 2 minutes.

schema.description: Dive into a delicious makeover of the classic English breakfast, tailored for those seeking a high-protein, low-carb start to their day. With an aromatic combination of mushrooms, uncured bacon, and eggs all seasoned with Himalayan salt and a hint of coconut aminos, this 'Healthyfied English Breakfast' transforms traditional indulgence into a guilt-free pleasure. Perfect for anyone looking to maintain a healthy lifestyle without sacrificing taste.

schema.name: Healthyfied Tofu Sisig

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: Dice the red onion and leeks, mince the garlic, and finely chop the jalapeño peppers. Set aside.
Drain the firm tofu and wrap it in a clean kitchen towel. Place a weight on top (like a heavy pan) to press out excess water for about 20 minutes.
Crumble the pressed tofu into small pieces, mimicking the texture of ground meat.
In a pan, heat a little oil over medium heat and cook the ground beef until browned. This should take about 10 minutes.
To the same pan, add the diced red onions, leeks, minced garlic, and chopped jalapeño peppers. Sauté until the vegetables are softened, approximately 8 minutes.
Add the crumbled tofu to the pan along with the coconut amino and ground ginger. Stir well to combine and cook for another 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Serve your Healthyfied Tofu Sisig hot, garnished with additional jalapeño slices or leeks if desired.

schema.description: Indulge in a guilt-free version of a classic Filipino dish with our Healthyfied Tofu Sisig. Packed with high-protein ingredients and keeping it low-carb, this recipe is perfect for those who love to enjoy traditional flavors in a healthier way. Explore the vibrant mix of ground beef, aromatic spices, and tofu that makes this dish a delightful addition to your healthy recipe collection.

schema.name: Healthyfied Cajun Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the chicken breasts by trimming any excess fat.
In a small bowl, mix together thyme, rosemary, ground black pepper, and cajun style seasoning.
Rub the seasoning mix onto both sides of the chicken breasts.
Preheat a skillet over medium heat and add butter.

Once the butter is melted, add the seasoned chicken breasts to the skillet and cook for 5 minutes on each side or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C), adjusting the heat as necessary to prevent burning.
Drizzle the Kikoman over the chicken during the last minute of cooking.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Cajun Chicken recipe is perfect for those who are looking for a tasty, high-protein, and low-carb meal. It's seasoned with a spicy cajun style seasoning, fresh thyme, and rosemary, making it a flavorful yet health-conscious choice. Suitable for anyone looking to maintain a healthy diet without compromising on taste.

schema.name: Squid Ink ALog

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the 율무 (Job's Tears) under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the 율무 (Job's Tears) in a pot of boiling water until tender, about 20 minutes, then drain and set aside.

Chop the red onion and bell pepper. Mince the garlic and ginger root. Cut the cauliflower into small florets. Slice the squid rings and octopus legs into bite-sized pieces. Cut the hard-boiled egg into quarters.
In a large pot, sauté the red onion, bell pepper, garlic, and ginger in a bit of oil until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the squid ink, squid rings, and octopus legs to the pot. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Add the cooked 율무 (Job's Tears) and cauliflower to the pot. Pour enough water to cover all the ingredients. Bring to a boil and then simmer for about 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Continue to simmer for another 10 minutes.
Serve hot, garnishing each bowl with a quarter of a hard-boiled egg.

schema.description: This Squid Ink Arroz Caldo is a 'Healthyfied' version of the classic Filipino congee. It is packed with high-protein ingredients such as squid rings and octopus legs, low in sodium, and contains high-fiber components like 율무 (Job's Tears) and cauliflower. Perfect for anyone looking for healthy recipes that do not compromise on taste and texture.

schema.name: Healthyfied Pork and Mushrooms
recipeIngredient: 1 pat (1 inch sq, 1/2 inch high), Butter, unsalted

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Bokchoi under cold water and chop it into bite-sized pieces.
Peel and finely chop the White onion.
Peel and mince the garlic cloves.
Clean the White Button mushrooms by wiping them with a damp cloth and slice them.
Slice the Pork Tenderloin into thin strips.
Seed and dice the Red bell pepper.
In a large pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, sautéing until soft and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Increase the heat to medium-high and add the pork strips to the pan. Cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Add the sliced mushrooms and diced red bell pepper to the pan, cooking until they start to soften, about 4 minutes.
Stir in the Worcestershire sauce, salt, and ground black pepper, cooking for another minute.
Lower the heat to medium and pour in the Puremilk. Let the mixture simmer until the sauce slightly thickens, about 8 minutes.
Add the chopped Bokchoi to the pan, cover, and let it steam until tender, about 4 minutes.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Pork and Mushrooms recipe is a delicious way to enjoy a high-protein meal without sacrificing flavor. Perfect for those looking for healthy alternatives.

schema.name: Healthyfied omurice

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the Shirataki Noodles by rinsing them under cold water and boiling for 2 minutes. Then, drain and set aside to dry.
In a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs until well beaten.

Heat half a tablespoon of butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour in the eggs and cook for 2-3 minutes until the omelette is just set. Carefully fold the omelette in half and then slide it onto a plate.
In the same skillet, add the remaining butter and sauté the prepared Shirataki Noodles for about 5 minutes, or until they begin to slightly brown.
Stir in the Keto Ketchup with the noodles, mixing well to ensure the noodles are evenly coated. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Place the noodle mixture on the plate and gently fold the omelette over the top. Serve immediately for a warm, comforting meal.

schema.description: Indulge in this Healthyfied omurice, a delicious low-carb and low-sugar twist on the traditional Japanese omelette rice. Made with keto-friendly ingredients, this dish perfectly blends healthy eating with mouthwatering flavors, making it an ideal choice for those seeking nutritious yet satisfying meals.

schema.name: Healthyfied Beef Tendon Kaldereta

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the beef tendon thoroughly and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Peel and mince the garlic.
Peel and chop the potato, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and white onion into equal sizes to ensure even cooking.
In a pot, add the beef tendon and water. Bring to a boil and simmer for about 1 hour 30 minutes or until the tendon is tender.
Remove the tendon from the pot, set aside, and discard the water.
In the same pot, heat a little oil over medium heat and sauté the minced garlic until golden brown, about 2 minutes.
Add the cut vegetables (potato, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and white onion) to the pot and sauté for another 5 minutes.
Return the beef tendon to the pot and add the tomato sauce, stirring well to combine. Season with black pepper and salt.
Cover the pot and let the kaldereta simmer on low heat for about 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the sauce has thickened.
Serve your Healthyfied Beef Tendon Kaldereta hot and enjoy this nutritious twist on a classic Filipino comfort food.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Beef Tendon Kaldereta is a perfect combination of healthful eating and indulgent flavors. Designed for those who love high-protein and low-sugar diets, this recipe transforms a classic dish into a healthier alternative without compromising taste. Whether you're following a health-conscious lifestyle or simply looking for a nutritious meal, this healthy twist on the traditional Kaldereta is sure to impress.

schema.name: Healthyfied Wagyu Cabbage Sopas

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare all the ingredients: Cut the young corn, dice the red onion, shred the Parmesan cheese, slice the Wagyu beef into strips, mince the garlic, shred the mozzarella cheese, and chop the cabbage.
In a large pot, sauté the garlic and red onion over medium heat until they're softened and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add the Wagyu beef strips to the pot and cook until they're no longer pink, approximately 10 minutes.
Pour in the full cream milk and bring the mixture to a simmer. Then, add the young corn and cabbage, cooking until the vegetables are tender, about 7 minutes.
Season the sopas with salt to taste, then stir in the shredded Parmesan and mozzarella cheeses until melted and well combined.
Serve the Healthyfied Wagyu Cabbage Sopas hot, garnished with additional cheese if desired.

schema.description: Indulge in a nutritious twist on the classic sopas with our Healthyfied Wagyu Cabbage Sopas. This savory delight is packed with high-quality Wagyu beef, fresh vegetables, and a creamy, rich broth, making it perfect for those seeking a high-protein, low-carb meal without compromising on taste. Ideal for health-conscious individuals looking for healthy recipes that are both comforting and satisfying.

schema.name: Healthyfied Potato Vegetable Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the Garlic Marble Potatoes, Carrots, Cabbage, Eggplant, and Yellow raw under cold water.
Dice the Carrots, Cabbage, Eggplant, and Yellow raw, and mince the Garlic.
Boil the Garlic Marble Potatoes in a pot of water until they are tender, about 15 minutes.
In another pot, blanch the diced Carrots, Cabbage, and Eggplant for about 5 minutes, then drain.
Combine the boiled potatoes, blanched vegetables, minced garlic in a large bowl.
Add the mayonnaise, ground pepper, and lemon juice to the bowl. Mix well until all the ingredients are evenly coated.

schema.description: Dive into a bowl of Healthyfied Potato Vegetable Salad, a delight for anyone looking to enjoy a high-fiber, nutritious meal. Crafted with an assortment of fresh vegetables and seasoned to perfection, this salad epitomizes the essence of healthy living through 'Healthyfied' and 'Healthified Recipes'. It's a perfect choice for those seeking a refreshing, hearty meal.

schema.name: Healthyfied Ground Beef Caldereta
recipeIngredient: 0.25 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare all the vegetables first: mince the 6 cloves of garlic and dice the 83 grams of red onion and 120 grams of red bell pepper.
In a large pan, brown the 380 grams of ground beef over medium heat for about 8 minutes or until fully cooked. Drain excess fat if necessary.
Add the minced garlic and diced onion to the pan with beef. Cook for another 3 minutes or until the onion is translucent.
Introduce the 0.25 cup of tomato purée along with the diced red bell pepper to the pan. Stir well to combine.
Chop the 3 teaspoons of sweet pickle chips and add them to the pan. Season with 0.25 tsp of salt and 0.25 tsp of ground black pepper. Mix everything thoroughly.
Let the mixture simmer on low heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally to meld the flavors together.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Ground Beef Caldereta is a delicious twist on a classic Filipino dish, focusing on high-protein and low-carb ingredients to fit into a healthy lifestyle. Perfect for those who love to enjoy traditional flavors without compromising their dietary goals.

schema.name: Healthyfied Carrot Spaghetti With Meatballs

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C) for the meatballs.
Dice the eggplant, mince the garlic, and finely chop the parsley.
In a large mixing bowl, combine ground beef, eggplant, half of the minced garlic, half of the chopped parsley, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
Form the mixture into small meatballs and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake the meatballs for 20 minutes or until they're cooked through.
While meatballs are baking, use a spiralizer or vegetable peeler to create carrot spaghetti from the steamed carrots.
Steam the spinach until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. Set aside.
In a pan, sauté the remaining garlic in a little bit of oil over medium heat until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the carrot spaghetti to the pan, tossing it with the garlic for about 2-3 minutes just to warm through.
Serve the carrot spaghetti topped with meatballs, steamed spinach, and a sprinkle of the remaining parsley.

schema.description: Indulge in the perfect blend of health and taste with our Healthyfied Carrot Spaghetti with Meatballs recipe. This dish is a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar meal that doesn't compromise on flavor. Tailored to fit into Healthyfied and Healthy Recipes categories, it's ideal for anyone looking to enjoy classic comfort food in a nutritious way.

schema.name: Healthyfied Chicken Chopseuy

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your vegetables: Peel and slice the carrots into strips, chop the red onion, mince the garlic cloves, dice the red bell pepper into squares, cut the chayote into 1" pieces, and chop the green cabbage.
Cut the chicken thigh into bite-sized pieces.
Cut off the kernels from the cob of corn.
In a large pan, over medium heat, cook the chicken pieces until they are lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic, chopped onions, and slices of carrot into the pan, cook for another 5 minutes.
Introduce the red bell pepper, chayote, and corn to the pan, and pour in 1 cup of water. Allow the mixture to simmer for 10 minutes.
Season the chopseuy with ground black pepper and Kikoman. Stir well.
Lastly, add the chopped green cabbage, and let the dish simmer for an additional 5 minutes until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Chicken Chopseuy is a delightful take on the classic dish, packed with vibrant vegetables and flavorful chicken thigh. Perfect for those who are looking for healthy recipes that do not compromise on taste. This chopseuy is not just a feast for the eyes but also a nourishing meal that fits perfectly into a health-conscious lifestyle.

schema.name: Healthyfied Basmati Paella Negra

recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop the red onion and mince the garlic.
Rinse the Basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
In a large pan, melt the butter over medium heat and sauté the onion and garlic until they are soft and fragrant, which takes about 5 minutes.
Stir in the crab paste, salt, and black pepper to the onion mixture; mix well.
Add the Basmati rice to the pan, stirring constantly to ensure the rice is fully coated with the onion and crab paste mixture, cook for 2 minutes.
Dissolve the Posta Negra in 4 cups of hot water and add this to the rice mixture. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the frozen cooked shrimp and mixed vegetables to the pan. Cover and cook for an additional 10 minutes or until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
Remove from heat and gently fold in the Kewpie Mayo until everything is well combined.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Basmati Paella Negra is a delightful twist on a traditional favorite, designed for those looking to enjoy the richness of paella with a health-conscious approach. Perfect for anyone following a high-sodium, low-sugar diet, this recipe combines the aromatic Basmati rice with savory Posta Negra, crab paste, and a medley of vegetables and shrimp. It's a hearty meal that doesn't skimp on flavor, making it a fantastic choice for healthy recipe lovers seeking to mix up their meal routine.

schema.name: Healthyfied Garlic Egg Drop Bacon Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your vegetables: Slice the carrots, chop the red bell pepper and green cabbage, mince the garlic, and finely chop the red onion.
In a large pot, bring 6 cups of water to a boil.
Add the sliced carrots, chopped red bell pepper, and chopped green cabbage to the boiling water. Cook for about 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
While the vegetables are cooking, cut the bacon into small pieces.
In a separate pan, cook the bacon pieces over medium heat until crispy, about 5-7 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan used for bacon, sauté the minced garlic and chopped red onion until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Add the sautéed garlic and onion along with the crispy bacon to the pot of boiling vegetables.
Stir in the granulated garlic, then crack the egg into the soup. Gently stir the soup to create egg ribbons. Cook for an additional 3 minutes.
Remove the pot from heat. Allow the soup to sit for a couple of minutes before serving to enhance the flavors.

schema.description: Indulge in a delicious bowl of Healthyfied Garlic Egg Drop Bacon Soup, a perfect blend of health and flavor. Tailored for those following a low-carb diet, this recipe combines the richness of bacon with the wholesome goodness of vegetables and a garlicky broth. It's not just a soup; it's a hearty meal that celebrates healthy eating without compromising taste.

schema.name: Healthyfied Eggplant Lasagna
recipeIngredient: 1 container (8.00 oz), Mozzarella brick low-moisture parr-skim
1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare all your vegetables: Slice the eggplant into 1/4 inch slices. Finely chop the parsley, dice the tomatoes, and the white onion, and mince the garlic.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and diced onions, sautéing until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the lean ground beef to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking it apart with a spoon, about 10 minutes.

Stir in the passata, chopped tomatoes, and all the dried herbs (basil, oregano, thyme, rosemary, marjoram) to the beef mixture. Season with ground black pepper. Let it simmer for 15 minutes, until the sauce has thickened.
In a separate pan, sauté the spinach until wilted, about 5 minutes.
To assemble the lasagna, layer the bottom of a baking dish with slices of eggplant, followed by a layer of the beef and passata sauce, then a layer of sautéed spinach. Sprinkle with chopped parsley.
Repeat the layers until all components are used, finishing with a layer of eggplant slices on top.
Grate the Parmesan and mozzarella cheeses. Mix them together and sprinkle the cheese mixture over the top layer of eggplant.
Cover the baking dish with aluminium foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 20 minutes, or until the cheese is golden and bubbly.
Let it rest for 10 minutes before serving. Enjoy your Healthyfied Eggplant Lasagna hot.

schema.description: Indulge in the comforting flavors of this Healthyfied Eggplant Lasagna, a perfect fusion of high-protein, low-carb, and high-fiber ingredients designed to delight health-conscious gourmets. This reimagined classic keeps your nutritional goals in check without compromising on taste. A hearty ensemble of lean ground beef, fresh vegetables, and rich herbs, layered between succulent slices of eggplant and smothered in a duo of cheeses, makes each bite a wholesome delight. Welcome to your new favorite way to enjoy lasagna—where health meets taste, splendidly.

schema.name: Healthyfied Tuna In Citrus Soy Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the white onion and set aside.
Thoroughly rinse the frozen tuna cubes under cold water.
In a mixing bowl, coat the thawed tuna cubes evenly with cornstarch.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add tuna cubes and sear until golden brown on all sides, approximately 3-4 minutes. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the sliced onion and sauté until transparent and soft, about 2 minutes.
Mix water, low sodium soy sauce, ground black pepper, and salt in a bowl.
Pour the soy sauce mixture into the skillet with onions and bring to a simmer.
Return the seared tuna cubes to the skillet and cook in the citrus soy sauce until well-coated and heated through, about 3 minutes.
Squeeze calamansi juice over the tuna and stir to combine.

schema.description: Indulge in a high-protein, low-carb meal with our Healthyfied Tuna in Citrus Soy Sauce. This recipe cleverly combines the flavorful essence of low sodium soy sauce and the zest of calamansi, providing a heart-healthy option without sacrificing taste. Perfect for those watching their sugar intake but craving the satisfaction of a fulfilling indulgence.

schema.name: Healthyfied Red Cabbage Tamarind Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the red cabbage into thin strips.
Hard boil the eggs: place eggs in a saucepan, cover with water, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
After boiling, transfer the eggs to a bowl of cold water to cool, then peel and slice.
In a large bowl, combine the chopped red cabbage, sliced eggs, and tamarind puree. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil.
Toss everything together until the salad is evenly coated with the tamarind puree and olive oil. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

schema.description: Indulge in the vibrant and refreshing flavors of our Healthyfied Red Cabbage Tamarind Salad. This dish is a treasure trove of nutrition, perfect for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. It's designed to tantalize your taste buds while keeping your health in check. Experience the delightful blend of crunchy red cabbage, tangy tamarind, and rich, organic selenium eggs complemented by a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil. A true embodiment of healthful eating without compromising on taste!

schema.name: Healthyfied Tuna In Citrus Soy Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the white onion and set aside.
In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of water to create a slurry. Set aside.
Juice the calamondin to get the required amount of juice. Set aside.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the frozen tuna cubes to the skillet and cook until they are evenly browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the low sodium soy sauce, calamondin juice, the remaining water (6 fl oz), and salt. Bring to a simmer.
Add the cornstarch slurry to the skillet. Stir constantly until the sauce thickens, about 2-3 minutes.
Season with ground black pepper. Simmer for an additional 2 minutes to blend the flavors.

schema.description: Healthify your meals with this Healthyfied Tuna in Citrus Soy Sauce recipe. Rich in protein and low in carbs and sugar, it's an ideal choice for anyone looking to maintain a balanced diet without sacrificing flavor. This delicious recipe brings together the freshness of calamondin with the savory depth of low-sodium soy sauce, presenting a dish that exudes culinary sophistication while adhering to healthy eating principles. Perfect for the health-conscious food lover!

schema.name: Healthyfied Binakol

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: finely chop the garlic, slice the green onions, dice the white onion, slice the ginger, and shred the coconut meat.
In a large pot, combine the whole chicken, sliced ginger, chopped garlic, diced white onion, and lemon grass. Pour in the coconut water, and season with salt and black pepper.
Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 45 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked.
Add the shredded coconut meat and sliced green onions. Simmer for an additional 10 minutes.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Binakol recipe is your ticket to a delicious, low-carb, and low-sugar meal, featuring the savory combination of whole chicken with the tropical flavors of coconut. Ideal for those looking for healthy recipes without compromising taste.

schema.name: Healthyfied Instant Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the lettuce under cold water and let it dry.
Dice the tomatoes into small pieces.
Peel the sweet potato, dice it into cubes, and steam until tender, approximately 15 minutes.
In a large salad bowl, combine the rinsed lettuce, diced tomatoes, steamed sweet potato cubes, salad topper of your choice, and adobo.
Toss all the ingredients until they are evenly mixed and coated in the adobo for flavor, approximately 2 minutes.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Instant Salad is perfect for those who are looking for a high-protein, low-carb meal with the added benefits of being low-sugar and high-sodium. Ideal for anyone on a path to a healthier lifestyle and searching for delicious, healthy recipes.

schema.name: Healthyfied Pepper Chicken With Vegetables

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the mixed vegetables according to the package instructions (if frozen) or wash and chop fresh vegetables into small pieces.
Cut the cooked chicken breast into bite-sized pieces.
In a pan, melt the unsalted butter over medium heat.
Add the prepared vegetables to the pan and sauté for about 5 minutes.
Introduce the chicken pieces to the pan and sprinkle the ground black pepper over the chicken and vegetables. Stir well to combine.
Cook the mixture for an additional 10 minutes, until the vegetables are soft and the chicken is heated through.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Pepper Chicken With Vegetables recipe embodies a delectable blend of high-protein and low-carb ingredients, making it perfect for a nutritious meal. Enjoy the savory taste of tender chicken breast paired with an array of vegetables, all seasoned with a hint of black pepper for that extra kick. A low-sugar delight that stays true to healthy eating.

schema.name: Healthyfied Steamed Egg In Pork

recipeInstructions.text: Crack the 3 large eggs into a bowl.
Add 0.25 cup of pork broth to the eggs.
Season with 0.06 tsp of ground black pepper and 0.06 teaspoon of salt. Whisk everything together until well combined.
Pour the egg mixture through a fine strainer into another bowl to ensure a smooth consistency.
Cover the bowl with foil or a lid designed for steaming.
Fill a steamer pot with water and bring to a boil. Place the bowl inside the steamer, reduce heat to a gentle simmer, and steam for about 12 minutes.
After 12 minutes, check if the egg is set by gently shaking the bowl. If it wobbles slightly in the center, cover and steam for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Carefully remove the bowl from the steamer and let it cool for a minute before serving.

schema.description: Dive into a healthier version of a classic with our Healthyfied Steamed Egg in Pork recipe. Perfect for those following a high-protein, low-carb diet, this dish offers a delightful experience without compromising on taste. Embracing a 'healthified' approach to cooking, this recipe is designed to cater to the nutritious needs of individuals looking for healthy recipes that don't sacrifice flavor for benefits.

schema.name: Healthyfied Almond Vanilla Protein Shake

recipeInstructions.text: Measure and prepare all ingredients: 140 grams of unsweetened almond milk, 10 ounces of water, 1 teaspoon of monk fruit, and 2 scoops (approximately 50g) of Classic Plus Vanilla Protein.
Add almond milk, water, monk fruit, and vanilla protein into a blender.
Blend on high for about 1 minute or until the mixture is smooth.
Pour the protein shake into a glass and enjoy immediately for the best taste and consistency.

schema.description: Indulge in a refreshing and nutritious Healthyfied Almond Vanilla Protein Shake, perfectly catering to your high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar dietary preferences. This delectable blend, featured among our Healthy Recipes, is the ultimate choice for those seeking a healthful twist without compromising on taste.

schema.name: Healthyfied Fresh Mushroomsoup

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the button mushrooms, broccoli, cauliflower, red onion, and green capsicum under cold water.
Chop the button mushrooms, broccoli, cauliflower, red onion, and green capsicum into bite-sized pieces.
In a large pot, bring 3 cups of water to a boil.
Add the chopped vegetables and garlic (Spice World) to the boiling water, and simmer for 15 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Stir in the coconut cream powder, salt, and ground pepper, and continue to simmer for another 5 minutes.

schema.description: Indulge in a bowl of Healthyfied Fresh Mushroom Soup, perfect for those seeking a nutritious meal without compromising on taste. This delightful soup is not only low in sodium and high in fiber but also aligns with a health-conscious lifestyle. Packed with fresh mushrooms, broccoli, red onions, green capsicum, and cauliflower, and subtly enhanced with coconut cream and spices, it's a guilt-free indulgence for health aficionados.

schema.name: Healthyfied Chicken Curry

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. Finely chop the Curry Leaves Green, garlic, and red onion. Peel and dice the carrots. Cut the bell pepper into thin slices.
In a bowl, mix the chicken with paprika, turmeric, salt, and pepper, ensuring each piece is well coated.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat and sauté the garlic, red onion, carrots, and red bell pepper until they start to soften, about 5 minutes.
Add the seasoned chicken to the skillet and cook until all sides are golden brown, approximately 10 minutes.
Pour in the coconut cream and add the curry leaves. Stir well and cover the skillet. Simmer on low heat until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened, about 20 minutes.
Serve your Healthyfied Chicken Curry hot, accompanied by a side of your choice. Enjoy the nourishing flavors!

schema.description: Dive into the world of healthy eating with our Healthyfied Chicken Curry. Tailored for fitness enthusiasts, this high-protein, low-carb dish is perfect for those looking to maintain a balanced diet without compromising on taste. With a mix of aromatic spices and fresh ingredients, it's a wonderful addition to your collection of healthy recipes.

schema.name: Healthyfied Cajun Shrimp

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your vegetables by rinsing the mixed vegetables under cold water to thaw.
Peel and devein the shrimp, ensuring they're ready for cooking.
In a bowl, mix the tomato ketchup, salt, ground black pepper, basil, and Cajun seasoning. Stir until well combined.
Add the shrimp to the bowl and toss them in the seasoning mix until they are evenly coated.
Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add the seasoned shrimp. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add the mixed vegetables to the skillet with the shrimp. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes until the shrimp are pink and fully cooked and the vegetables are tender.

schema.description: Dive into the essence of Louisiana with this Healthified Cajun Shrimp recipe. Perfect for anyone following a low-carb, low-sugar diet, yet not compromising on flavor. Rich in spices and packed with vibrant mixed vegetables, this dish brings a nutritious twist to your table while catering to a health-conscious lifestyle.

schema.name: Healthyfied Mexican Ground Beef

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: Peel and mince the garlic, dice the capsicum green and red peppers, and finely chop the red onion.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef with salt, ground pepper, cumin, Spanish paprika, dried marjoram, oregano, and ground ginger. Mix thoroughly.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add the minced garlic and chopped onions, sautéing until they are soft and fragrant, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the seasoned ground beef to the skillet. Cook, breaking the meat apart with a spatula, until it is browned and cooked through, about 8-10 minutes.
Stir in the diced capsicum green and red peppers. Continue cooking for an additional 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Your Healthyfied Mexican Ground Beef is now ready to be enjoyed!

schema.description: Dive into the bold flavors of Mexico with this Healthyfied Mexican Ground Beef recipe! Designed for those seeking a high-protein and low-carb diet without sacrificing taste, this dish is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy the richness of Mexican cuisine in a healthier, low-sugar version. Infused with a blend of traditional spices, this recipe guarantees a delicious and satisfying meal, making it a must-try in your healthy recipe collection.

schema.name: AvoCoMangoBan Smoothie

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and slice the banana.
Scoop out the avocado flesh and chop the mango into chunks.
Add banana slices, avocado flesh, mango chunks, shredded coconut meat, water, whipped cream, and Stevia to a blender.
Blend on high speed until smooth, about 2 minutes.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

schema.description: Indulge in a refreshing and nutritious AvoCoMangoBan Smoothie, perfectly blending the creamy textures of avocado and banana with the tropical sweetness of mango and coconut. Ideal for those following a low-sodium, high-fiber diet, this healthified recipe promises not only a burst of flavors but also a boost of wellness. Satisfy your cravings while keeping it healthy!

schema.name: Salad Dressing - Garlic Mayo (500 ML)

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and finely mince the garlic cloves.
In a mixing bowl, combine the minced garlic with mayonnaise.
Add the vinegar to the mayo and garlic mixture and whisk until the vinegar is well incorporated and the mixture is smooth.
Transfer the garlic mayo to a container and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld together.

schema.description: This Garlic Mayo Salad Dressing recipe is perfect for those looking to add a flavorful twist to their salads without compromising on health. Although it is tagged as high-sodium and high-sugar, this version has been healthified to fit into healthy eating plans, making it a guilt-free addition to your meals.

schema.name: Sky-High Fiber Honey Toast
recipeIngredient: 4 slice (40g), Sugar Free 100% Whole Wheat Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a small bowl, beat the eggs thoroughly.
In another bowl, mix the rolled oats with the beaten eggs until well combined.
Lay the sugar-free whole wheat bread slices on a baking tray.
Spread the oats and egg mixture evenly over the bread slices.
Drizzle honey over each bread slice.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and slightly crisp.

schema.description: Indulge in a delightful and nutritious start to your day with our Sky-High Fiber Honey Toast! Perfect for those seeking a low-sugar yet delicious breakfast option, this recipe transforms classic ingredients into a healthy masterpiece. With rolled oats, sugar-free whole wheat bread, and the natural sweetness of honey, this toast is not just a treat to your taste buds but also a step towards a healthier lifestyle. Ideal for anyone embracing health-conscious dining without compromising on taste.

schema.name: Meal 2020-11-15

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the scallops and shrimp under cold water and pat them dry.
Boil the egg until hard-boiled, then cool, peel and slice.
Chop the lettuce, dice the onion, and slice the tomato.
In a pan, sear the scallops over medium-high heat until golden brown on each side, about 2 minutes per side.
In the same pan, cook the shrimp until they are pink and opaque, about 2-3 minutes.
Assemble the salad by placing the lettuce in a large bowl. Top with the cooked scallops, shrimp, sliced egg, diced onion, and tomato slices.
Toss gently to combine and serve immediately.

schema.description: Dive into a high-protein, low-carb meal with this exquisite scallop and shrimp salad. Perfect for those following a health-conscious diet without sacrificing flavor. Enjoy a mix of succulent scallops and tender shrimp atop a crisp bed of lettuce, complemented by fresh tomato and a hint of onion for a tantalizing dish that's both nutritious and delicious.

schema.name: Healthyfied Bolognese Sauce
recipeIngredient: 83.00 g, Red capsicum (nutritional info from veggycation)

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse and finely dice the red capsicum.
In a large pan, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned, about 10 minutes.
Add the diced red capsicum to the pan with the beef and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the Barilla alla bolognese sauce and simmer the mixture on low heat, allowing the flavors to meld, about 15 minutes.
Serve your Healthyfied Bolognese Sauce hot over your choice of pasta or zucchini noodles for an even lighter option.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Bolognese Sauce is a low-carb, low-sugar delight that does not compromise on flavor. Perfect for anyone following a healthy lifestyle, this recipe transforms the classic Bolognese into a nutritious meal without losing its hearty essence. A great addition to your collection of Healthy Recipes.

schema.name: Healthyfied Kimchi Bone Marrow Ramen

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: Thinly slice the Sukiyaki beef, chop the green cabbage, dice the bell pepper, mince the red onion and garlic, and grate the ginger.
Cook the noodles according to package instructions until al dente, then drain and set aside.
In a pan, melt the bone marrow over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic, ginger, and diced red onion to the pan and sauté for about 5 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in the chopped cabbage and diced bell pepper, cooking for an additional 5 minutes.
Add the thinly sliced Sukiyaki beef to the pan and cook for about 3-4 minutes until browned.
Mix in the kimchi, gochujang, and ground black pepper, and continue to cook for 5 minutes, allowing the flavours to meld together.
Add the cooked noodles to the pan, stirring well to ensure they are fully integrated and heated through, about 2 minutes.
Serve the ramen hot, garnished with additional kimchi if desired.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Kimchi Bone Marrow Ramen recipe perfectly blends the richness of bone marrow with the zest of kimchi in a low-carb and low-sugar delight. Ideal for those looking to enjoy a healthier version of this beloved dish, this recipe promises to be a satisfying addition to your healthy recipes collection.

schema.name: Three CheeseTuna Steak

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your grill or pan on medium-high heat.
Grate the mozzarella, Tillamook, and parmesan cheese. Set aside.
Season the sashimi tuna generously with ground black pepper.
Coat both sides of the tuna steak with virgin coconut oil.
Place the tuna steak on the grill or pan. Cook for 3 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or adjust the time depending on your preferred level of doneness.
In the last minute of cooking, evenly sprinkle the grated cheeses over the tuna steak, allowing them to melt.
Remove the tuna steak from the heat and let it rest for a couple of minutes.
Drizzle fresh squeezed lemon juice over the top before serving.

schema.description: This delightful Three Cheese Tuna Steak recipe is a perfect blend of high-protein and low-carb ingredients, designed for those looking to enjoy a healthy yet flavorful meal. With a mix of mozzarella, Tillamook, and parmesan cheese, complemented by the rich taste of sashimi tuna and seasoned with fresh lemon juice and black pepper, this dish is a testament to healthy eating without compromising on taste.

schema.name: Healthyfied Beef Yakiniku

recipeInstructions.text: Thinly slice the red onion and mince the garlic.
In a bowl, mix the beef brisket yakiniku with salt, ground pepper, and sesame oil.
Preheat a grill pan over medium-high heat.
Cook the beef brisket yakiniku for about 3-5 minutes on each side or until desired doneness. (cooking time: PT10M)
Remove the beef from the grill pan and let it rest.
In the same pan, add the sliced red onion and cook until soft and golden. (cooking time: PT5M)
Serve the beef yakiniku topped with cooked onions and a side of freshly minced garlic.

schema.description: Our Healthyfied Beef Yakiniku is perfect for those following a high-protein, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. This delicious recipe marries the savory taste of beef yakiniku with health-conscious ingredients, making it an ideal choice for anyone looking to enjoy a classic dish with a healthier twist. Dive into the world of healthy recipes without compromising on taste.

schema.name: Healthyfied Taragon Buttered Tuna

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: Soften the butter to room temperature, grind the pepper, and measure the garlic powder and dried tarragon.
Season the sashimi tuna evenly with the ground pepper and garlic powder.
In a pan, melt the unsalted butter over medium heat, then add the seasoned tuna to the pan.
Cook the tuna for about 2 minutes on each side for a medium-rare finish or adjust according to your preferred doneness.
Sprinkle the dried tarragon over the tuna in the last minute of cooking to infuse it with flavor.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Healthyfied Tarragon Buttered Tuna.

schema.description: Dive into a heart-healthy culinary adventure with this Healthyfied Tarragon Buttered Tuna. Perfect for those following a high-protein, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. This recipe brings together the richness of butter, the spicy hint of black pepper and garlic, and the unique aroma of tarragon to give you a flavorsome meal that doesn't skimp on your health goals. Ideal for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes without compromising on taste.

title: Sky High Fibre Creamy Toast Plain

schema.name: Sky-High Fibre Creamy Toast - Plain
recipeIngredient: 0.50 Cup ( 8 oz--250 ml ), Ice Cold Water

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk the large egg in a bowl until smooth.
Add milk powder and ice cold water to the egg and continue to whisk until the mixture is well combined.
Stir in the quick cook oats and sugar substitute into the mixture, ensuring everything is evenly distributed.
Preheat a non-stick skillet or pan over medium heat.
Soak each slice of whole wheat bread in the mixture, ensuring both sides are well coated.
Cook the soaked bread slices on the preheated skillet for about 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
Serve the creamy toast hot, ideally with a side of fresh fruits or a dollop of your favorite low-sugar jam for an extra burst of flavor.

schema.description: Enjoy a healthier start to your day with our Sky-High Fibre Creamy Toast - Plain, a masterpiece crafted for those who appreciate low-sugar, healthified recipes. This dish combines the wholesome goodness of whole wheat bread, oats, and protein from egg, creating a balanced and nutritious breakfast that keeps you fueled.

title: Seafood City Sauteed Scallops With Veggies

schema.name: Seafood City - Sauteed Scallops with Veggies

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the scallops under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
Cut the cauliflower into florets.
Peel and slice the carrots.
Chop the taiwan pechay into bite-sized pieces.
Mince the fresh garlic.
Heat a large pan over medium heat and sauté the garlic until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the cauliflower and carrots to the pan, season with salt and pepper, and cook for 5-7 minutes until slightly tender.
Increase the heat to medium-high and add the scallops to the pan, cooking for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown and cooked through.
Stir in the oyster sauce and add the taiwan pechay, cook for an additional 2 minutes until the greens wilt.

schema.description: Indulge in the taste of the ocean with 'Seafood City - Sauteed Scallops with Veggies', a dish perfect for those who love a high-protein, low-carb meal with the benefits of a healthy recipe. This dish balances the succulence of scallops with the crunch of fresh vegetables, all while keeping an eye on your health needs. It's a delectable way to keep your meals interesting and nutritious.

schema.name: Healthyfied Pork Nilaga
recipeIngredient: 300 g, Pork / Boston Butt, Raw (夾心肉, 生)

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Pork / Boston Butt under cold water.
Chop the green cabbage and dice the pumpkin into bite-sized pieces.
Mince the garlic and slice the onion.
In a large pot, bring the 2 liters of water to a boil.
Add the pork to the boiling water, reduce heat to medium, and simmer for 45 minutes or until the pork is tender.
Incorporate the garlic, onion, green cabbage, and pumpkin into the pot. Season with fish sauce, salt, and black pepper.
Continue to simmer for an additional 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Adjust the seasoning as needed, and serve hot.

schema.description: Indulge in the comforting flavors of our Healthyfied Pork Nilaga, a classic Filipino stew reimagined to fit a low-carb, low-sugar lifestyle without compromising on taste. This heartwarming dish, enriched with tender pork, vibrant green cabbage, and sweet pumpkin, offers a perfect balance of nutrition and flavor. Ideal for health-conscious individuals looking for high-sodium yet healthy recipes.

schema.name: Sky-High Fibre Toast - Banana
recipeIngredient: 0.25 Cup ( 8 oz--250 ml ), Ice Cold Water

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix together the sugar substitute, Quick Cook Oats, and Non-Fat milk until well blended.
Peel the banana and cut it into slices.
Fry the eggs to your liking, preferably using a non-stick pan to minimize the need for added fats.
Toast the whole wheat bread slices until they're golden and crispy.
Assemble the toast by spreading the oat mixture on the toasted bread, add a layer of fried egg and top with banana slices.
Drizzle ice cold water over the assembled toast for added freshness.

schema.description: Indulge in a delicious breakfast option with our Sky-High Fibre Toast - Banana recipe. It's a health-conscious choice that's low in sugar and high in nutrients, perfect for those looking to maintain a healthy lifestyle without sacrificing taste. This recipe transforms simple ingredients into a wholesome meal that's both satisfying and nutritious.

schema.name: 2018/11/06 Healthyfied Caulirice

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse 47.50 g of Adlai Rice (Job's Tears) under cold water until the water runs clear.
Chop 67 g of Capsicum Green and 200 g of Cauliflower into small pieces.
Mince 10.00 g of Garlic.
In a skillet, melt 2 tbsp of Butter over medium heat.
Add the minced Garlic to the skillet and sauté for about 1 minute or until fragrant. Cook Time: 1M

Add the chopped Capsicum Green and Cauliflower to the skillet, sprinkle with 0.25 teaspoon of Salt and 0.25 teaspoon of ground Pepper. Cook for about 7-10 minutes until the vegetables are tender. Cook Time: 10M
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions, then set aside.
Combine the cooked Adlai Rice with the sautéed vegetables. Mix well and adjust the seasoning if needed.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Caulirice recipe is perfect for those looking to enjoy a delicious, nutritious meal without the guilt. With its low-carb and low-sugar tags, it's ideal for a healthy lifestyle. Featuring a blend of flavors with Adlai Rice, Capsicum Green, Cauliflower, and a hint of garlic, this dish is not just healthy but also incredibly flavorful. Dive into the world of healthy recipes with this delightful dish.

schema.name: Healthyfied Mashed Unripe Plantain

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the unripe plantains and cut them into chunks.
In a pot, boil the plantain chunks until they become tender, about 20 minutes.
While the plantains are boiling, finely dice the red bell pepper.
Once the plantains are tender, drain the water and transfer the plantains to a large bowl.
Add the evaporated milk, salted butter, salt, and diced red bell pepper to the warm plantains.
Mash the mixture until smooth and well combined.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Mashed Unripe Plantain recipe is a delightful twist on traditional mashed recipes, tailor-made for those seeking low-sodium, healthy options. Perfect for anyone looking to enjoy healthier versions of their favorite dishes.

schema.name: Healthyfied Buttered Garlic Clam

recipeInstructions.text: Mince the garlic.
In a large pan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic to the pan and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant and golden, stirring often to prevent burning.
Add the clams and water to the garlic butter mixture. Increase the heat to high, cover the pan with a lid, and allow to cook for 5-7 minutes, until the clams open.
Once the clams are cooked and open, drizzle with lemon juice and gently mix in the grape juice for a slight sweet note.
Serve the clams hot, ensuring not to consume any that did not open.

schema.description: This Healthyfied Buttered Garlic Clam recipe is perfect for those seeking to make healthier choices without compromising on flavor. Featuring low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar ingredients, this recipe transforms a classic dish into a guilt-free pleasure. Dive into the succulent taste of hard shell clams, complemented by the richness of unsalted butter and the aromatic punch of garlic, all while maintaining a nutritious profile.

schema.name: Healthyfied Tofu Sisig with Egg

recipeInstructions.text: Start by dicing the red onion, red bell pepper, and leeks. Mince the garlic and chop the fresh green chilli.
In a non-stick skillet, crumble the firm tofu and cook over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes until browned. Set aside.
Using the same skillet, add a bit of coconut oil and sauté garlic, onion, bell pepper, green chilli, and leeks until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Return the tofu to the skillet. Add coconut amino, salt, and pepper. Stir well to combine all ingredients. Reduce heat to medium and let it cook for an additional 5 minutes.
In a separate pan, fry the eggs to your liking.
Serve the tofu sisig hot, topped with a fried egg on each serving. Enjoy your healthy meal!

schema.description: This Healthyfied Tofu Sisig with Egg recipe is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a classic Filipino dish with a healthy twist. Low-carb and low-sugar, it's a guilt-free option that doesn't compromise on flavor. Dive into this blend of fragrant spices, fresh veggies, and hearty tofu for a satisfying meal.

schema.name: Healthyfied Salt and Pepper Pork

recipeInstructions.text: Start by slicing the pork tenderloin into thin strips.
Finely mince the garlic and chop the green onions, setting them aside.
In a bowl, mix the salt and ground black pepper together.
