Serve the dish warm, garnished with a pinch of black pepper or fresh herbs if desired.

schema.description: This 2018/10/10 Dinner is perfect for those seeking a high-protein, high-fiber lifestyle. Engage in a delightful culinary experience with this healthified recipe, designed to keep you on track with your healthy diet goals while tantalizing your taste buds with its array of flavors.

schema.name: Baguio Pinikpikan

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: Clean the gizzard and chicken livers, separate the egg yolks, cut the free range chicken into serving pieces, and peel and chop the sorakaya (bottle gourd).
In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add the chicken pieces. Simmer for 20 minutes to cook the chicken thoroughly.
Add the gizzard and chicken livers to the pot and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Incorporate the chopped sorakaya into the mix and simmer until the vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes.
Carefully remove the pot from the heat, and gently stir in the egg yolks to thicken the broth, ensuring the mix does not come to a boil again.

schema.description: Indulge in the hearty and nutritious Baguio Pinikpikan - a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar dish that embodies the essence of healthy living. Perfectly tailored for those seeking delicious yet health-conscious options, this recipe transforms traditional ingredients into a modern masterpiece.

schema.name: Aug 31, 2019 Dinner

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: Dice the tomatoes and onion, mince the garlic, and cut the pumpkin into small, even pieces.
In a large pot, heat the virgin coconut oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and chopped onion, sautéing until they become translucent and fragrant.
Add the diced tomatoes to the pot and cook until they start to soften, about 5 minutes.
Introduce the pumpkin pieces to the pot, stirring to combine with the other ingredients. If necessary, add a little water to prevent sticking.
Season the mixture with salt and pepper according to your taste. Allow it to simmer until the pumpkin is tender, approximately 20 minutes.
Finally, stir in the Huhn Tepanyaki and tapas, cooking for an additional 10 minutes to ensure they're heated through and flavors have melded.

schema.description: A wholesome, heart-healthy meal perfect for a nourishing dinner, this recipe brings together the natural flavors of pumpkin, tomatoes, onions, and garlic, with the added depth of virgin coconut oil. Designed for those following a low-sodium, high-fiber diet, it's not only a feast for your tastebuds but a power-packed nutritious meal to keep you feeling great. Whether you're looking to maintain a healthy lifestyle or simply enjoy delicious, healthified recipes, this dinner option is bound to impress.

schema.name: 2019/02/05 Eggplant Omelette With Ground Beef

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the red onion, chop the young corn, dice the tomatoes, slice the eggplant into rounds, finely chop the parsley, ginger root, and garlic, and tear the fresh basil leaves, thyme, and rosemary for preparation.
In a large skillet, heat the extra virgin olive oil and butter over medium heat until the butter is melted.
Add the diced red onion and chopped young corn to the skillet and sauté for about 5 minutes or until the onion becomes translucent.
Add the ground beef to the skillet, breaking it apart with a spatula. Cook for about 10 minutes or until the beef is browned.

Incorporate the diced tomatoes, sliced eggplant, chopped parsley, ginger root, garlic, salt, pepper, dried marjoram, fresh thyme, and fresh rosemary into the skillet. Cook for another 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
While the beef mixture is cooking, beat the eggs in a bowl and set aside.
Once the beef mixture has cooked, pour the beaten eggs over it evenly. Allow the eggs to set and cook for about 5 minutes.
Garnish the omelette with fresh basil leaves before serving.

schema.description: This Eggplant Omelette With Ground Beef is a perfect combination of high-protein, low-carb, and high-fiber ingredients, making it an ideal choice for anyone looking for a healthy yet satisfying meal. Tailored to fit the Healthy Recipes and Healthified Recipes tags, this dish brings together the richness of ground beef and the lightness of eggplant in a unique blend that's sure to tantalize your taste buds.

schema.name: Ground Beef with Cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Rinse the Cherry Tomatoes under cold water and cut them in halves.
Cut the Cauliflower into small florets.
In a large skillet, melt the Butter over medium heat.
Add the Ground Beef to the skillet and cook until browned, about 10 minutes.
Add the cut Cauliflower to the skillet, cover, and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the Cherry Tomatoes, Creme Cheese Spread, Salt, Black Pepper, and Lemon Juice. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Gradually mix in the Milk to achieve a creamy texture.
Transfer the mixture into a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

schema.description: Indulge in a high-protein, low-carb delight with our Ground Beef with Cheese recipe. This healthy reinterpretation of classic comfort food is perfect for those pursuing a nutritious lifestyle without sacrificing flavor. Dive into the richness of ground beef, complemented by the creamy texture of cheese and the freshness of cherry tomatoes and lemon juice. A delight for anyone looking to enjoy Healthy Recipes while keeping their meals delicious and satisfying.

schema.name: Healthtyfied Kimchi Curry Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Mince the garlic and ginger, and chop the white onion.
Cut the beef tenderloin into thin strips.
In a large pot, heat a tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic, ginger, and chopped onion, sautéing until they are soft and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add the curry powder to the pot and stir well to combine with the sautéed ingredients, cook for 1 minute.
Increase the heat to medium-high and add the beef tenderloin strips. Cook until they are just browned, about 3-5 minutes.
Pour in the unsweetened coconut milk and add the red, sweet bell pepper. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to maintain the simmer for about 15 minutes.
Add the kimchi to the pot and continue to simmer for another 10 minutes.
In a separate pot, cook the noodles according to package instructions until tender, then drain.
Serve the curry soup over the cooked noodles.

schema.description: Indulge in the harmonious blend of flavors with our Healthtyfied Kimchi Curry Soup. This recipe is a perfect balance for those looking for a high-protein, low-carb, low-sugar, and high-fiber meal. Elevate your dining experience with a dish that not only promises a healthful journey but also embodies the essence of Healthyfied cooking.

schema.name: 2018/09/24 Lunch
recipeIngredient: 1 roll, Steamed Bean Curd Roll With Pork and Veg

recipeInstructions.text: Boil the egg to your preferred doneness, then peel and set aside.
Wash the grapes and tangerines, then set aside.
Season the lean ground pork with your choice of herbs and spices.
Cook the seasoned ground pork in a pan over medium heat for about 10 minutes, until fully cooked.
Prepare the steamed bean curd roll according to package instructions.
Wash the lettuce iceberg and chop it for the salad base.
Assemble the salad by placing the chopped lettuce on a plate, topping it with the cooked ground pork, and adding the steamed bean curd roll slices. Garnish with the salad topper.
Serve the prepared egg, grapes, and tangerines on the side to complete your nutritious lunch.

schema.description: This '2018/09/24 Lunch' recipe is a perfect blend of high-protein and low-sodium ingredients, making it an ideal choice for anyone looking to enjoy healthy, nutritious meals without compromising on taste. Featuring a combination of fresh fruits, lean ground pork, steamed bean curd roll, and crisp iceberg lettuce, this lunch is not only healthy but also delicious and satisfying.

schema.name: Beef Yakiniku Mackerel Meal
recipeIngredient: 0.50 large ear (7-9" long), White on the Cob
1 eggplant, peeled (yield from 1-1/4 lb), Eggplant, raw
0.50 head, large (about 5-1/2" dia), Cabbage, red, raw

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the vegetables: peel and slice the Daikon Root, husk and slice the White on the Cob, slice the raw Bellpeppers, peel and slice the eggplant, and slice the red cabbage and medium-size Zucchini.
Preheat a grill pan over medium heat and lightly grease it with Virgin Coconut Oil.
Grill the Yakiniku Beef Tips on the preheated pan, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through, about 10 minutes.

In a separate pan, melt the Butter - Salted over medium heat. Add the sliced vegetables (Daikon Root, Corn, Bellpeppers, Eggplant, Red Cabbage, and Zucchini) and sauté until they start to soften, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the Mushrooms, enoki, raw to the vegetables and continue to sauté until all vegetables are tender, about 3-4 minutes.
Grill the Fish, mackerel, Atlantic, raw fillets on the preheated grill pan until cooked through, about 5-6 minutes per side.
Assemble the meal by adding a serving of grilled Yakiniku Beef and Mackerel on a plate, accompanied by the colorful array of sautéed vegetables and Kabocha Squash on the side.

schema.description: This Beef Yakiniku Mackerel Meal is a delectable fusion dish that combines the flavors of rich beef yakiniku and savory mackerel, making it an excellent choice for those following a high-protein, low-carb, and high-fiber diet. Perfect for individuals seeking healthful yet delicious meal options, this recipe will delight your taste buds and support your well-being.

schema.name: 2018/09/24 Dinner

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by washing the grapes, tangerines, and tomatoes under cold water. Peel the bananas and tangerines. Set aside.
Thinly slice the cabbage, dice the white onion, and slice the tomatoes.
Prepare the Boston Butt Roast by cutting it into small cubes.
In a medium pot, bring water to a boil and carefully add the egg. Cook for 10 minutes for a hard-boiled egg.
In a separate pan, sauté the onions and Boston Butt Roast cubes until they are lightly browned, about 10 minutes.
Add the sliced cabbage and tomatoes to the pan, cooking until they're soft, approximately 5 minutes.
Prepare the mushroom soup according to the package instructions, then combine with the sautéed vegetables and meat in the pan. Let it simmer for another 5 minutes.
Peel the rambutans and add them to the dish, allowing them to warm through for about 2 minutes.
Serve the dish with the peeled banana, tangerines, and hard-boiled egg on the side.

schema.description: Dive into a wholesome meal that blends high-sugar, high-fiber ingredients with a healthified twist. This unique mix of fruits, vegetables, and proteins offers a nutritious adventure perfect for those looking to enjoy healthy recipes without sacrificing flavor.

schema.name: 2018/10/22 Broccoli Beef Bowl

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the vegetables by dicing the red onion, mincing the garlic, chopping the carrots into bite-size pieces, and cutting the broccoli into florets.
Heat a pan over medium heat, add the ground beef, and season with salt and pepper. Cook for about 10 minutes or until the beef is browned and cooked through.
Remove the beef from the pan and set aside. In the same pan, add a bit more oil if needed, then sauté the garlic and onion for about 3 minutes until softened.
Add the chopped carrots and broccoli florets to the pan. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender but still slightly crisp.
Return the beef to the pan. Drizzle in the honey and stir everything together. Cook for an additional 2 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
In a separate pan, fry the eggs to your desired doneness.
Serve the beef and vegetable mixture in bowls, topped with a fried egg. Enjoy your nutrient-packed Broccoli Beef Bowl!

schema.description: This Broccoli Beef Bowl is a nutritious delight, packed with high-protein and high-fiber ingredients to fuel your body. Perfect for those seeking healthy, revitalized eating options, this dish combines the savory goodness of ground beef with the fresh crunch of broccoli, carrots, and other fresh veggies. A wonderful addition to your healthy recipe collection.

schema.name: scrambled egg with bacon mushroom

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the bacon into small pieces. Slice the button mushrooms.
In a non-stick skillet over medium heat, cook the chopped bacon for about 5 minutes.
Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook with bacon for another 5 minutes until the mushrooms are soft.
Beat the eggs in a bowl. Add the shredded cheddar cheese to the beaten eggs and mix well.
Pour the egg and cheese mixture into the skillet with the bacon and mushrooms. Stir gently for about 3-4 minutes or until the eggs are fully cooked and scrambled.

schema.description: This scrambled egg with bacon mushroom recipe is perfect for those who are looking for a high-protein, low-carb meal. Being low in sugar yet high in sodium, it's a great option for individuals following a healthy diet, or anyone wanting to enjoy a 'healthified' version of a classic breakfast dish. Dive into a delicious start to your day with this satisfying combination of eggs, bacon, mushroom, and cheese.

schema.name: Dried Chicken Arrozcaldo

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the 300 gram of chicken thigh into cubes, peel and mince the 5.00 g of ginger root, and dice the 70.00 g of capsicum.
Rinse 190 g of Adlai Rice (Job's Tears) under cold water until the water runs clear.

In a large pot, bring 4 cups (8 fl oz) of water to a boil. Add the minced ginger, 2 tsp of ground ginger, and 0.25 tsp of black pepper. Let it simmer for 5 minutes to infuse the water with ginger flavor.
Add the cubed chicken thighs to the pot and simmer until they are fully cooked, approximately 20 minutes.
Add the rinsed Adlai Rice to the pot and let it simmer until the rice is tender and the porridge has thickened, about 30 minutes.
Halfway through the cooking, add the diced capsicum and 1 pcs of organic coco sugar into the pot. Stir well.
Season the arrozcaldo with additional black pepper according to taste. Serve hot and enjoy your healthy and comforting meal.

schema.description: Indulge in a comforting bowl of Dried Chicken Arrozcaldo, a healthy twist on the traditional Filipino porridge. Packed with high-protein chicken, enriched with the healing qualities of ginger, and made with Adlai rice for a low-sugar option, this recipe is perfect for those seeking a nutritious yet heartwarming meal. Perfect for anyone on a low-sodium diet, this healthified recipe brings warmth and wellness to your table.

schema.name: Tinolang tahong
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the mussels under cold water, scrubbing the shells to remove any dirt or debris.
Peel and chop the garlic and ginger root. Set aside.
Peel and slice the red onion. Set aside.
Peel the papaya, remove the seeds, and cut it into cubes. Set aside.
In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped garlic, ginger, and sliced onion. Sauté for about 5 minutes until softened.
Add the mussels to the pot and cook for 3-5 minutes until they start to open.
Add enough water to cover the mussels, then season with salt and ground black pepper. Bring to a boil.
Once boiling, add the cubed papayas and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the papaya is tender and the mussels are fully opened.
Discard any mussels that did not open. Adjust the seasoning if needed.
Serve hot and enjoy your nutritious Tinolang tahong.

schema.description: Tinolang tahong, a delightful and nutritious dish, is perfect for those who love a healthy meal with a high-protein, high-sodium, and high-fiber profile. This recipe promises not just a burst of flavors but also a wealth of health benefits, making it a perfect addition to your collection of Healthy Recipes and Healthified Recipes.

schema.name: Sweet Style Carrot Spaghetti

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by spiralizing 1 cup of carrots into noodles. Set aside.
Dice 0.75 cup of red onion.
In a pan over medium heat, cook 100 grams of beef until browned, approximately 10 minutes.
Add the diced red onion to the beef, and sauté until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Mix in 2 tablespoons of tomato & basil pasta sauce with the beef and onion, stir well, and let it simmer for 5 minutes.
Combine the beef mixture with the spiralized carrot noodles. Toss everything together until the noodles are evenly coated.
Serve the carrot spaghetti topped with 2 tablespoons of grated Parmesan cheese.

schema.description: This Sweet Style Carrot Spaghetti recipe is an excellent choice for those looking for a high-protein, high-fiber, and healthified meal option. It creatively incorporates spiralized carrot noodles, offering a fun twist on traditional pasta while also boosting your daily vegetable intake. Perfect for fitness enthusiasts or anyone seeking a healthier alternative to conventional spaghetti dishes.

schema.name: 2018/10/04 Lunch

recipeInstructions.text: Mince the Garlic and dice the Red Onion.
Slice the Eggplant into rounds and chop the Tomatoes.
Season the Tilapia Fillets with Salt, Black Pepper, and half of the Lemon juice.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a baking dish, layer the Eggplant rounds at the bottom, then place the seasoned Tilapia Fillets on top. Sprinkle with Garlic, Red Onion, and Tomatoes.
Drizzle the Coconut Amino, Coconut Vinegar, and the rest of the Lemon juice over the tilapia and vegetables.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
Remove the foil, sprinkle the Parmesan over the top, and bake for an additional 5 minutes or until the cheese is slightly golden and bubbly.
While the fish is cooking, heat Extra Virgin Olive Oil in a pan over medium heat and sauté the Belly until crispy, set aside.
Serve the baked tilapia and eggplant hot, topped with crispy belly bits.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthy feast with our 2018/10/04 Lunch recipe! Packed with high-protein and low-carb ingredients, this dish is perfect for those following a health-conscious diet without compromising on flavor. Discover how belly, tilapia fillets, and eggplant can come together in a beautiful harmony, accentuated with a splash of lemon juice and hints of garlic and Parmesan. An excellent choice for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes without the guilt.

schema.name: Steak with Asparagus Carrot Enoki

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: slice the beef Sukiyaki meat into thin strips, chop the red onion and parsley, thinly slice the carrot, and trim the ends off the enoki mushroom and asparagus spears.
Marinate the beef strips in cane vinegar for at least 15 minutes.
In a pan over medium heat, add the marinated beef strips and cook for 5 minutes until browned and almost cooked through. Set aside.
In the same pan, sauté the onions and carrots for about 3 minutes until they start to soften.
Add the steamable asparagus spears and enoki mushrooms to the pan, and cook for another 3 minutes, until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.
Return the cooked beef to the pan, add the chopped parsley, and toss everything together. Cook for an additional 2 minutes to reheat the beef and combine the flavors.
Serve the steak with the asparagus, carrot and enoki mushroom while hot. Enjoy your nutrient-packed, healthified meal.

schema.description: Savor the goodness of a high-protein, high-fiber dish with this Steak with Asparagus Carrot Enoki recipe. Perfect for anyone looking for healthy yet hearty options, this meal combines succulent beef with the fresh, clean flavors of asparagus, carrot, and enoki mushroom. Ideal for those on a healthy eating journey!

schema.name: 2018/10/04 Dinner Salmon and Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Prepare the ingredients: Grate the sharp cheddar cheese, finely chop the white onion and garlic, and trim the green string beans.
In a small bowl, mix 1 tsp of honey with 1 tbsp of organic soy sauce. This will be used to glaze the chicken and salmon.
Place the chicken breasts on one side of a baking dish, and the green string beans next to them.
Brush the honey and soy sauce mixture over the chicken.
In another baking dish, place the smoked salmon slices and sprinkle them with the grated sharp cheddar cheese.
Bake the chicken and green beans for 20 minutes.
Add the baking dish with the salmon to the oven and bake everything for an additional 10 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the beans are tender.
While the dishes are baking, sauté the chopped onion and garlic in a pan over medium heat until translucent.
Whisk the eggs in a bowl and then pour them into the pan with the onion and garlic. Cook the eggs, stirring frequently, until they are scrambled and fully cooked, about 8 minutes.
Serve the baked chicken and salmon alongside the scrambled eggs and sautéed green beans.

schema.description: This delicious dinner recipe featuring honey-glazed salmon and chicken is perfect for those looking for a high-protein, low-carb meal. The combination of smoked salmon slices, tender chicken, and green beans provides a satisfying dish that is also high in fiber. With a touch of sharp cheddar cheese and a mix of onion and garlic, it's a nutritious meal that doesn't sacrifice flavor for health. Perfect for anyone on a health-conscious diet craving something savory and fulfilling.

schema.name: Wagyu Cabbage Bowl

recipeInstructions.text: Crack the eggs into a bowl and set aside.
Slice the beef sukiyaki meat and burger meat into thin strips.
Dice the red onion, red pepper, and carrots. Shred the cabbage and slice the eggplant into thin rounds.
Mince the garlic.
In a large skillet, heat the extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic, diced onion, red pepper, and sauté until they begin to soften, about 5 minutes.
Add the carrot, cabbage, and eggplant to the skillet. Season with salt, pepper, marjoram, paprika, and basil. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.
Push the vegetables to the side of the skillet. Add the butter and allow it to melt. Add the beef strips and cook until they're browned and cooked through, about 8 minutes.
Pour the beaten eggs over the cooked vegetables and meat. Allow the eggs to cook without stirring, until they are set, about 2-3 minutes.
Gently stir to combine all the ingredients in the skillet. Serve the Wagyu Cabbage Bowl hot.

schema.description: This Wagyu Cabbage Bowl is a high-protein and high-fiber meal, perfect for anyone looking to enjoy healthy and delicious flavors. Made with tender Wagyu beef, fresh vegetables, and a blend of spices, it's a healthified recipe that doesn't skimp on taste. Ideal for health-conscious individuals seeking nourishing and satisfying dishes.

title: Cream Dory Okra Adlai With Cane Vinegar Okra Dip

schema.name: Cream Dory Okra Adlai with Cane Vinegar Okra Dip
recipeIngredient: 0.33 cup raw, Butternut Squash Raw Shredded

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the 율무 (Job's Tears) under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the 율무 (Job's Tears) according to package instructions until tender, then set aside.
Slice the okra pods and shred the butternut squash.
Chop the organic eggplant into small cubes.
Season the cream dory fillet with garlic juice and set aside for marination.
In a pan, lightly fry the cream dory fillet until golden brown and fully cooked, about 7 minutes.
In the same pan, sauté the okra, butternut squash, and eggplant until they're softened, about 5 minutes.
Combine the cooked 율무 (Job's Tears) with the sautéed vegetables and mix well.
For the dip, mix 1 Tbsp of cane vinegar with the juice of 3 cloves of garlic. Adjust the quantity as per taste.
Serve the Cream Dory and vegetable mix hot with the Cane Vinegar Okra Dip on the side.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthful delight with our Cream Dory Okra Adlai recipe, perfectly complemented by a Cane Vinegar Okra Dip. This dish is an innovative twist on Healthy Recipes and Healthified Recipes, aimed at those who are looking to enjoy high-sodium flavors in a more nutritious manner. A combination of creamy dory fish, crisp okra, and the nutty flavors of Adlai (Job's Tears), paired with a tangy cane vinegar dip, promises a delicious and wholesome meal.

schema.name: 2018/11/08 Dinner Mackerel

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Rinse the Mackerel (Saba Fish) under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
Place the Mackerel on a lightly greased baking tray.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.

schema.description: This '2018/11/08 Dinner Mackerel' recipe is perfect for those looking for a healthy meal option. It's high in protein and low in both carbs and sugar, making it an ideal choice for anyone wanting to maintain a balanced diet. Enjoy a delicious, healthified recipe that's sure to satisfy your taste buds without compromising on nutrition.

schema.name: 2018/10/11 Lunch Bangus and Broccoli Carrots

recipeInstructions.text: Prep your vegetables: Wash the broccoli and carrots under cold water. Chop the broccoli into florets and slice the carrots into thin rounds.
Season the vegetables: In a mixing bowl, combine the broccoli and carrot slices. Toss with 0.25 teaspoon salt and 0.25 teaspoon ground pepper until evenly coated.

Cook the vegetables: Melt 1 tablespoon of unsalted butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add the seasoned vegetables and sauté for about 5 minutes until they are tender but still crisp. Remove from pan and set aside.
Prepare the bangus: Rinse the milkfish under cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
Cook the bangus: In the same pan, add another tablespoon of butter if necessary. Place the milkfish in the pan and cook for about 4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve the dish: Arrange the sautéed vegetables on a plate and top with the cooked bangus. Serve immediately for a nutritious and delicious meal.

schema.description: This high-protein, low-carb, and high-fiber lunch recipe featuring bangus (milkfish) and broccoli carrots is perfect for those seeking nutritious, healthified meals. It's a fantastic choice for anyone looking to enjoy a healthy recipe that doesn't compromise on flavor.

schema.name: Globe Lunch

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven for the roasted chicken breast or reheat if already cooked.
Trim the ends off the string beans and wash them thoroughly.
Boil the corn on the cob in a large pot of water until tender, about 10 minutes.
In a pan, sauté the string beans with a little bit of olive oil until they are tender and vibrant green.
Peel and slice the banana just before serving to prevent it from browning.
Assemble the plate with a serving of roasted chicken breast, a portion of corn on the cob, sautéed string beans, and slices of fresh banana.

schema.description: The Globe Lunch is a nutritious, high-protein and high-fiber meal that epitomizes healthful eating. Combining roasted chicken breast with corn on the cob, ripe bananas, and sautéed string beans, this dish is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes that don't compromise on flavor.

schema.name: Sweet Garlic Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375°F.
Rinse the chicken thighs under cold water, then pat dry with paper towels.
Finely mince the garlic.
In a mixing bowl, combine the minced garlic, coconut sugar, salt, and ground black pepper.
Rub the garlic mixture evenly onto both sides of the chicken thighs.
Place the seasoned chicken thighs on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until the chicken is thoroughly cooked and has a golden brown exterior.
Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving.

schema.description: Indulge in a high-protein, low-carb meal with our Sweet Garlic Chicken recipe. Perfect for those seeking a healthy yet delicious twist on chicken, this recipe combines the robust flavors of garlic and coconut sugar with chicken thighs to create a dish that's not only nutritious but also rich in taste and perfect for health-conscious food lovers.

schema.name: 2018/10/16 Lunch

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your grill or pan over medium heat.
Wash the tomatoes and okra under cold water, then slice the tomatoes and cut the okra into half-inch pieces.
Beat the egg in a small bowl.
Prepare the tortang talong by dipping the sliced eggplant in the beaten egg, then frying it until golden brown on both sides.
Grill the marinated baby bangus until it is fully cooked, approximately 10 minutes each side.
In a small bowl, mix the coconut amino and coconut vinegar to make a simple dressing.
Serve the grilled bangus and tortang talong with fresh slices of tomato, okra, and a drizzle of the coconut dressing.

schema.description: This high-protein, low-sugar meal is perfect for those who want to enjoy a healthy and delicious lunch. Featuring marinated baby bangus, tortang talong, fresh tomatoes, okra, and a hint of coconut with the dressing, it's a meal that's both nourishing and full of flavor.

schema.name: Sweet and Sour Escabeche

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the raw fish under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
Slice the red onion, mince the garlic, and grate the ginger root.
Season the fish with salt and ground black pepper on both sides.
Heat a pan over medium heat and cook the fish until golden brown on each side, about 5-6 minutes per side.
Remove the fish from the pan and set aside. In the same pan, sauté the sliced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger until softened.
Add the spiced natural coconut vinegar and coconut sugar to the pan, stirring well to combine with the sautéed vegetables.
Return the fish to the pan, spooning the sauce over it to coat evenly. Let simmer for an additional 5 minutes, allowing the fish to absorb the flavors of the sauce.

schema.description: Indulge in a high-protein, low-carb treat with our Sweet and Sour Escabeche recipe. Tailored for health-conscious individuals, this dish blends the delightful flavors of spiced natural coconut vinegar and coconut sugar with fresh raw ingredients. It's a perfect example of a healthyfied dish that doesn't compromise on taste while adhering to dietary choices that favor low sugar and controlled sodium intake.

schema.name: 2018/12/05 Burger Lunch

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your grill or skillet over medium-high heat.
Prepare the vegetables: Peel and chop the carrots into thin slices; Trim the asparagus and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Season the burger with 0.25 tsp of salt.
Lightly brush the grill or skillet with 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
Place the burger on the grill or skillet, cooking for about 4 minutes per side or until it reaches the desired level of doneness.

While the burger cooks, add the chopped carrots and asparagus to a separate part of the grill or another skillet. Grill or sauté with a bit of olive oil until the vegetables are tender, about 6-8 minutes.
Serve the burger alongside the grilled carrots and asparagus.

schema.description: This low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar burger lunch is a healthy alternative for those looking to enjoy a classic dish without the guilt. Perfect for individuals following a health-conscious diet, this recipe combines the juicy, savory flavors of a traditional burger with the crisp freshness of carrots and asparagus, making it a delicious and nutritious meal option.

schema.name: 2018/09/23 Dinner
recipeIngredient: 0.25 pita, large (6-1/2" dia), Bread, pita, white, enriched

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 180°C (356°F) for the tilapia and smoked chicken breast.
Wash the okra under cold water, then cut into slices.
Prepare the Ginisang Pechay by chopping it finely.
Place the tilapia and smoked chicken breast on a baking sheet, season to taste, and bake for 20 minutes or until fully cooked.
While the meats are baking, lightly steam the sliced okra and chopped Ginisang Pechay for about 5 minutes.
Cut the pita bread into quarters and lightly toast.
Grate the cheddar cheese.
Assemble your plate by placing the baked tilapia and smoked chicken breast, steamed okra and Ginisang Pechay, toasted pita quarters, grated cheddar cheese, and sprinkle with the salad topper lite.

schema.description: This '2018/09/23 Dinner' recipe is perfect for those looking to enjoy a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar meal. Healthy and delicious, it fits wonderfully into diets aiming for nutritious yet satisfying options. Dive into this blend of flavors with okra, pechay, tilapia, smoked chicken breast, and more for a healthified dining experience.

schema.name: 02/06/2019 Beef sukiyaki Carrot Noodles

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the carrots by washing them thoroughly. Use a spiralizer to create carrot noodles.
Thinly slice the red onion and dice the garlic.
Trim the green beans and cut them into bite-sized pieces.
In a large pan, heat the extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and red onion, sautéing until fragrant and translucent, about 3 minutes.
Add the sukiyaki beef to the pan and cook until browned on all sides, approximately 5 minutes.

Incorporate the green beans and carrot noodles into the pan, seasoning with salt, pepper, marjoram, thyme, and oregano. Cook for an additional 7 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.

schema.description: This Beef Sukiyaki with Carrot Noodles recipe is a high-protein, low-carb dish that transforms traditional indulgence into a healthified masterpiece. Perfect for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes without sacrificing flavor, this dish marries the rich taste of sukiyaki beef with the freshness of carrot noodles and a bouquet of herbs.

schema.name: Garlic Soy Chicken Breast
recipeIngredient: 600 gram, Chicken breast, raw, with skin

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the ingredients: Finely chop the ginger and garlic cloves. Measure out all other ingredients as per the list.
In a small bowl, mix the low sodium soy sauce, coconut aminos, garlic granules, chopped ginger, and chopped garlic. Season with black pepper and salt to create the marinade.

Place the chicken breasts in a suitable marinating dish and pour the marinade over the chicken. Ensure each piece is well-coated. Add the bay leaves to the dish. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight, to marinate.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Transfer the marinated chicken breasts to a baking tray. Evenly distribute pieces of butter on top of each chicken breast.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes or until the chicken is thoroughly cooked and juices run clear.
Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving. Enjoy your delicious and healthy Garlic Soy Chicken Breast.

schema.description: Indulge in the savory and aromatic Garlic Soy Chicken Breast, a perfect dish for those who love high-protein and low-carb meals. Made with a delectable blend of spices, low sodium soy sauce, and coconut aminos, this recipe promises a tender and flavorful chicken breast that aligns with a healthy lifestyle. Perfect for anyone following a diet that appreciates the essence of quality ingredients without compromising on taste.

schema.name: Zucchini Carrot Tomato Pesto Pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Wash and prepare your vegetables: slice the zucchini into thin strips, peel and slice the carrot, chop the red onion, mince the garlic, dice the tomatoes, and slice the eggplant.
In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook pasta until al dente, about 8 minutes; drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, sautéing until they're soft and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add the sliced zucchini, carrot, and eggplant to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the diced tomatoes and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Add the cooked pasta to the skillet with the vegetable mixture. Toss everything together with your choice of pesto sauce until well combined. Heat through for a couple of minutes.

schema.description: This Zucchini Carrot Tomato Pesto Pasta is perfect for those who are looking for a low-sodium, high-fiber meal option. Not only is it packed with fresh vegetables like zucchini, carrots, tomatoes, and eggplant, but it's also a testament to how healthy recipes can still be incredibly delicious. It's a wonderful choice for anyone aiming to add more nutritious dishes to their repertoire without sacrificing taste.

schema.name: Honey Mustard Chicken Pomelo Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Season the chicken breast with salt and white pepper.
Grill the chicken breast until fully cooked and juicy, about 10-12 minutes on medium heat.
While the chicken is grilling, wash and chop the Ice Berg Lettuce and set aside.
Peel and segment the pomelo, ensuring to remove as much of the white pith as possible.
In a small bowl, mix the Mayonnaise Lite, Cream Cheese Wedge, and a dash of salt and pepper to create the honey mustard dressing.
Slice the grilled chicken breast into thin strips.
In a large salad bowl, combine the Ice Berg Lettuce, pomelo segments, All Bran, and sliced grilled chicken.
Drizzle the honey mustard dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.

schema.description: This Honey Mustard Chicken Pomelo Salad is a perfect blend of flavors and textures for those following a high-protein, high-sodium, and high-fiber diet. Ideal for anyone looking to enjoy healthy yet delicious meals, this salad combines the succulence of grilled chicken breast with the refreshing tartness of pomelo, all brought together with a creamy honey mustard dressing. It's a great addition to your healthy recipe collection!

title: Gusto! Sesame Soy Bowl All Green No Sauce

schema.name: Gusto! Sesame Soy Bowl All Green No Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the lettuce, carrots, and cucumber under cold water. Pat them dry with a paper towel.
Prepare the miso glazed sweet potatoes as per the instructions or until they are tender. Set them aside.
Hydrate the raw wakame seaweed in water for about 15 minutes, then drain and set aside.
Cook the lemon butter shrimp in a pan over medium heat for 5 minutes or until they are pink and cooked through.
Assemble the bowl by placing the green leaf lettuce at the bottom. Add the cooked sweet potatoes, raw carrots, cucumber, hydrated wakame, and cooked shrimp.
Sprinkle the black sesame seeds over the top of the bowl.

schema.description: Dive into the refreshing world of healthy eating with our Gusto! Sesame Soy Bowl All Green No Sauce. A perfect blend of high-fiber ingredients like green leaf lettuce, miso glazed sweet potatoes, raw carrots, cucumber, and wakame seaweed, topped with lemon butter shrimp and black sesame seeds. This bowl is not only a feast for the eyes but also a nutrient powerhouse designed for those who enjoy 'Healthyfied' and health-conscious recipes. Despite its high sodium content, this recipe remains a guilt-free pleasure that satisfies the craving for something savory and nutritious.

schema.name: Cafe France Bacon Potato Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and dice the potatoes into bite-sized pieces.
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and add the diced potatoes. Cook until tender, about 15 minutes.
While the potatoes are cooking, dice the carrots and cut the lean rasher into small pieces.
In a pan over medium heat, cook the lean rasher pieces until crispy, about 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, mix the cooked potatoes, crispy lean rasher, diced carrots, and chopped green leaf lettuce.
Season with salt and ground pepper to taste.
Add 2 tablespoons of mayo to the salad and gently toss to combine.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthier version of everyone's favorite side dish with this Café France Bacon Potato Salad. Crafted with the finest ingredients and tailored for a low-sugar diet, this recipe brings together the crispness of green leaf lettuce, the heartiness of potatoes, and the savory delight of lean bacon. A touch of mayo ties it all together into a dish that's perfect for those seeking health-conscious recipes without sacrificing flavor.

schema.name: 2018/11/28 Dinner

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 200°C (392°F).
Wash the broccoli, baby corn, tomatoes, and eggplant under cold water. Cut the broccoli into florets, slice the baby corn diagonally, dice the tomatoes, and cut the eggplant into cubes.
Season the vegetables and fresh salmon with salt, pepper, and Spice World according to taste.
Arrange the vegetables and salmon on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Ensure the salmon is placed skin-side down.
Roast in the preheated oven until the vegetables are tender and the salmon is cooked through, approximately 20 minutes.
Serve the roasted vegetables and salmon hot, seasoned with additional spices if desired.

schema.description: This healthy and delicious dinner is perfect for those looking for a nutritious meal that is high in protein, fiber, and essential nutrients, but also mindful of sodium levels. Tagged as both 'Healthyfied' and part of 'Healthy Recipes', it's an ideal choice for health-conscious individuals seeking flavorful 'Healthified Recipes'.

schema.name: 2018/10/05 Lunch
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground
1 tbsp(s), Seeds, sesame seeds, whole, dried

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the red onion, mince the garlic, and chop the green capsicum and cabbage. Set aside.
In a bowl, marinate the Yakiniku (Beef Tips) with salt, black pepper, and 2 tablespoons of tomato purée. Let it sit for 10 minutes.
Heat a pan over medium heat and cook the marinated beef tips for 5 minutes, or until browned. Set aside.
In the same pan, add a tablespoon of sesame oil and sauté the diced onion, minced garlic, and chopped capsicum for 5 minutes or until they are slightly softened.
Add the remaining tomato purée to the pan along with the chopped cabbage. Cook for another 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Return the cooked beef tips to the pan. Mix well to combine all the ingredients.
Serve the mixture hot, garnished with sesame seeds and drizzled with mayonnaise.

schema.description: This delicious 2018/10/05 Lunch recipe, featuring Yakiniku (Beef Tips) and a host of fresh vegetables, is perfect for those looking for a high-fiber, healthy meal option. Infused with tantalizing sauces and spices, this dish not only nourishes your body but also tantalizes your taste buds, making it a standout addition to your collection of healthified recipes.

schema.name: 2018/10/19 Dinner Chicken Paprika

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven for roasting baby potatoes at 200°C (400°F).
Wash the baby potatoes and cut them into halves. Place them on a baking tray, drizzle with a bit of oil and season with salt. Roast in the oven until golden and tender, about 25 minutes.
While the potatoes are roasting, dice the red onion, chop the capsicum (green and red), and slice the eggplant.
Crush the garlic and cut the chicken into bite-size pieces.
Melt the butter in a large pan over medium heat, add the garlic, onion, and chicken. Season with paprika and cumin. Cook until the chicken is browned and cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Add the capsicum and eggplant to the pan. Cook until the vegetables are soft, about 5-7 minutes.
Beat the eggs in a bowl, then pour over the chicken and vegetable mixture in the pan. Allow the egg to set slightly before stirring to combine everything, cook for another 3-4 minutes.
Sprinkle shredded Parmesan cheese over the top and let it melt into the hot chicken and vegetable mix.
Serve the chicken paprika hot with the roasted baby potatoes on the side.

schema.description: This high-protein, healthified dinner recipe featuring Chicken Paprika is perfect for those looking to enjoy a hearty, nutritious meal. Packed with rich spices like paprika and cumin, and loaded with vegetables such as capsicum, onion, and eggplant, this dish is not only flavorful but also contributes to a healthy diet. Topped with parmesan cheese and served alongside baby potatoes, it's a well-rounded meal that's sure to satisfy.

schema.name: Soy Chicken
recipeIngredient: 1 tbsp(s), Seeds, sesame seeds, whole, dried

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and mince the garlic and ginger root. Finely chop the red onion.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the coconut amino, minced garlic, minced ginger, and chopped red onion. Mix thoroughly.

Add the chicken thighs to the bowl and ensure they are well coated with the marinade. Cover and allow to marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, ideally for a few hours or overnight for deeper flavor.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Place the marinated chicken thighs on a baking tray lined with parchment paper, and sprinkle the sesame seeds evenly over the chicken.
Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.

schema.description: This Soy Chicken recipe is a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar delight that's perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a healthy yet delicious meal. Featuring skinless, boneless chicken thighs marinated in a savory mix of coconut amino, ginger, garlic, and sesame seeds, this dish promises a mouthwatering experience. It's an excellent choice for those who cherish healthy recipes without compromising on taste.

schema.name: 2018/12/09 Dinner

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: slice the carrots, cut the abalone, broccoli, red cabbage, raw cabbage, and capsicum green into bite-sized pieces.
Roast the pork roast in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 60 minutes or until fully cooked.
While the pork is roasting, bake the salmon steak in the oven at 350°F (175°C) for 20 to 25 minutes.
Steam the sliced carrots, broccoli, red and raw cabbage, and capsicum green until tender, approximately 10 minutes.
In a bowl, mix the roasted sesame dressing with thyme and rosemary.
Once everything is cooked, arrange the pork roast, baked salmon, steamed vegetables, and abalone on a plate.
Drizzle the mixed roasted sesame dressing over the dish before serving.

schema.description: This high-protein, low-carb dinner is perfect for those who are looking for a healthful meal option. Featuring a variety of nutritious ingredients such as abalone, carrots, pork roast, baked salmon steak, broccoli, cabbage, capsicum green, and flavored with roasted sesame dressing, thyme, and rosemary, it's a healthy recipe that doesn't skimp on taste or satisfaction.

schema.name: Globe Lunch 2

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the beef into small, bite-sized pieces.
Beat the eggs lightly in a bowl and set aside.
Cut the watermelon into small cubes, removing any seeds.
Cook the beef pieces in a pan over medium heat until browned and cooked through, about 10 minutes.
In a separate pan, scramble the eggs until fully cooked, about 5 minutes.
Serve the cooked beef and scrambled eggs together with the fresh watermelon cubes on the side.

schema.description: This Globe Lunch 2 recipe is a perfect match for those seeking a high-protein, low-carb, and healthy meal. Combining tender beef, hearty eggs, and refreshing watermelon, it's not just a treat to your taste buds but also a step towards a healthier lifestyle. Ideal for anyone looking to keep their meal times both nutritious and delicious!

schema.name: Salmon Bellpepper Wrap

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the red bell pepper and yellow bell pepper into thin strips.
Tear the iceberg lettuce leaves into smaller pieces that fit the size of the wraps.
Warm the wholemeal wraps in a dry pan over low heat for about 1 minute on each side to make them more pliable.
Flake the grilled salmon steak into bite-sized pieces.
Lay out the warmed wraps and evenly distribute the lettuce leaves across them.
Top the lettuce with the sliced bell peppers.
Distribute the flaked grilled salmon evenly over the bell peppers.
Carefully roll up the wraps, tucking in the edges as you go to secure the filling.
Serve the salmon bellpepper wraps immediately, or wrap them in foil to keep them fresh if serving later.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthful delight with our Salmon Bellpepper Wrap, perfectly tailored for those prioritizing low-sodium, low-sugar, and high-fiber meals. This recipe is part of our Healthified Recipes collection, aiming to provide delicious yet nutritious alternatives for your diet. Packed with the goodness of grilled salmon, vibrant bell peppers, and fresh iceberg lettuce, all wrapped in a hearty wholemeal wrap, it's a guilt-free option for a satisfying meal.

schema.name: Yellow Zucchini Pesto Past

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: cook the penne pasta according to package instructions; chop the broccoli, cauliflower, and yellow zucchini into bite-sized pieces.
Steam the broccoli and cauliflower for about 5 minutes, or until tender yet crisp.
In a skillet over medium heat, sauté the chopped yellow zucchini for about 7 minutes, or until it begins to soften.

Reduce the heat to low, add the cooked pasta, steamed broccoli, cauliflower, and pesto to the skillet with the zucchini. Cook for an additional 3 minutes, stirring until everything is well combined and heated through.
Stir in the cream cheese until the pasta is evenly coated and creamy.

schema.description: This Yellow Zucchini Pesto Pasta is a delight for those looking for a healthy, low-sugar yet high-fiber meal. Perfectly fitting within the realm of healthy recipes, this dish combines the goodness of vegetables with the rich, creamy texture of pesto and cream cheese to create a healthified version of your favorite pasta. Suitable for anyone aiming to maintain a balanced diet without compromising on taste.

schema.name: No Milk Chicken Sopas

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the chicken legs and thighs under cold water and pat dry.
Dice the cabbage and carrots, and mince the garlic.
Chop the red onion.
In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add the chicken legs and thighs. Cook for about 25 minutes until the chicken is fully cooked.
Remove the chicken from the pot and shred it into bite-sized pieces.
In the same pot, sauté the garlic and red onion until fragrant.
Add the diced cabbage and carrots to the pot and cook until they are softened.
Return the shredded chicken to the pot and add the Calendula noodles. Cook until the noodles are tender.
Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

schema.description: Indulge in a heartwarming bowl of No Milk Chicken Sopas. Perfect for those looking for a high-protein and healthier twist on traditional recipes. This nourishing soup, part of our Healthyfied collection, is sure to satisfy your craving for comfort food.

schema.name: Chicken Citrus Crabstick Pear Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 large egg (50 g), Egg, Large, Boiled

recipeInstructions.text: Shred the Iceberg lettuce, slice the seafood crabstick, dice the young baby corn, and cut the boiled chicken breast into small pieces.
Peel and segment the small orange, and chop the pear into bite-sized pieces.
Slice the boiled large egg into thin slices or wedges.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the lettuce, crabstick, baby corn, chicken, orange segments, and pear. Gently toss to mix.
Top the salad with egg slices and serve immediately.

schema.description: Dive into a high-protein, high-fiber delicacy with our Chicken Citrus Crabstick Pear Salad. Perfect for those looking to maintain a healthy lifestyle without sacrificing flavor. Each bite is a fusion of tender boiled chicken, crisp Iceberg lettuce, succulent seafood crabstick, and crunchy baby corn, all complemented by the freshness of orange and pear. Topped off with a boiled egg for an extra protein punch, this salad is not just a meal; it's a healthy, flavorful journey!

schema.name: 2018/10/26 Lunch Eggplant Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by washing and preparing your vegetables: slice the eggplant, red capsicum, green capsicum, tomatoes, red onion, and carrots. Shuck the ear of corn and remove the kernels. Mince the garlic.
Grill the eggplant, red and green capsicum, and corn kernels on a preheated grill until they are slightly charred, about 15 minutes.
In a pan, lightly sauté the minced garlic and sliced belly until the belly is crispy, about 5 minutes.
Combine all the grilled vegetables, crispy belly, and raw vegetables (carrots, red onion, tomatoes) in a large mixing bowl.
Toss the salad ingredients together until well combined. Season with your preferred dressing or spices according to taste.

schema.description: This high-fiber, healthified version of an Eggplant Salad is perfect for those looking for healthy recipes to add to their diet. Packed with nutritious vegetables like eggplant, capsicum, tomatoes, red onion, corn, garlic, and carrots, and enriched with belly for added flavor, it's a salad that doesn't skimp on taste while being wonderfully beneficial for your health.

schema.name: Dory Blossom Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the romaine, medium carrot, tomatoes, and extra firm tofu into bite-sized pieces.
Dice the cucumber, yellow and green bell peppers.
Peel and dice the dragonfruit. Set aside to be used in the salad dressing.
Season the cream dory fillet with a pinch of salt and pepper.
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the cream dory fillet for 4 minutes on each side or until golden brown and cooked through. Allow it to cool, then flake into pieces.
In a small bowl, mix the yogurt, cane vinegar, and minced fresh garlic to prepare the dressing. Mash half of the diced dragonfruit and blend it into the dressing for a sweet and tangy flavor.
In a large bowl, combine the chopped and diced vegetables, flaked dory, and the remaining diced dragonfruit. Toss gently.
Drizzle the dragonfruit yogurt dressing over the salad and toss well to coat all the ingredients.

schema.description: This Dory Blossom Salad is a perfect blend for those seeking a healthy yet flavorful meal. Packed with high-protein ingredients and carefully selected vegetables, it's a delicious way to enjoy a meal that's both nutritious and satisfying. Featuring cream dory, colorful peppers, and a unique dragonfruit dressing, this salad is ideal for those following a health-conscious lifestyle.

schema.name: Cream dory Bellpepper Basil

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Crack the eggs into a bowl and beat them lightly.
Grate the sharp cheddar cheese and set aside.
Rinse the Pangasius fillet under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
Chop the fresh basil leaves finely.
In a mixing bowl, combine the beaten eggs, grated cheese, and chopped basil. Mix well.
Lay the Pangasius fillets in a baking dish and cover them with the egg-cheese-basil mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the fillets are cooked through and the topping is golden brown.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthy and flavorful journey with our Cream dory Bellpepper Basil recipe. Perfect for those following a high-protein, low-carb diet without compromising on taste. This dish is crafted with succulent Pangasius fillet, enriched with the aromatic presence of fresh basil leaves, and complemented with a sharp cheddar cheese topping, making it a hearty yet healthy choice.

schema.name: Cream dory Bellpepper Basil

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk until fully beaten.
Grate the Sharp Cheddar Cheese.
Season the Pangasius fillet with salt and pepper to taste.
Chop the fresh basil leaves finely.
Place the Pangasius fillets in a baking dish.
Pour the beaten eggs over the fillets, ensuring they are well covered.
Sprinkle the grated cheddar cheese on top of the egg-covered fillets.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the cheese is golden brown.
Garnish with freshly chopped basil leaves before serving.

schema.description: This Cream dory Bellpepper Basil recipe is perfect for those seeking a high-protein, low-carb meal. It's healthy, with a focus on fresh flavors from basil and bell pepper, making it a great choice for anyone looking to enjoy a healthful and delicious meal.

schema.name: Ground Beef with Green Beans

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the ingredients: Dice the red, sweet onion, mince the garlic cloves, and cut the green beans into bite-sized pieces.
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the ground pork for about 10 minutes or until browned. Drain excess fat and set aside.
In the same skillet, add a tablespoon of oil if needed, and sauté the diced onion and minced garlic until they're soft and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add the cut green beans to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes until they are tender yet crisp.
Return the cooked ground pork to the skillet. Stir in the oyster sauce, salt, and ground black pepper, cooking for an additional 5 minutes to let the flavors meld.

schema.description: This Ground Beef with Green Beans recipe is perfect for those seeking a healthy, high-protein, and low-carb meal. Ideal for anyone looking to enjoy a nutritious dish without sacrificing flavor, this recipe combines the savory taste of ground beef with the crisp freshness of green beans, all seasoned with the rich depth of oyster sauce and the aromatic sharpness of garlic and onions. Whether you're aiming for a healthier lifestyle or just want to explore new healthy recipes, this dish is sure to delight.

schema.name: Orange “Soy” Salmon

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Rinse the salmon tail under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
Peel the oranges and segment them over a bowl to catch the juice. Squeeze the remaining membrane to extract all the juice.
In a small bowl, mix the coconut aminos with half of the orange juice.
Place the salmon tail in a baking dish and pour the coconut aminos and orange juice mixture over it, ensuring it's well-coated.
Bake in the preheated oven until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork, about 20-25 minutes.
Serve the salmon with the remaining orange segments and drizzle with the sauce from the baking dish.

schema.description: Indulge in a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sodium meal with our Orange “Soy” Salmon. A perfect combination of juicy oranges and savory salmon, tailored for those who enjoy healthy yet flavorful recipes. This dish is a testament to how health-conscious choices do not have to compromise on taste, making it a must-try for anyone looking to enhance their culinary repertoire with healthier options.

title: Honey Garlic Beef Yakiniku With Carrot Pasta

schema.name: Honey Garlic Beef Yakiniku with Carrot Pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and mince the garlic.
Peel and spiralize the carrots into noodle shapes.
Season the beef brisket yakiniku with the minced garlic and black pepper.
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the seasoned beef for about 10 minutes until browned and cooked through.
Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the spiralized carrot pasta and cook for about 5-7 minutes until tender but still firm to the bite.
Return the beef to the skillet with the carrot pasta. Sprinkle with coco sugar and drizzle with honey. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring to combine all the flavors.

schema.description: This Honey Garlic Beef Yakiniku with Carrot Pasta recipe is a health-conscious delight, tailored for those seeking high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar options. It's part of our Healthy Recipes collection, designed to provide nutritious yet delicious meals. Ideal for anyone looking to enjoy a savory and healthful dish.

schema.name: Beef with mushroom

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the ingredients: Thinly slice the beef sukiyaki meat if not already sliced. Finely chop the garlic and red onion. Rinse the water cress and button mushrooms.
Season the beef slices with salt, black pepper, and lemon juice. Let them marinate for 10 minutes.
In a pan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the garlic and red onion to the pan and sauté until they are soft and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Increase the heat to high, add the marinated beef slices to the pan and cook until they are browned on each side, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Add the button mushrooms to the pan and cook until they are soft, about 4 minutes.
Once the mushrooms are cooked, add the water cress and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Serve the beef and mushrooms hot, optionally with ginisang pechay on the side.

schema.description: Indulge in this high-protein, low-carb Beef with Mushroom recipe that's perfect for those looking to enjoy a healthy but flavorful meal. Packed with succulent beef sukiyaki meat and juicy button mushrooms, this dish is a delicious way to maintain a healthy diet without compromising on taste. Ideal for anyone seeking healthified recipes that are low in sugar and high in satisfaction.

schema.name: Chicken Corn Citrus Salad
recipeIngredient: 0.67 large egg (50 g), Egg, Large, Boiled

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the Ice Berg Lettuce and Fresh, Raw, Baby leaves thoroughly under cold water.
Boil the egg until hard-boiled, approximately 9 minutes, then set aside to cool.
Boil the chicken breast until fully cooked, about 20 minutes, then allow it to cool before shredding.
Drain the Whole Kernel Corn and set aside.
Cut the Baby Corn into bite-sized pieces.
Peel and segment the small orange.
Slice the boiled egg.

In a large bowl, combine the Ice Berg Lettuce, Fresh, Raw, Baby leaves, Young Baby Corn, sliced egg, shredded chicken breast, orange segments, Whole Kernel Corn, and All-Bran Regular. Toss gently to combine.

schema.description: Dive into a blend of nutrition and taste with our Chicken Corn Citrus Salad. This dish is a vibrant mix of fresh ingredients and bold flavors, specially curated for those seeking a high-protein, high-sodium, and high-fiber meal. Perfect for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes without compromising on taste, this salad is sure to enhance your dining experience with its delightful combination of textures and ingredients.

title: Potato Pasto With Garlic Tomato Spinach Sauce

schema.name: Potato Pasto with Garlic Tomato Spinach Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by peeling and dicing the potato into small cubes.
Dice the tomatoes, and carrot into small pieces and set aside.
Thinly slice the 12 cloves of garlic and set aside.
Cut the eggplant into small cubes.
In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add the diced potato. Cook for about 5 minutes until tender but still firm.
In a skillet over medium heat, add the extra virgin olive oil and sauté the sliced garlic until golden brown.
Add the tomatoes and carrot to the skillet and cook until they begin to soften, about 5 minutes.
Add the eggplant to the skillet and continue to cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Stir in the fresh spinach leaves and cook until they wilt, about 2 minutes.
Combine the sautéed vegetables with the boiled potatoes in a large serving bowl and toss well.

schema.description: Dive into a plate of Potato Pasta with Garlic Tomato Spinach Sauce, a perfect blend of high-fiber and nutritious ingredients designed to suit your healthy lifestyle. With fresh spinach, ripe tomatoes, crunchy carrots, and a hint of garlic, this dish is not just good for you but also packed with flavors that will delight your taste buds.

schema.name: Ginataang Tambakol (Yellow Fin tuna)

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the ingredients: thinly slice the Red Onion, mince the Ginger and Garlic, cut the Bellpepper into strips.
In a large pot, mix the Coconut Cream Powder with 200ml of warm water to create coconut cream. Stir until well combined.
Add the sliced Red Onion, minced Ginger, and Garlic to the pot. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes to soften.
Gently add the Yellow Fin Tuna to the pot. Season with Salt and Pepper. Let it simmer for 10 minutes.
Finally, add the Bellpepper strips to the pot. Cover and let it cook for an additional 5 minutes.

schema.description: Indulge in the flavors of Ginataang Tambakol (Yellow Fin Tuna), a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar delight designed for lovers of healthy recipes. This dish, a part of our Healthified Recipes collection, merges the richness of coconut cream with the tenderness of Yellow Fin Tuna, enhanced with the subtle heat of peppers and the aromatic blend of ginger, garlic, and onions, making it a perfect choice for those monitoring their sodium intake without compromising on taste.

schema.name: Mixed Cucumber Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and thinly slice the cucumber.
Peel the mango and cut it into small cubes.
Julienne the baby carrots.
Chop the hard-boiled egg into small pieces.
Cut the imitation crab into bite-size pieces.
Chop the almonds coarsely.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the sliced cucumber, cubed mango, julienned carrots, chopped egg, imitation crab, and almonds.
Toss the ingredients gently to ensure they are well mixed. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

schema.description: This Mixed Cucumber Salad is not only a high-fiber, healthy choice but also caters to those looking for healthified recipes with a touch of indulgence. Perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a nutritious, yet delicious, meal.

title: High Protein Seafood Salad Without Sauce

schema.name: High Protein Seafood Salad without Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by boiling the egg. Place the egg in a saucepan, cover with water, and bring to a boil. Once boiling, lower the heat to a simmer and cook for 9 minutes for a hard-boiled egg. Remove from heat, cool in cold water, and then peel.
Drain the tuna fillet from the can, ensuring to remove as much water as possible.
Prepare the crab sticks by slicing them into bite-sized pieces.
Wash the Ice Berg Lettuce thoroughly, then chop it into bite-sized pieces to form the salad base.
In a large salad bowl, combine the boiled egg (sliced or chopped), crab stick pieces, drained tuna fillet, and Ice Berg Lettuce.
Sprinkle the All-Bran Regular over the salad for an added crunchy texture.

schema.description: Dive into a refreshing and nutritious meal with our High Protein Seafood Salad. Perfect for those seeking a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar option, this salad combines flavorful seafood with crisp Ice Berg Lettuce and fiber-rich All-Bran for a deliciously healthified meal.

schema.name: Chicken Adlai Arrozcaldo

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Dice the carrots, mince the ginger root, and finely chop the red onion.
Cut the chicken thigh into bite-size pieces.
In a large pot, combine 4 cups of water, the ginger, and the chicken pieces. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to simmer for 20 minutes.
Add the rinsed Adlai Rice to the pot and continue simmering for 30 minutes, or until the rice is fully cooked and has absorbed most of the liquid.
Stir in the diced carrots, chopped red onions, garlic powder, and ground pepper. Cook for another 10 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.

schema.description: Indulge in a nourishing bowl of Chicken Adlai Arrozcaldo, a healthified twist on the classic Filipino comfort food. Perfect for those seeking high-protein, low-sodium, and low-sugar meal options, this arrozcaldo promises to warm your soul without compromising on health.

schema.name: 2018/11/12Dinner Grapes and beef

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse 50g of grapes under cold water and set aside.
Prep the 15.00g of Ginisang Pechay by washing and chopping it into bite-size pieces.
Prepare 2.47 ounces of Beef Ground Mexican (Bison) by breaking it into smaller chunks for even cooking.
Rinse and drain 56.50 grams of Mixed Chinese Vegetables.
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef for 10 minutes or until browned and cooked through.
Add the mixed Chinese vegetables and ginisang pechay to the skillet, cooking for an additional 5 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Gently toss in the grapes, cooking for an additional 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve hot and enjoy a nutritious, healthified dinner.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthy and delectable low-carb dinner with our 'Grapes and Beef' recipe. Specially designed for those looking for high-sodium, healthified recipes, this dish combines the freshness of grapes with the rich flavor of ground beef and mixed Chinese vegetables. Perfect for those pursuing a balanced and nutritious eating plan.

schema.name: 2018/10/19 Lunch Pancit

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the okra, cabbage, and carrots under cold water. Slice the okra, shred the cabbage, and julienne the carrots.
Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Cook the instant vegetable noodles according to package instructions until tender, then drain and set aside. (Cook time: PT10M)
In a pan over medium heat, cook the chicken pieces until no longer pink and fully cooked through. (Cook time: PT10M)
Add the prepared okra, cabbage, and carrots to the pan with the chicken. Stir well and cook until the vegetables are tender but still crisp. (Cook time: PT5M)
Mix in the cooked instant noodles with the vegetable and chicken mixture. Stir well to combine.
Squeeze the calamansi over the pancit and add the coconut amino. Stir well to ensure everything is evenly coated.

schema.description: This '2018/10/19 Lunch Pancit' recipe is tailored for those looking for a high-protein, healthy meal option without compromising on taste. Perfectly blending the nutritious goodness of okra, cabbage, carrots, and chicken with the delightful flavors of instant vegetable noodles, coconut amino, and a splash of calamansi, this dish is a healthified twist on the classic Pancit. Whether you're aiming to maintain a balanced diet or simply in search of a deliciously healthy recipe, this dish promises to satisfy your cravings while nourishing your body.

schema.name: 2018/10/09 Dinner Vegetables (Meat is Chicken Tomato)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Rinse the cauliflower and broccoli under cold water, then chop them into bite-sized florets.
Dice the red, yellow, and green capsicum.
In a large bowl, whisk the eggs and season with salt.
Grease a baking dish with butter, then add the chopped vegetables. Pour the whisked eggs over the vegetables evenly.
Sprinkle the dried thyme leaves over the top.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the eggs are set and the vegetables are tender.

schema.description: This delicious dinner is perfect for those on a low-carb, high-fiber diet. Featuring vegetables like cauliflower, broccoli, and colorful bell peppers, and enriched with the protein from eggs, and the unique flavor of thyme, this meal is 'healthyfied' to keep you satisfied in the healthiest way possible.

schema.name: Beef Spaghetti Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Finely dice the red onion, capsicum (green and red), and set aside.
Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the diced onions and capsicum to the skillet and sauté until they are soft, about 5 minutes.
Increase the heat to medium-high and add the ground beef to the skillet, cooking until browned, about 8 minutes.
Mix in the tomato puree, salt, ground pepper, thyme, basil, and marjoram. Reduce heat to low and let simmer for 15 minutes to allow flavors to blend.

schema.description: This Beef Spaghetti Sauce is a perfect blend for those looking for a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar option to add to their healthy recipe collection. Infused with the fresh herbal notes of thyme, basil, and marjoram, and richly seasoned with salt and pepper, this sauce promises a robust flavor that enhances any pasta dish.

schema.name: Sweet potato Pimento

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and cut the sweet potato into cubes.
Dice the red capsicum.
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
In a mixing bowl, combine sweet potato cubes, diced red capsicum, and unsalted butter.
Transfer the mixture to a baking tray and bake for 25 minutes or until the sweet potatoes are tender.
Remove from the oven and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving.

schema.description: This high-fiber, healthified Sweet Potato Pimento dish is a perfect example of a healthy recipe that doesn't compromise on taste. Packed with the goodness of sweet potatoes, enhanced with the flavor of red capsicum, and a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese, this dish is bound to be a delightful addition to your meal plan.

schema.name: Beef Carrot Sweet Ginger

recipeInstructions.text: Prep your vegetables: dice the red onion, capsicum, and carrots, and mince the ginger root.
Preheat a skillet over medium heat and add the extra virgin olive oil.
Add the diced red onion and minced ginger to the skillet and sauté for about 3 minutes, until the onion is translucent.
Increase the heat to medium-high, add the ground beef to the skillet, and cook for about 5 minutes, breaking it apart with a spoon until it's browned.
Add the diced carrots and capsicum to the skillet, stirring to integrate. Let the mixture cook for another 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Season the mixture with salt, sugar, and ground pepper. Mix well to ensure the seasonings are evenly distributed.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and let the mixture simmer for 5 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Remove the skillet from heat and let the Beef Carrot Sweet Ginger mixture cool slightly before serving. Enjoy your healthy and flavorful dish!

schema.description: Dive into the world of healthy eating with this Beef Carrot Sweet Ginger recipe. Perfect for those following a low-carb diet but not missing out on flavor, this dish is a testament to healthy yet delicious meals. With tender ground beef, sweet carrots, and a zing of ginger, each bite is a mix of satisfying textures and flavors, making it a great addition to your collection of healthified recipes.

schema.name: Sunday camachile
recipeIngredient: 0.50 cup, chopped, Sweet potato leaves, raw

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Manila Tamarind, tomatoes, carrots, asparagus, and potato under cold water.
Soak the Filipino-Dried Mackerel in water for 10 minutes to rehydrate.
Dice the tomatoes, carrots and potato. Cut the asparagus into 1-inch pieces.
Cook the Rib Roast in a pan over medium heat for about 10 minutes until browned and tender. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add the rehydrated Mackerel, diced vegetables, and Manila Tamarind. Cook for 7 minutes.
Add the fresh Lumpia and Vegetable Kare-kare mix to the pan. Combine thoroughly and cook for another 5 minutes.
Lastly, stir in the sweet potato leaves and cook until just wilted, about 2 minutes.

schema.description: Delve into the heart of healthy Filipino cuisine with our Sunday camachile recipe. This dish is marvelously low-sodium and low-sugar, combining the unique flavors of Manila Tamarind with a medley of fresh vegetables and fish. Perfect for those looking to enjoy traditional flavors while keeping their meals nutritious and health-friendly. This recipe is a tribute to healthy eating without compromising on taste, making it a perfect addition to your collection of healthy recipes.

schema.name: 2018/10/16 Adlai Carrot Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold running water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice in a pot of boiling water with a pinch of salt. Follow the package instructions for the cooking time, then set aside.
Peel and dice the carrots into small pieces.
Peel and mince the garlic.
In a pan over medium heat, sauté the minced garlic until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Add the diced carrots to the pan and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Combine the cooked Adlai Rice with the sautéed carrots and garlic. Stir well and season with salt to taste.

schema.description: This wholesome Adlai Carrot Rice is perfect for health-conscious individuals looking for a low-sodium and low-sugar meal. A healthy twist on your regular rice dish that doesn't skimp on flavor. Ideal for those seeking delicious and nutritious diet-friendly recipes.

schema.name: Crunchy Seafood Red Salad
recipeIngredient: 3 sticks (86 g), Ichiban Alaskan Crab Flavored
0.50 fruit 2-1/4" high x 2-1/2" dia, Pears, asian, raw

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the red cabbage, and drain the young corn.
Cut the Asian pear and apple into thin slices.
Open the can of tuna and drain the water.
Slice the Alaskan crab flavored sticks into small pieces.
In a large bowl, gently mix the chopped cabbage, drained young corn, sliced pear and apple, drained tuna, and chopped crab sticks until well combined.
Chill in the refrigerator for about 15 minutes before serving to let the flavors blend.

schema.description: This Crunchy Seafood Red Salad blends the delicious flavors of the ocean with the freshness of raw vegetables and fruits, making it a perfect dish for those seeking high-protein, high-fiber, and health-conscious recipes. Dive into a bowl of goodness that brings together the best of both worlds.

schema.name: Tuna Sashimi Dinner

recipeInstructions.text: Ensure the Sashimi Tuna is fresh and of sushi-grade quality.
Place the tuna in the freezer for about an hour to make slicing easier.
Remove the tuna from the freezer and, using a sharp knife, slice it into thin slices, about 1/8 inch thick.
Arrange the tuna slices neatly on a serving plate.
Optionally, garnish with microgreens or a light drizzle of soy sauce and wasabi on the side for those who enjoy a bit of spice.

schema.description: This Tuna Sashimi Dinner recipe is perfect for those who are looking for a healthy meal that is high in protein and low in carbs, sodium, and sugar. It's an ideal option for anyone dedicated to maintaining a nutritious diet without sacrificing flavor.

schema.name: 2018/11/11 Lunch

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the ingredients: dice the melon, cut the mango into chunks, and set aside.
Cook the pork nilaga according to your favorite recipe or simply boil until tender, about 45 minutes.
Simultaneously, boil the chicken livers for about 10 minutes until fully cooked, then set aside to cool before cutting into small pieces.
Combine the cooked pork nilaga, diced melons, mango chunks, and chicken livers in a bowl. Toss gently to mix.

schema.description: This low-sodium and healthy recipe makes a perfect lunch for those looking to enjoy a nutritious meal. Comprising pork nilaga, fresh diced cantaloupe, juicy mango chunks, and nutrient-rich chicken livers, it's a delightful mix of flavors and textures that embodies a healthified approach to eating.

schema.name: 2018/10/18 Dinner

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your grill to medium heat.
Shuck the corn and remove all silk. Rinse the corn under cold water.
Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Slice the eggplant and carrots into thin rounds.
Finely chop the red onion and garlic.
In a bowl, mix the chicken pieces with half of the chopped garlic and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Grill the corn for about 10 minutes, turning occasionally until cooked through and slightly charred. Remove and set aside to cool.
In a skillet over medium heat, melt the butter and sauté the remaining garlic and chopped onion until translucent.
Add the chicken to the skillet and grill until thoroughly cooked, about 10 minutes.
Add the sliced eggplant and carrot to the grill, cooking until tender, about 5 minutes.
