Cut the grilled corn off the cob and add to the skillet with the chicken and vegetables.
Stir in the pesto to the skillet, mixing well to combine all the ingredients.

schema.description: Indulge in a wholesome and nutritious dinner with this high-protein, low-sodium, and high-fiber meal. Crafted for those pursuing a healthified lifestyle, this recipe combines the savory flavors of chicken and vegetables with a hint of garlic and pesto for a hearty and balanced dish.

schema.name: 2018/10/11 Dinner Red Cabbage Cumin

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the ingredients by washing the capsicum, steamed red cabbage, and red onion. Then, chop the capsicum, shred the cabbage, dice the red onion, and mince the garlic.
Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk them lightly.
In the same bowl, add the tomato puree, ground pepper, salt, and cumin seed. Mix everything well.
Cut the chicken into small pieces and add it to the mixture, ensuring that it's well-coated.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add the chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side. Take the chicken out and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the capsicum, cabbage, red onion, and garlic. Sauté until they start to soften, approximately 5 minutes.
Return the chicken to the skillet. Stir in the previously whisked eggs and cook until the eggs are set, about 3 minutes.
Adjust seasoning with additional salt and pepper if needed. Serve hot.

schema.description: This Red Cabbage Cumin recipe is a delicious, high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar dinner option. Perfect for those who are looking for healthy recipes that do not compromise on taste. With ingredients like tender chicken, fresh vegetables, and a hint of cumin, this dish is a great way to enjoy a hearty meal that's both nutritious and satisfying.

schema.name: Ampalaya Egg

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Bitter Melon under cold water, cut in half lengthwise, remove the seeds, and slice thinly.
Dice the tomatoes and chop the red onion. Mince the garlic clove.
In a pan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Sauté the chopped onion and minced garlic in the pan until they become soft and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add the sliced bitter melon to the pan and cook until it begins to soften, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the diced tomatoes and salt, cooking for another 3 minutes.
Crack the eggs directly into the pan over the vegetables and scramble gently until the eggs are fully cooked, about 4 minutes.

schema.description: This Ampalaya Egg recipe is a healthy, nutritious choice for anyone seeking a low-carb, low-sugar, and high-fiber meal. Perfectly suited for health-conscious individuals looking for 'Healthyfied' options, this dish brings together the unique bitterness of bitter melon with the richness of eggs, creating a savory experience that's beneficial for your diet.

schema.name: Chicken Rosemary Thyme

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Pat the chicken fillets dry with paper towels to ensure proper seasoning.
Mince the garlic.
In a small bowl, mix the minced garlic, dried thyme, and dried rosemary.
Rub the chicken fillets with the butter, then coat evenly with the garlic, thyme, and rosemary mixture.
Place the seasoned chicken fillets in a baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.
Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving to allow the juices to redistribute.

schema.description: This Chicken Rosemary Thyme recipe is the epitome of a wholesome, nutritious meal, perfectly suitable for health-conscious individuals. Featuring high-protein, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar ingredients, it's crafted to cater to those pursuing a healthy lifestyle without compromising on flavor. Each bite is infused with the aromatic essences of rosemary and thyme, promising a delightful culinary experience.

schema.name: Globe Lunch

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C) for roasting the chicken breast.
Season the chicken breast with salt and pepper, and place it on a baking tray.
Roast the chicken breast in the preheated oven until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C), about 25-30 minutes.
While the chicken is roasting, trim the ends off the string beans.
Heat a pan over medium heat and sauté the string beans with a bit of olive oil until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Bring a pot of water to a boil and cook the corn on the cob until tender, about 5-8 minutes.
Slice the roasted chicken breast and serve it alongside the sautéed string beans and boiled corn on the cob.

schema.description: Indulge in a nutritious and fulfilling 'Globe Lunch' that's perfect for anyone looking to maintain a healthy diet without compromising on taste. This dish packs a high-protein and low-carb punch, featuring a succulently roasted chicken breast paired with sautéed string beans and a side of corn on the cob. It's an ideal meal for those seeking healthy, delicious options that are low in sugar.

schema.name: Adlai Goto

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Dice the carrots, white onion, and ginger. Mince the garlic.
Thinly slice the beef sirloin and beef tripe into bite-sized pieces.
In a large pot, bring the water to a boil. Add the saffron, ground pepper, diced onion, ginger, minced garlic, sliced beef sirloin, and beef tripe. Lower the heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Add the rinsed Adlai Rice to the pot and continue to simmer for 45 minutes, or until the rice is fully cooked and has absorbed the flavors.
Stir in the fish sauce. In a small bowl, mix the tapioca flour with a bit of water to create a slurry, then stir it into the pot to thicken the goto.
Serve hot and enjoy your healthy, comforting Adlai Goto.

schema.description: Adlai Goto is a healthified twist on the traditional Filipino congee, tailored for those seeking low-sugar, nutritious meals. This heartwarming recipe combines the wholesomeness of Adlai rice with the richness of beef sirloin and tripe, infused with the exotic flavors of saffron and ginger. Perfect for health-conscious individuals looking for a comforting yet healthy meal.

schema.name: Toasted Tinola Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: Peel and finely dice the red onion. Peel and minced the fresh ginger. Peel and mince the garlic.
Season the chicken with 1 tsp ground black pepper and 1.5 tsp(s) of salt, ensuring it's evenly coated.
In a large skillet over medium heat, sear the seasoned chicken until it is golden brown on all sides, about 5-7 minutes per side.
Remove the chicken and set aside. In the same skillet, add the diced red onion, minced garlic, and ginger. Sauté until fragrant and translucent, about 3-5 minutes.
Add the browned chicken back into the skillet. Lower the heat and cover, allowing it to cook through, about 30 minutes.
Uncover, increase the heat to medium and continue cooking until the exterior of the chicken is crispy, about 10 minutes.

schema.description: This Toasted Tinola Chicken recipe is packed with high-protein, and falls perfectly into the categories of low-carb and low-sugar meals. Designed for those seeking a healthier twist on traditional recipes, this dish is an ideal addition to your collection of Healthyfied, Healthy Recipes, and Healthified Recipes.

schema.name: Chia Almond Pudding

recipeInstructions.text: Measure 1 tablespoon of Chia Seeds.
Measure 0.50 cup (240ml) of Almond Milk - Original.
Wash and dice half a medium apple.
Rinse 15 grams of grapes under cold water and pat dry.
Measure 15 grams of almonds.
In a bowl, combine chia seeds with almond milk. Stir well and let it sit for 5 minutes to allow the chia seeds to start absorbing the liquid.
Add the diced apples, grapes, and almonds to the chia mixture. Stir until all ingredients are well combined.
Cover the bowl with a lid or plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight to let the pudding set.

schema.description: This Chia Almond Pudding is a perfect choice for anyone looking to enjoy a low-sodium, high-fiber meal that doesn't compromise on taste. Part of our Healthy Recipes collection, it's meticulously designed to cater to those who are on a quest for healthified meal options. Delicious and nutritious, it's a delightful way to start your day or enjoy as a light snack.

schema.name: 2018/10/17 Dinner

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 180°C (356°F).
Rinse the Pangasius fillets and pat them dry. Lay them out on a baking dish.
Drizzle 0.50 tbsp of lemon juice over the Pangasius fillets. Season with 0.12 teaspoon of salt and 0.25 tsp of ground pepper evenly.
Peel and slice the carrots into thin strips.
Chop the cabbage into bite-sized pieces.
Place the chopped vegetables around the Pangasius in the baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, until the fish is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
While the fish and vegetables are baking, prepare the sauce by mixing 2 tbsp of mayonnaise with 0.25 tbsp of lemon juice.
Once cooked, remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
Serve the Pangasius and vegetables with the lemon-mayonnaise sauce drizzled on top or on the side.

schema.description: This Healthyfied dinner is perfect for those following a high-protein, low-carb diet. Made with pangasius, fresh vegetables, and seasoned with lemon juice and ground pepper, it's a nutritious choice that does not skimp on flavor. Ideal for anyone looking for healthy recipes that are delicious and easy to prepare.

schema.name: Mushroom Meaty Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Prep the vegetables by dicing the red and green capsicum, chopping the white beech mushrooms, and finely chopping the red onion.
Mince the garlic.
In a frying pan, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned and no longer pink, about 8 minutes.
Add the diced red and green capsicum, chopped mushrooms, and finely chopped red onion to the pan. Cook for an additional 5 minutes until the vegetables are soft.
Stir in the tomato puree, salt, black pepper, marjoram, tarragon, and minced garlic. Cook for another 7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Serve warm over your choice of pasta or zoodles.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthier twist on classic flavors with our Mushroom Meaty Sauce. Featuring a high-protein, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar profile, this sauce is perfect for those looking to enjoy hearty meals without sacrificing nutrition. Pair it with your favorite pasta or zoodles for a satisfying, health-conscious meal.

schema.name: 2018/11/06 Dinner Chicke Gizzard
recipeIngredient: 300 g, Chicken, gizzard, all classes, raw

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the chicken gizzards under cold water and then trim any excess fat.
Cut the carrots into thin slices and the asparagus into bite-sized pieces.
Mince the garlic and ginger root.
In a pot, bring water to a boil and blanch the asparagus for 2-3 minutes, then remove and set aside. This should take about 5 minutes.
Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat and sauté the minced garlic and ginger until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Add the chicken gizzards to the pan and cook until they are browned on all sides and nearly cooked through, approximately 10 minutes.
Add the sliced carrots to the pan, sprinkle with salt, and cook for an additional 10 minutes or until the carrots are tender.
While the gizzards and carrots are cooking, boil the large egg to your desired doneness, peel, and then slice.
Once the gizzards and carrots are done, add the blanched asparagus to the pan and heat everything together for another 3 minutes.
Serve the chicken gizzard mix with slices of boiled egg on top.

schema.description: This 2018/11/06 Dinner Chicken Gizzard recipe is perfect for those seeking a high-protein, low-carb, and high-fiber meal. It's designed to nourish your body and satisfy your taste buds while sticking to your healthy eating goals. Featuring tender chicken gizzard, crunchy carrots, fresh asparagus, and a rich blend of garlic and ginger, this dish is a hearty and healthified option for any dinner.

schema.name: Adlai Red Cabbage

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, about 20 minutes, then set aside to cool.
Thinly slice the red cabbage.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked Adlai Rice with the thinly sliced red cabbage. Mix well.

schema.description: This Adlai Red Cabbage recipe is a perfect combination for those looking to enjoy a delicious, healthy dish that is low in sodium and sugar. Each bite is packed with the nutty flavors of Adlai Rice (Job's Tears) and the crunchy texture of fresh red cabbage, making it a great addition to your list of healthified recipes.

schema.name: Mango Raspberry Goji Chia Pudding

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix the chia seeds and goji berries with almond milk. Stir well until fully combined.
Cover the bowl with a lid or plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight, or at least for 4 hours, to allow the chia seeds to absorb the almond milk and thicken.
Slice the almonds and set aside. Peel and dice the kiwi. Thaw the raspberries if using frozen and chop the mango into small pieces.
Once the chia pudding has set, give it a good stir to ensure the consistency is even. If the pudding is too thick, you can add a little more almond milk to reach your desired consistency.
Layer the chia pudding in serving glasses or bowls with the sliced almonds, diced kiwi, raspberries, and mango pieces.
Serve the Mango Raspberry Goji Chia Pudding immediately or keep it refrigerated until ready to serve.

schema.description: Indulge in a delightful, healthy treat with our Mango Raspberry Goji Chia Pudding. Perfect for those following a low-sodium, high-fiber diet, this pudding is not just a feast for your tastebuds but also a powerhouse of nutrition. Embark on a journey to wellness with this easy-to-make, delicious pudding that's sure to become a staple in your healthy recipe collection.

schema.name: 2018/10/24 Breakfast Broccoli Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the broccoli under cold water and chop into small florets.
Peel the carrots and chop them finely.
Mince the garlic and finely dice the red onion.
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the minced garlic, diced red onion, marjoram, salt, and pepper to the beef. Stir and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Steam the broccoli and carrots until tender, about 5 minutes.
Combine the steamed vegetables with the beef mixture. Toss well to combine.

schema.description: This high-protein, low-carb, low-sugar, high-fiber Breakfast Broccoli Salad is perfect for those who are looking for a Healthyfied recipe to kickstart their day. Full of nutrients and flavors, it's a great addition to your Healthy Recipes collection.

schema.name: Beef Banana Blossom Pesto

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Banana Blossom under cold water and chop it into bite-sized pieces.
Cut the Beef Brisket into thin strips, making sure they are of uniform thickness for even cooking.
Season the Beef Brisket strips with 2 teaspoons of black pepper and 2 teaspoons of garlic powder, ensuring each piece is evenly coated.
In a pan over medium heat, cook the seasoned Beef Brisket strips until they are browned and cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Add the chopped Banana Blossom to the pan with the beef, and cook for an additional 5 minutes or until the banana blossom is tender.
Stir in 64 grams of Classic Pesto to the pan, mixing well to ensure the beef and banana blossom are well coated with the pesto. Heat through for 2 minutes.

schema.description: This Beef Banana Blossom Pesto recipe is a delightful fusion of flavors, perfect for those who are looking for a low-carb and low-sugar option without sacrificing taste. It's a healthy and novel way to enjoy beef brisket, combined with the unique taste of banana blossom and classic pesto, seasoned to perfection with black pepper and garlic powder. A must-try for anyone seeking healthy yet delicious meals.

schema.name: Chicken Squash Spinach Tinola Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare ingredients: slice the chicken into bite-sized pieces, mince the garlic, chop the red onion, cut the pumpkin into 1" cubes, and finely slice the ginger.
In a large pot over medium heat, sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until aromatic, about 3-5 minutes.
Add the chicken to the pot and cook until it turns white, approximately 5 minutes.
Pour in enough water to cover the chicken. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes to create a flavorful broth.
Add the pumpkin cubes to the pot and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes.
Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
Add the spinach and simmer for an additional 2 minutes until the spinach is wilted.
Serve hot and enjoy your healthy and satisfying Chicken Squash Spinach Tinola Soup.

schema.description: This Chicken Squash Spinach Tinola Soup is a perfect blend of high-protein and low-carb ingredients, ideal for anyone looking to enjoy a healthy, delicious meal with minimal sugar. Whether you're seeking a nourishing soup to warm you up or a healthy recipe to add to your collection, this Tinola variation is sure to delight.

title: Creamy Honey Mustard Tuna Corn Salad

schema.name: Creamy Honey Mustard Tuna Corn Salad
recipeIngredient: 0.50 ear, small (5-1/2" to 6-1/2" long), Corn, sweet, white, raw

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Ice Berg Lettuce under cold water and chop it into bite-sized pieces.
Drain the Tuna Fillet In Water and flake it into a mixing bowl.
Boil the corn ear for 7 minutes. Once cool, cut the kernels off the cob.
Crumble the All-Bran Regular into smaller pieces.
Soften the Cream Cheese Wedge and mix it with 10 g of mustard and 1 packet of Sugar Substitute to create the honey mustard dressing.

Combine the lettuce, flaked tuna, corn kernels, and crumbled All-Bran in a salad bowl. Drizzle with the creamy honey mustard dressing and toss until everything is evenly coated. Serve immediately. Cooking time: 7 minutes

schema.description: Indulge in a high-protein, high-sodium delight with our Creamy Honey Mustard Tuna Corn Salad. This healthified recipe transforms simple, nutritious ingredients into a flavorful salad that's perfect for those seeking wholesome yet hearty dishes. The creamy honey mustard dressing, combined with the richness of tuna and the sweetness of corn, creates a satisfying meal that's both flavorful and beneficial.

schema.name: Low Cal Refreshing Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 large egg, Egg Hard Boiled Large
2 sticks (86 g), Ichiban Alaskan Crab Flavored

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and slice the carrot.
Wash and chop the Ice Burg Lettuce.
Peel and slice the cucumber.
Roughly chop the almonds.
Slice the Ichiban Alaskan Crab Flavored sticks.
Drain and slice the young corn.
Slice the hard-boiled egg.
In a large salad bowl, combine the sliced carrot, chopped lettuce, sliced cucumber, chopped almonds, sliced crab flavored sticks, sliced young corn, and sliced hard-boiled egg. Toss gently to mix.
Serve immediately for the freshest taste. Enjoy your Low Cal Refreshing Salad!

schema.description: Dive into a fresh and Healthyfied journey with our Low Cal Refreshing Salad! Perfect for those who relish balanced meals, this salad is packed with high-fiber ingredients and a tantalizing mix that caters to your health-conscious palate. Ideal for anyone looking for Healthy Recipes without compromising on flavor. Its vibrant ingredients, including carrots, lettuce, hard-boiled eggs, cucumber, almonds, Alaskan crab flavored sticks, and young corn, make it a delightful choice for a nutritious meal.

schema.name: Chicken Squash Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the ingredients: Cut the chicken into small pieces; dice the red onion; mince the garlic; peel and grate the fresh turmeric root; wash and chop the Moringa Oleifera leaves; cube the pumpkin.
In a large pot, combine the chicken, red onion, garlic, salt, pepper, and grated turmeric root. Add enough water to cover the ingredients.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce to a simmer, cooking for 20 minutes until the chicken is tender.
Add the cubed pumpkin to the pot and simmer for another 10 minutes until the pumpkin is soft.
Stir in the Moringa Oleifera leaves and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Taste and adjust seasoning with more salt and pepper if needed. Serve hot.

schema.description: Indulge in the savory delight of our Chicken Squash Soup, a heartwarming blend that embodies health and taste. Perfect for those seeking a high-protein, low-carb meal, this soup promises a nutritional boost with low sugar content and the wholesome goodness of ingredients like pumpkin and Moringa Oleifera leaves. A treasure trove for anyone on a health journey, especially tailored for those following a healthy lifestyle.

schema.name: Coconut Tapioca Tortilla
recipeIngredient: 64 grams, Coconut Flour - 100% Natural Coconut Meat

recipeInstructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together almond milk, finely ground tapioca flour, organic chia seeds, coconut flour, and salt until well combined.
Crack the eggs into a separate bowl and beat them until fluffy.
Gradually mix the beaten eggs into the dry ingredients, stirring constantly to ensure a smooth mixture.
Let the batter rest for 10 minutes to allow the chia seeds to gel, thickening the mixture.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and pour a portion of the batter, spreading it thinly to form a tortilla shape. Cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown and fully cooked.

schema.description: This Coconut Tapioca Tortilla is a delightful blend of health and taste, perfect for those looking for low-sodium, low-sugar, and high-fiber options. Made with a unique combination of almond milk, tapioca flour, chia seeds, coconut flour, and eggs, this tortilla is a 'Healthyfied' twist on your typical recipes, aiming to enrich your diet without compromising on flavor.

schema.name: Tomato Spinach Fusilli Pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the ingredients: Wash and chop the tomatoes, rinse the spinach, and grate the Parmesan cheese if not pre-shredded.
In a large pot, bring water to a boil and cook fusilli according to package instructions until al dente, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat the extra virgin olive oil over medium heat.
Add garlic powder to the skillet and sauté for 1 minute.
Add the chopped tomatoes to the skillet and cook until they start to break down, about 5 minutes.
Add the spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Season the vegetable mixture with salt and pepper.
Add the cooked fusilli to the skillet, toss well to combine with the tomato and spinach mixture.
Serve the pasta sprinkled with shredded Parmesan cheese.

schema.description: Indulge in a delicious and healthy Tomato Spinach Fusilli Pasta that's perfect for those seeking high-sodium, low-sugar meal options. This healthified recipe combines the luscious flavors of fresh tomatoes, nutritious spinach, and perfectly cooked fusilli, topped with a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese to create a wholesome dish.

schema.name: 2018/11/06 Lunch Tilapia Caulirice

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Tilapia under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
Slice the eggplant into small cubes.
Season the tilapia with marjoram, salt, and pepper.
Preheat a non-stick pan over medium heat and cook the tilapia for 4 minutes on each side or until it flakes easily with a fork.
Remove the tilapia and in the same pan, add the eggplant cubes. Cook until they are tender, approximately 5 minutes.
Serve the tilapia atop the cooked eggplant as a healthy and satisfying caulirice alternative.

schema.description: This high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar 2018/11/06 Lunch Tilapia Caulirice is perfect for those looking to maintain a healthy lifestyle without sacrificing flavor. Inspired by Healthy Recipes and Healthified Recipes, this meal combines the light taste of tilapia with the hearty texture of caulirice, marjoram seasoning, and fresh eggplants to create a dish that's not just good for you, but also delicious.

schema.name: Beef Honey onion
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Thinly slice the onion.
In a bowl, combine the beef sukiyaki meat with honey, salt, ground black pepper, and oyster sauce. Let it marinate for at least 15 minutes.
In a pan over medium heat, sauté the sliced onion until translucent and slightly caramelized, about 5 minutes.
Add the marinated beef to the pan and cook until the beef is fully cooked and the sauce has thickened, about 10 minutes.

schema.description: This Beef Honey Onion recipe is perfectly tailored for those adhering to a high-protein and low-carb diet, while also being a healthified version of a beloved classic. Seasoned with a hint of sweetness from honey and the robust flavors of black pepper and oyster sauce, it's an enticing dish for anyone looking to maintain a healthy lifestyle without sacrificing taste.

schema.name: Squid in Creamy Ink

recipeInstructions.text: Finely dice the Red Onion, mince the Garlic, and grate the Ginger root.
Clean the Squid, making sure to remove the ink sack intact and set it aside.
Peel the Banana Blossom, chop it into bite-size pieces, and soak in a bowl with 1 cup of water and Coconut Vinegar for 10 minutes, then drain.
In a pan, sauté the diced Onion, minced Garlic, and grated Ginger with a splash of water until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the Squid and drained Banana Blossom to the pan, seasoning with Salt and Pepper. Cook for another 10 minutes.
Dissolve the Coconut Cream Powder in 1 cup of water and add it to the pan along with the Squid Ink. Stir well and simmer for another 15 minutes until the squid is tender and the sauce has thickened.

schema.description: Indulge in a unique and healthy culinary adventure with our Squid in Creamy Ink recipe. Perfect for those seeking a low-sodium, low-sugar, and high-fiber meal that doesn't compromise on flavor. This dish is a part of our Healthyfied recipe collection, designed to offer delicious, health-conscious options for your dining pleasure.

schema.name: Coconut Banana Pancake

recipeInstructions.text: Mash the Saba Banana until smooth.
In a large bowl, mix together the mashed banana, coconut flour, eggs, baking powder, and salt until well combined.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add a tablespoon of extra virgin coconut oil.
Pour a scoop of the pancake batter into the skillet, cook for about 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
Repeat the process with the remaining batter, adding more coconut oil to the skillet as needed.

schema.description: Indulge in the goodness of Coconut Banana Pancakes, a healthified delight that's perfect for those seeking high-fiber, nutritious meal options. Crafted with the wholesomeness of Saba bananas, coconut flour, and extra virgin coconut oil, these pancakes promise a heart-healthy start to your day

schema.name: Chicken Egg Drop Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the vegetables by chopping the carrots, dicing the red onion, and mincing the garlic and ginger. Set aside.
Rinse the chicken back portions and chicken livers under cold water, then set aside.
In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add the chicken back portions and chicken livers. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for about 30 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked.
Remove the chicken pieces from the broth. Once cool enough to handle, shred the meat from the bones and set the meat aside. Discard the bones and livers.
In the same pot with the broth, add the chopped carrots, diced red onion, minced garlic, and ginger. Simmer for about 10 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Whisk the egg in a bowl. Slowly pour the whisked egg into the simmering soup, stirring constantly to create egg ribbons. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Add the shredded chicken back into the pot. Stir well and continue to cook for another 5 minutes, ensuring the chicken is heated through.

schema.description: This Chicken Egg Drop Soup is a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar delight, tailor-made for those who are watching their dietary intake but don't want to compromise on flavor. A hearty and healthy recipe, it's perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a nourishing meal that's both delicious and beneficial to their health.

schema.name: Red Cabbage Chicken Egg Salad
recipeIngredient: 0.11 head, small (4" dia), Cabbage, red, raw

recipeInstructions.text: Start by hard boiling the egg. Place the egg in a saucepan, cover with water, bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer for 9 minutes.
While the egg is cooking, slice the red cabbage thinly and chop the honey crisp apple into bite-sized pieces.
Chop the boiled chicken breast and baby carrots into small pieces.
Chop the ice burg lettuce into thin strips and slice the young corn.
Once the egg is done, place it in cold water to cool before peeling and chopping it into pieces.
In a large salad bowl, combine the sliced red cabbage, chopped apple, chicken breast, baby carrots, ice burg lettuce, young corn, and chopped egg.
Toss the ingredients together until well mixed. Serve this nourishing salad chilled for a refreshing and healthy meal.

schema.description: Indulge in a refreshing blend of crunch and flavor with our Red Cabbage Chicken Egg Salad. Perfect for those seeking a high-fiber and healthified meal, this recipe beautifully combines tender boiled chicken, crisp red cabbage, juicy apples, and more for a delightful and nutritious experience.

schema.name: Garlic Paprika Salmon Tail

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Pat the salmon tail dry with paper towels to remove any excess moisture.
Mix 1 tablespoon of ground black pepper, 1 teaspoon of McCormick Paprika, and 2 tablespoons of fresh lemon juice in a small bowl to create the marinade.
Rub the marinade evenly over both sides of the salmon tail.
Place the salmon tail on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.

schema.description: This Garlic Paprika Salmon Tail recipe is a healthy indulgence for anyone following a high-protein, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. Perfect for those looking to enjoy a sumptuous meal while keeping it nutritious.

schema.name: Egg Garlic Adlai Fried Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, which takes about 20 minutes, then set aside.
Crack the eggs into a bowl, add salt, black pepper, and dried rosemary. Whisk until well combined.
Mince the garlic.
Heat a large skillet or wok over medium heat, add 1 tablespoon of oil.
Add the minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and stir gently until the eggs are softly set, about 3 minutes.
Add the cooked Adlai Rice to the skillet with the eggs. Stir and toss gently, breaking up the eggs and mixing them well with the rice. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Season the fried rice with additional salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

schema.description: Dive into a plate of Egg Garlic Adlai Fried Rice, tailored to suit your health-centric lifestyle. Meticulously selected for those who prefer low-sugar and nutritious meals, this recipe transforms simple ingredients into a delightful fusion of flavors and textures. A perfect embodiment of 'healthy eating without sacrificing taste', it's crafted for those who seek to maintain a balanced diet while indulging in the pleasures of home-cooked comfort food.

schema.name: Carrot Bell Pepper Omelette

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by whisking 3 large eggs in a bowl until well combined.
Finely dice the 0.50 green bell pepper and add it to the eggs.
Shred 1 cup of carrots and mix them into the egg and bell pepper mixture.
Stir in 0.25 cups of grated Parmesan cheese into the mixture.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and pour in the omelette mixture, spreading it evenly across the skillet. Let it cook for 3 minutes.
Gently flip the omelette and cook for an additional 2 minutes, or until the eggs are fully set.
Serve the omelette warm, optionally garnished with fresh herbs or avocado slices.

schema.description: This Carrot Bell Pepper Omelette is a perfect addition to your collection of healthy recipes. Not only is it low-carb, but it's also packed with nutritious ingredients like shredded carrots and green bell pepper, making it an ideal choice for anyone looking to maintain a healthy lifestyle.

schema.name: Tilapia in Soy Ginger

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the ingredients: Peel and mince the ginger root. Squeeze the calamansi to get fresh juice. Rinse the tilapia under cold water and pat dry.
Marinate the tilapia in a mixture of soy sauce, calamansi juice, minced ginger, and black pepper for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Preheat a non-stick pan over medium heat and gently place the marinated tilapia in it, cooking for 4 minutes on each side or until the fish is cooked through and golden brown.
In the last minute of cooking, sprinkle the moringa leaves over the tilapia to lightly wilt them.
Serve the tilapia hot, garnished with additional calamansi slices or moringa leaves if desired.

schema.description: This Tilapia in Soy Ginger recipe is a perfect match for those looking for a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar option. Embrace a healthier lifestyle with this mouthwatering dish that combines the delicate flavors of fresh tilapia, ginger, and soy, beautifully accented with moringa leaves and a hint of calamansi and black pepper. Ideal for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes without sacrificing flavor!

schema.name: Edamame Sesame Pancit
recipeIngredient: 3 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Prep your vegetables by thinly slicing the red pepper and carrots, mincing the garlic, and finely chopping the red onion.
Cut the sirloin strips into thin slices, suitable for quick stir-frying.
Bring 4 cups of water to a boil in a pot, add a dash of salt, then cook the pasta according to the package instructions. Once cooked, drain and set aside.
In a large pan or wok, heat the sesame oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and red onion, sautéing until they become aromatic and slightly golden, about 5 minutes.
Increase the heat to high, add the sliced sirloin strips to the pan, and season with salt and black pepper. Cook until the meat is browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the red pepper, carrots, and chicharos (edamame) to the pan with the meat. Stir well and cook for another 5 minutes.

Lower the heat to medium and add the cooked pasta to the pan along with the coconut aminos. Toss everything together until the pasta is well coated with the sauce and the vegetables are distributed throughout.
Taste and adjust seasoning as necessary. Optionally, top with a sprinkle of sesame seeds before serving warm.

schema.description: This Edamame Sesame Pancit recipe is a healthified delight, perfect for those seeking a high-protein, low-carb, and high-fiber meal. An innovative take on the classic Filipino noodle dish, this version is packed with nutritious ingredients like edamame, carrots, and sirloin strips, all seasoned with coconut aminos and sesame oil for a burst of flavor. It's ideal for anyone looking for healthy recipes that do not compromise on taste.

schema.name: Pan Grilled Bangus
recipeIngredient: 3 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the Boneless Milkfish (Bangus) by rinsing it under cold water and patting it dry with paper towels.
Season the Bangus with 3 tsp of ground black pepper and 1 tsp of minced garlic (Spice World). Ensure it's evenly coated on all sides.
Preheat your grill pan over medium heat. Once heated, place the seasoned Bangus on the grill.
Grill the Bangus for about 4 minutes on each side, or until cooked through and the skin is crisp.
Remove the Bangus from the grill and let it rest for a couple of minutes before serving.

schema.description: This Pan Grilled Bangus recipe is perfect for those looking to enjoy a healthy and delicious meal. The dish is high in protein, low in carbohydrates and sugar, and has a bold flavor profile thanks to the black pepper and garlic. It's an excellent choice for anyone following a healthy eating plan and looking for 'Healthified' recipes.

schema.name: 2019/01/05 Salad Stop Make Your Own

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the spinach, cabbage, beet root, and broccoli under cold water until clean.
Cook the lentils and beans in boiling water according to package instructions until tender, then drain. Estimated time: 20 minutes.
Peel and section the pomelo.
Boil the egg until hard-boiled, approximately 10 minutes, then cool, peel, and slice or chop.
Chop the olives, beet root, and broccoli into bite-sized pieces.
In a large salad bowl, combine the spinach, shredded red cabbage, chopped olives, lentils, beans, beet root, broccoli, pomelo sections, and baby leaf rocket. Toss gently to mix.
Top the salad with sliced egg and serve fresh.

schema.description: Dive into a bowl of freshness with our '2019/01/05 Salad Stop Make Your Own' recipe, a delightful mix perfect for those who love low-sugar, high-fiber meals. This healthy recipe combines an assortment of greens and beans, promising a nutritious punch in every bite. Ideal for anyone following a health-conscious lifestyle!

schema.name: Spicy Carrots Tinapa
recipeIngredient: 1 eggplant, peeled (yield from 1-1/4 lb), Eggplant, raw

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Tamban (sardines) under cold water and set aside.
Spiralize the carrots to create carrot noodles and peel the eggplant. Chop the eggplant, tomatoes, and zucchini into desired sizes.
Mince the garlic cloves and slice the olives.
In a bowl, mix the salt and ground pepper.
Heat the extra-virgin olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and sauté until it's fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Add the Tamban (sardines) to the pan and cook for 5 minutes. Remove the sardines and set aside.
In the same pan, add the spiralized carrot noodles, chopped eggplant, zucchini, and tomatoes. Cook for 8 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.
Gently mix in the sardines and olives into the pan. Season with the salt and pepper mixture. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, allowing all flavors to meld together.

schema.description: Spicy Carrots Tinapa is a flavorful and nutritious dish that is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a healthy yet indulgent meal. This recipe combines spiralized carrot noodles with fresh zucchini, tomatoes, olives, and delicious Tamban, creating a high-fiber and high-sodium delightful blend that fits right into your healthy lifestyle. Dive into this healthyfied recipe that promises not just great taste but also a boost to your health.

schema.name: Tinola

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: Slice the 50 grams of chicken back portions into smaller pieces, peel and cut 50 grams of raw papayas into chunks, finely chop 10 grams of garlic, dice 10 grams of onion, and slice 10 grams of ginger root.
In a large pot, sauté the chopped garlic, diced onion, and sliced ginger with a little oil over medium heat until the onion is translucent and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add the chicken pieces to the pot and cook until slightly browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Pour enough water into the pot to cover the chicken. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for 20 minutes.
Add the raw papaya chunks to the pot. Simmer until the papaya is tender, about 10 minutes.
Season with 0.25 teaspoon of salt and 1 teaspoon of ground black pepper. Adjust seasoning to taste. Continue to simmer for an additional 5 minutes.

schema.description: Tinola is a classic Filipino soup that's perfect for those looking for a healthy and comforting dish. This version is low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar, making it a perfect addition to a healthy lifestyle. Dive into the rich flavors of chicken, papaya, and ginger in this healthified recipe.

schema.name: Homemade Spaghetti

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the sausage into half-inch pieces.
Chop the white onion and dice any additional vegetables you have prepared.
Fill a large pot with water, add a pinch of salt, and bring it to a boil. Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions until al dente, usually about 10 minutes, then drain.
While the spaghetti is cooking, heat a pan over medium heat. Add the sliced sausages and cook until they start to brown, about 5 minutes.
Add the chopped onions and diced vegetables to the pan with the sausage. Sauté until the onions are translucent and the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
Season the sausage and vegetable mixture with salt and pepper, adjusting to taste.
Combine the cooked spaghetti with the sausage and vegetable mixture. Toss everything together until the spaghetti is evenly coated with the seasoning.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs or cheese as desired.

schema.description: Indulge in a delectable Homemade Spaghetti recipe that's designed for health enthusiasts. This dish skilfully balances high sodium with low sugar, categorizing it under Healthyfied Recipes—a perfect choice for those looking to enjoy classic flavors while keeping health in mind.

schema.name: Creamy Pesto Potato Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Boil the baby potatoes until they are fork-tender, about 15 minutes, then let them cool and cut into halves.
Hard-boil the eggs for 9 minutes, then cool, peel, and slice them.
Dice the tomatoes and red capsicum into small pieces.
In a large bowl, combine Greek yogurt and classic pesto to create the creamy pesto dressing.
Add the halved baby potatoes, sliced eggs, diced tomatoes, and red capsicum to the bowl with the creamy pesto dressing. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly coated.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving to allow flavors to meld.

schema.description: This Creamy Pesto Potato Salad is a perfect fit for anyone looking for a low-carb, low-sugar, yet deliciously healthy option. Made with Greek yogurt, baby potatoes, fresh tomatoes, capsicum, classic pesto, and eggs, it's an ideal choice for those who enjoy healthy yet flavorful recipes.

schema.name: Homemade Spaghetti

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the sausage into bite-sized pieces.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add salt, and cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Dice the white onion.
In a pan, heat a tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the diced onion and sliced sausage until the onion is translucent and sausage is lightly browned, about 8-10 minutes.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the pan with the sausage and onions. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss everything together until well combined, cooking for an additional 2-3 minutes.

schema.description: Indulge in this delicious Homemade Spaghetti that marries the goodness of a high-sodium and low-sugar diet, perfectly fitting for those seeking healthy yet flavorful meal options. This dish is part of our 'Healthified Recipes' collection, proving that you can enjoy your favorite meals in a healthier way.

schema.name: Tomato Basil Penne Pasta
recipeIngredient: 2 cup (4.7 oz) cooked, Cooked Penne Rigate

recipeInstructions.text: Start by chopping 1 cup of red onion and setting aside.
Prepare 0.12 cup(s) of basil leaves by washing and roughly chopping them.
Next, measure out 2 tablespoons of garlic pepper grinder.
Cook 125 grams of fresh ground pork in a pan over medium heat until fully cooked, breaking it apart with a spatula, about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, boil water in a large pot and cook 2 cups (4.7 oz) of Penne Rigate according to the package instructions until al dente, then drain.
Slice 10 small tomatoes into halves.
In a large skillet, sauté the chopped red onion with the prepared garlic pepper grinder over medium heat until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the cooked pork, halved tomatoes, and cooked Penne Rigate to the skillet. Stir well to combine. Let it cook for another 5 minutes to let the flavors meld.
Remove from heat and stir in the chopped basil leaves. Serve warm.

schema.description: This Tomato Basil Penne Pasta is perfect for anyone looking for healthy, flavorful meal options. Tagged as 'Healthyfied', 'Healthy Recipes', and 'Healthified Recipes', it's crafted to support a nutritious diet without sacrificing taste.

schema.name: Honey Garlic Chicken Liver

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the chicken livers under cold water and carefully remove any fat or connective tissue.
Finely chop the white onion and mince the garlic.
Season the chicken livers with salt and pepper.

In a pan, heat a tablespoon of olive oil (not listed in ingredients, please add if necessary) over medium heat. Add the chicken livers and sauté until they are browned on all sides but still pink in the middle, approximately 3-4 minutes each side.
Remove the livers from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, add the chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté until softened and fragrant, about 2 minutes.

Stir in the honey and a splash of water (about 2 tablespoons, not listed, please add if necessary) to the onion and garlic mixture, scraping the bottom of the pan to lift any browned bits. Cook for 1 minute.
Add the chicken livers back into the pan, coating them well with the honey garlic sauce. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, ensuring they are cooked through but not overcooked.
Serve the honey garlic chicken livers hot.

schema.description: This Honey Garlic Chicken Liver recipe is a healthy twist on traditional flavors, combining the benefits of high-protein and low-carb ingredients for those who love indulging in healthy yet delicious meals. Perfect for those looking to enjoy a nutritious dish without sacrificing taste, this recipe embodies the essence of healthified cooking.

schema.name: Cream Dory Beet Pesto Pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by rinsing the Cream Dory under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
Slice the Cream Dory into strips, season as desired and set aside.
Peel and dice the carrot, slice the Shitake mushrooms, and cut the young baby corn into small pieces.
Finely chop the cloves and fresh basil leaves, dice the tomatoes, and peel and chop the beets.
In a pan over medium heat, cook the diced beet until soft, about 10 minutes.
Add the cooked beets to a blender along with the chopped basil, tomatoes, and cloves. Blend until smooth to create the beet pesto sauce.
In a separate pan, heat a bit of oil and lightly sauté the carrot, shitake mushrooms, and baby corn until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the Cream Dory strips to the pan with the vegetables and cook until the fish is done, about 7 minutes.
Combine the sautéed vegetables, Cream Dory, and beet pesto sauce. Toss with your favorite cooked pasta.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthy yet hearty meal with our Cream Dory Beet Pesto Pasta. This recipe is perfect for those looking for low-sugar, nutritious options without compromising on taste. Packed with fresh vegetables, seasoned Cream Dory, and a unique beet pesto, it's a healthy twist on a classic pasta dish.

schema.name: Pesto Carrot Adlai

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, then set aside.
Dice the yellow carrot and mince the garlic.
In a pan, heat the fish oil over medium heat and sauté the diced carrot and minced garlic until they're softened, about 5 minutes.
Combine the cooked Adlai Rice with the carrot and garlic mixture. Stir in the pesto sauce and fresh squeezed lemon juice until well combined.

schema.description: This Pesto Carrot Adlai recipe is perfect for those seeking a healthy and delicious meal option. With its low-sodium and low-sugar content, it's a heart-healthy choice that doesn't compromise on flavor. Ideal for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes without sacrificing taste.

schema.name: Teryaki Sukiyaki

recipeInstructions.text: Season the Sukiyaki beef with salt and pepper.
In a large pan, heat the sesame oil over medium heat.
Add the seasoned beef to the pan and cook until browned, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Squeeze the lemon juice evenly over the cooked beef.
Drizzle the teryaki sauce over the beef and cook for an additional 2 minutes to combine the flavors.

schema.description: This Teryaki Sukiyaki recipe is a healthified version of the classic, offering a delectable blend of savory flavors with a note of citrus from the lemon juice. Perfect for those looking for healthy recipes without sacrificing taste. Its high sodium and low sugar profile fits well into a balanced diet.

schema.name: Buttered Broccoli Cauliflower Carrots

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots under cold water.
Cut the broccoli and cauliflower into florets, and peel and slice the carrots.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add 1 teaspoon of salt.
Blanch the broccoli and cauliflower florets and carrot slices in boiling water for 3 minutes.
Drain the vegetables and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the blanched vegetables to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper. Toss well to coat all the vegetables with butter.

schema.description: This Buttered Broccoli Cauliflower Carrots recipe is a testament to eating well and staying healthy. With its high fiber content, this dish fits perfectly into a diet aiming for health and wellness. The combination of tender broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots, all seasoned and buttered to perfection, makes it a healthy choice for anyone looking to maintain a nutritious diet while indulging in some high-sodium, high-taste goodness.

schema.name: Tortang Dulong

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Silverfish under cold water until the water runs clear and let it drain.
Finely chop the 15 grams of onion and mince the 10 grams of garlic.
In a large bowl, beat the 3 medium eggs until well combined.
Add the drained Silverfish, chopped onion, and minced garlic to the beaten eggs, gently stirring to ensure everything is evenly mixed.
Preheat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly oil it.
Spoon the Silverfish and egg mixture into the skillet, forming small patties. Cook each side for about 3-4 minutes or until golden and cooked through.

schema.description: Tortang Dulong is a high-protein, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar take on a classic Filipino dish. Perfect for those looking for healthier yet satisfying meal options, the recipe transforms silverfish into a nutritious delight. This approach aligns with the Healthified and Healthy Recipes trend, ensuring a delicious way to maintain a balanced diet.

title: Beef Potato Carrot Tomato Basil Pasta

schema.name: Beef Potato Carrot Tomato Basil Pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by peeling and dicing the small potatoes and medium carrot into small pieces.
Chop the red onion and slice the cherry tomatoes in half.
Cut the eggplant into small cubes.
Thinly slice the beef yakiniku if not already done.
In a large skillet, heat the extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced potatoes and carrot, and sauté for about 5 minutes.
Add the chopped red onion and eggplant cubes to the skillet and continue to sauté for another 5 minutes.
Introduce the beef yakiniku to the skillet and cook until the beef is browned, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the cherry tomatoes, salt, and pepper, and let cook until the tomatoes are just soft, about 3 minutes.
Turn off the heat and mix in the fresh basil leaves and shaved Parmesan cheese until the cheese is slightly melted.
Serve the Beef Potato Carrot Tomato Basil Pasta hot and enjoy!

schema.description: Dive into a wholesome and healthified meal with our Beef Potato Carrot Tomato Basil Pasta. This recipe brings together the savory flavors of beef, the earthiness of potatoes and carrots, the sweet burst of cherry tomatoes, and the fresh aroma of basil leaves in a delightful dance that is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes without compromising taste. Perfect for those who love a hint of high-sodium yet nourishing meals.

schema.name: Galunggong In Coconut Aminos
recipeIngredient: 250 g, Data From Pacific Ocean Fisheries

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Data From Pacific Ocean Fisheries (Galunggong) under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
Season the Galunggong with 1 tsp of ground black pepper.
In a pan, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
Once the oil is hot, add the seasoned Galunggong to the pan and cook for 4 minutes on each side or until golden and cooked through.
Drizzle 4 tsp of Coconut Aminos over the Galunggong in the last minute of cooking, allowing it to glaze the fish.

schema.description: Indulge in the flavors of the Pacific with this healthful Galunggong In Coconut Aminos recipe. Perfect for anyone following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet, this dish is a flavorful and nutritious option that brings you closer to your health goals while satisfying your palate.

schema.name: Chicken Shirataki Honey Ginger
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the Whole Dried Shitake in warm water until softened, then slice thinly.
Dice the Capsicum, Red and Yellow, Raw into small pieces.
Cut the Chicken Thigh Skinless Boneless into bite-sized chunks.
Grate 15g of raw ginger.
In a pan, heat some oil over medium heat and cook the chicken chunks until browned on all sides, about 8 minutes.
Add the sliced Dried Shitake, diced Capsicum, grated Ginger, Honey, and Ground Black Pepper to the pan. Stir well to combine.
Cover the pan, reduce the heat to low, and let the chicken simmer with the vegetables and seasonings until fully cooked and flavors meld, about 20 minutes.
Serve the Chicken Shirataki Honey Ginger hot, garnished with a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper or chopped herbs if desired.

schema.description: This Chicken Shirataki Honey Ginger recipe is a delicious blend of high-protein and low-carb ingredients, perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a healthy meal without sacrificing flavor. With a savory mix of chicken thigh, fresh veggies, and a hint of sweet honey and zesty ginger, it's ideal for those following a low-sodium and low-sugar diet. Dive into this healthified culinary creation that not only nourishes your body but also satisfies your taste buds with each bite.

schema.name: Pesto Carrot Adlai

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, about 20 minutes, then set aside.
Dice the yellow carrot and mince the garlic.
In a pan, heat the fish oil over medium heat and sauté the diced carrot and minced garlic until they're softened, about 5 minutes.
Combine the cooked Adlai Rice with the carrot and garlic mixture. Stir in the pesto sauce and fresh squeezed lemon juice until well combined.

schema.description: This Pesto Carrot Adlai recipe is a perfect example of a healthified meal that doesn't compromise on flavor. With low-sodium and low-sugar ingredients, it's an excellent choice for those looking to enjoy healthy recipes without forsaking taste. The combination of Adlai rice, fresh pesto, and yellow carrots, all brought together with a hint of garlic and a splash of fresh lemon juice, makes this dish a delightful, nutritious option for any meal.

schema.name: 2019/01/15 Tuesday Dinner

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the broccoli, red leaf lettuce, and water spinach under cold water. Pat dry with paper towels.
Prepare the vegetables for cooking: chop the broccoli into florets, tear the lettuce into bite-sized pieces, and trim the ends of the water spinach.

Hard boil the egg by placing it in a saucepan, covering it with water, and bringing it to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat, cool in cold water, and then peel.
Slice the fish and chicken leg into small, bite-sized pieces.
In a steamer, steam the broccoli and water spinach for 5 minutes until they are just tender.
In a separate pan, cook the fish and chicken pieces over medium heat for 10 minutes until fully cooked.
Slice the strawberry for garnish.
Assemble your dish by placing the lettuce on a plate, topping it with the steamed vegetables, cooked egg, fish, chicken, and garnishing with strawberry slices.

schema.description: This dinner recipe is perfect for those looking to maintain a healthy lifestyle with a low-carb and low-sugar diet. Featuring ingredients like broccoli, red leaf lettuce, egg, water spinach, milkfish, chicken leg, and strawberry, it's a meal that doesn't compromise on nutrition or flavor. Ideal for anyone following a health-conscious diet.

schema.name: Beef Mushroom with Broccoli

recipeInstructions.text: Thinly slice the Beef Sukiyaki Meat and set aside.
Trim the White Beech Mushrooms and set aside.
In a bowl, mix together Coconut Amino, Salt, ground Pepper, Lemon juice, and Stevia to create a marinade.
Add the sliced Beef Sukiyaki Meat to the marinade and let it marinate for at least 15 minutes.
Heat a pan over medium heat and sauté the marinated beef for 5 minutes or until browned.
Add the White Beech Mushrooms to the pan and cook for an additional 5 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender.
Serve the Beef Mushroom hot, garnishing with fresh herbs if desired.

schema.description: This Beef Mushroom with Broccoli dish is a healthful delight, perfect for those following a high-protein, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. It's a wonderful addition to your collection of healthy recipes, ensuring a guilt-free indulgence.

schema.name: 2019/10/01 Dinner

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the lettuce under cold water, then pat dry and set aside.
Prepare the homemade Ginisang monggo according to your favorite recipe, ensuring it's kept low-sodium and healthy.
Measure out 5 grams of your preferred salad topper.
Cut fresh oranges into 5 wedges.
Assemble the salad by laying down the lettuce first, then adding a quarter cup of Ginisang monggo on top.
Sprinkle the salad topper over the Ginisang monggo.
Garnish with fresh orange wedges and serve immediately.

schema.description: This dinner recipe from October 1, 2019, is perfect for those looking for a healthy and delicious meal. It is low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar, making it an ideal choice for anyone looking to maintain a healthy lifestyle. Featuring fresh lettuce, homemade Ginisang monggo, a nutritious salad topper, and fresh orange wedges, this dish is not only nourishing but also incredibly flavorful.

schema.name: 2018/11/02 Dinner Vegetables

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the Tomatoes, Green Beans, Enoki Mushrooms, Bell Pepper, and Carrots under cold water.
Cut the Tomatoes into wedges, trim the Green Beans, slice the Mushrooms and Bell Pepper, and chop the Carrots into bite-sized pieces.
In a large skillet, melt the Butter over medium heat.
Add the chopped Carrots and Bell Pepper to the skillet. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the Green Beans, Mushrooms, and Tomatoes. Cook for another 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
Season with Thyme, Salt, and Pepper. Stir well to combine and ensure the vegetables are evenly coated with the seasonings.

schema.description: This wholesome '2018/11/02 Dinner Vegetables' dish combines the freshness and nutrients of a variety of vegetables enhanced with thyme, resulting in a low-carb, high-fiber meal that fits perfectly into healthy eating plans. Ideal for those looking to enjoy healthy recipes without sacrificing flavor.

schema.name: Banana Blossom Beef Sisig
recipeIngredient: 0.50 medium (approx 2-3/4" long, 2-1/2" dia), Peppers, sweet, green, raw

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by chopping the red onion, cutting the banana blossom into small pieces, dicing the green pepper, slicing the spring onion, and mincing the garlic cloves.
Boil the banana blossom for 10 minutes until tender, then drain and set aside.
In a pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 2 minutes.
Increase the heat to medium-high and add the beef cubes. Cook for 5 minutes, or until the beef is browned.
Add the chopped red onion and diced green pepper to the pan. Cook for another 5 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Stir in the boiled banana blossom and continue cooking for an additional 5 minutes, ensuring everything is heated through and well-mixed.
Garnish with sliced spring onions before serving hot.

schema.description: Dive into a healthier, low-carb, and low-sugar version of the classic Filipino dish with our Banana Blossom Beef Sisig. Made with the natural sweetness of banana blossoms and lean beef cubes, this recipe is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy traditional flavors in a more health-conscious way. Perfect for fans of healthy recipes looking for a new culinary adventure.

schema.name: Gourmet Pesto Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place the chicken fillets on a baking sheet.
Spread the all-purpose pesto evenly over each chicken fillet.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes or until the chicken is thoroughly cooked.
Remove the chicken from the oven and immediately drizzle with lemon juice before serving.

schema.description: This Gourmet Pesto Chicken recipe is a perfect choice for anyone looking for a delicious, high-protein and low-carb option. Packed with flavors and health benefits, this dish is also low in sodium and sugar, making it a superb pick for a healthy meal. Ideal for those who enjoy healthy yet flavorful dishes.

schema.name: Low Cal Refreshing Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 head large, Lettuce, iceberg (includes crisphead types), raw

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the lettuce, carrots, cucumber under cold water. Pat dry with paper towels.
Chop the iceberg lettuce into bite-sized pieces.
Peel and grate the carrot.
Slice the cucumber into thin rounds.
Fry the egg until fully cooked, then set aside to cool. Once cooled, slice into strips or chop.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped lettuce, grated carrot, cucumber rounds, and ground almonds.
Add the fried egg to the bowl and gently toss all ingredients until well combined.
Serve immediately for the freshest taste.

schema.description: This Low Cal Refreshing Salad is perfect for those who are looking for a healthful twist in their diet. Loaded with high-protein, high-fiber ingredients and a hint of sweetness, this recipe is an ideal choice for those pursuing healthy yet delicious meals. Whether you're looking to healthify your diet or simply in search of a nutritious option, this salad encompasses all.

schema.name: Taco Omellete in Bellpepper

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
Finely chop the red onion and set aside.
Slice the tops off the yellow and red bell peppers, remove the seeds, and set the peppers aside.
In a medium bowl, beat the eggs together and add the marjoram, sage, salt, and ground pepper.
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the pork until no longer pink, about 7 minutes.
Add the chopped red onion to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet with the pork and onions, stirring gently to combine. Cook until the eggs are set, about 10 minutes.
Stuff the bell peppers with the egg and pork mixture, then place the peppers upright in a baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until the peppers are tender, about 25 minutes.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthy, low-carb, and low-sugar breakfast delight with our Taco Omelette in Bell Pepper recipe. Perfect for those who enjoy Healthyfied versions of their favorite dishes, this recipe combines fresh vegetables, protein-packed eggs, and savory pork for a meal that doesn't skimp on flavor.

title: Creamy Honey Mustard Tuna Apple Salad

schema.name: Creamy Honey Mustard Tuna Apple Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Ice Berg Lettuce under cold water and chop it into bite-sized pieces.
Dice the Raw, Peeled Apple into small chunks.
Drain the Tuna Fillet In Water and flake it with a fork.
In a small bowl, mix the Cream Cheese Wedge, Sugar Substitute, and mustard until smooth and creamy.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the iceberg lettuce, apple, tuna, and All-Bran Regular.
Pour the creamy honey mustard dressing over the salad and gently toss to combine.
Serve immediately for the freshest taste.

schema.description: Indulge in a delightful and refreshing salad that aligns perfectly with your health goals. Our Creamy Honey Mustard Tuna Apple Salad combines the crisp freshness of Ice Berg Lettuce, tender tuna fillet, and the crunch of All-Bran for a low-carb meal that doesn't skimp on flavor. Perfect for those who enjoy healthy and delicious recipes, this salad is a testament to healthified eating without compromise.

schema.name: 4 Ingredient Pancake

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the saba bananas and mash them thoroughly in a bowl.
In a separate bowl, beat the eggs until they are well mixed.
Combine the mashed saba bananas with the beaten eggs. Stir in the clabber girl (baking powder) until the mixture is well combined.
Heat the virgin coconut oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Pour 1/4 cup of the pancake mixture into the pan. Cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
Repeat with the remaining batter. Serve the pancakes hot.

schema.description: Dive into a healthier lifestyle with these easy-to-make 4 Ingredient Pancakes. Perfect for those following a low-sodium diet, these pancakes are not just nutritious but also cater to your health goals. Enjoy the unique blend of flavors and start your day with a healthified twist!

schema.name: Spicy Chicken Mongolian No Rice
recipeIngredient: 0.50 cup shredded, Lettuce, green leaf, raw

recipeInstructions.text: Mince the garlic.
Chop the carrots, shred the lettuce, slice the cucumbers and radishes, and slice the zucchini.
Cut the chicken breast into thin strips.

In a large pan, heat a tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and chicken strips. Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is browned and cooked through.
Add the chopped carrots, sliced zucchini, and a pinch of salt to the pan. Cook for another 5 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Serve the chicken and vegetables over a bed of shredded lettuce, topped with sliced cucumbers and radishes.

schema.description: This Spicy Chicken Mongolian No Rice recipe is perfect for those following a health-conscious, low-carb, and low-sodium diet. Enjoy a deliciously Healthyfied twist on the classic Mongolian dish, featuring fresh vegetables and tender chicken breast for a nutritious meal.

title: Sayote Tops Bellpepper Steamed Scrambled Egg

schema.name: Sayote Tops Bellpepper Steamed Scrambled Egg

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the steamed sayote tops and red bell pepper into small pieces. Mince the parsley finely.
Crack the eggs into a bowl, season with salt and ground pepper, and beat them until well mixed.
Add the chopped sayote tops, bell pepper, and minced parsley to the egg mixture and stir to combine.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and pour the egg mixture into the pan.
Cook for about 5-7 minutes, gently stirring occasionally, until the eggs are fully cooked but still soft and creamy.

schema.description: This delightful Sayote Tops Bellpepper Steamed Scrambled Egg recipe is perfect for those following a low-carb and low-sugar diet. Full of fresh flavors and healthy ingredients, it's an ideal addition to your collection of healthy recipes.

schema.name: 2018/11/07 Dinner Adlai Adobo

recipeInstructions.text: Prep your ingredients: Blanch the green beans, chop the red onion, dice the bell pepper, and mince the garlic.
Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, about 20 minutes, then set aside.
In a pan, heat a tablespoon of oil over medium heat and sauté the red onion, bell pepper, and minced garlic until they're softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the blanched green beans to the pan and continue to sauté for another 3 minutes.
Stir in the coconut amino into the vegetable mixture and let it simmer for about 10 minutes.
Combine the cooked Adlai Rice with the vegetable and coconut amino mixture. Mix well and cook together for another 5 minutes.

schema.description: This 2018/11/07 Dinner Adlai Adobo recipe is perfect for those who are looking for a healthy yet delicious meal option. With its low-sodium and low-sugar content, it fits wonderfully into a diet focusing on healthy living. Enjoy a dish that doesn't compromise on flavor while adhering to your health goals.

schema.name: Jackfruit In Coconut Milk

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your ingredients: Slice 2 cups of Jackfruit and cut 1 cup of papayas into 1" pieces. Mince 10 grams of garlic and 10 grams of organic ginger.
In a large pot over medium heat, sauté the minced garlic and ginger until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Add the sliced jackfruit and papaya pieces to the pot. Stir well to combine with the garlic and ginger.
Pour 1 cup of coconut milk into the pot. Add 0.5 tsp of salt. Stir until all ingredients are well mixed.
Cover the pot and let the mixture simmer over low heat until the fruits are tender and the flavors have melded together, about 20 minutes.
Once the fruits are tender, remove the pot from heat. Taste and adjust the seasoning, if necessary.
Serve warm and enjoy your healthy and flavorful Jackfruit in Coconut Milk.

schema.description: This Jackfruit in Coconut Milk recipe is perfect for those following a low-carb and low-sodium diet. It's a healthy and delicious way to enjoy the unique flavors of jackfruit and papayas, combined with the creamy richness of coconut milk. Ideal for lovers of healthy recipes!

schema.name: Tomato Alpine Penne Pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the ingredients: Rinse the cooked Penne Rigate under warm water and set aside. Dice the tomato and grate the cheese.
Season the diced tomato with 2 tsp of salt and 2 tsp of pepper, mix well to ensure even distribution.
In a large skillet over medium heat, add the seasoned diced tomato and cook until they soften, about 5 minutes.
Add the cooked Penne Rigate to the skillet with the tomatoes and stir to combine. Heat through, about 2-3 minutes.
Turn off the heat and add the grated cheese over the pasta. Stir well until the cheese melts and coats the pasta evenly.
Serve the Tomato Alpine Penne Pasta hot, garnished with additional cheese if desired.

schema.description: This Tomato Alpine Penne Pasta is a perfect choice for those looking for a healthified twist on a classic pasta dish. With its low sugar content, it suits a diet conscious of maintaining low sugar levels while not compromising on taste. The high-sodium tag suggests a flavorful experience, making it an ideal recipe for those who appreciate a well-seasoned meal. Enjoy a wholesome and Healthy Recipe that brings a creative twist to your table.

schema.name: Beef Kangkong in Soy

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by dicing the tomatoes and finely chopping the red onion.
Thoroughly wash the water spinach and chop it into bite-sized pieces.
In a pan over medium heat, cook the ground beef until it is fully browned. This should take about 8 minutes.
Add the diced tomatoes and chopped red onion to the pan with the beef. Cook together for 5 minutes until the vegetables are softened.
Stir in the salt and ground pepper, adjusting the seasoning according to taste.
Finally, add the chopped water spinach to the pan, cooking until wilted, about 2 minutes.

schema.description: This Beef Kangkong in Soy recipe is perfect for those following a low-carb and low-sugar diet, but with a mindful note on its high sodium content. Ideal for anyone looking to enjoy healthy yet flavorful dishes, this recipe combines the rich taste of ground beef with the fresh crunch of water spinach, all seasoned with a hint of soy for an irresistible, healthified meal.

title: Beef Egg Patty (One Patty Per Serving About 3” Dia)

schema.name: Beef Egg Patty (One Patty per Serving About 3” Dia)
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Finely dice the onion and mince the garlic.
In a large bowl, beat the eggs lightly.
Add the diced onion, minced garlic, marjoram, tarragon, salt, black pepper, and lean ground beef to the bowl with the beaten eggs. Mix thoroughly until well combined.
Preheat a skillet or non-stick pan over medium heat.
Scoop out a portion of the beef and egg mixture and form into a patty approximately 3” in diameter.
Place the patty in the preheated skillet, cooking for 5 minutes on each side or until fully cooked through.

schema.description: This Beef Egg Patty recipe is perfect for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. It is a healthy take on a classic dish, aiming to provide a nutritious meal without sacrificing flavor. Ideal for everyone looking to maintain a healthy lifestyle with delicious, healthified recipes.

schema.name: Garlic Cheddar Cauliflower

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Wash the cauliflower and cut it into florets.
Chop the red and green capsicum into small pieces.
Grate the sharp cheddar cheese.
In a large bowl, mix the cauliflower florets, chopped capsicum, grated cheese, salt, ground pepper, and spice. Ensure everything is evenly coated.
Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet in a single layer.
Bake for 25 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender and the cheese is bubbly and slightly golden.

schema.description: This Garlic Cheddar Cauliflower recipe is a delightful addition to your healthy recipe collection. It's low-sodium and high in fiber, falling perfectly under the tag of Healthified Recipes. A dish that ensures you enjoy delicious flavors without compromising on your health goals.

schema.name: Herbed Beef Sukiyaki
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp(s), Seeds, sesame seeds, whole, dried

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by thinly slicing the 400 grams of lean sirloin.
Mince 20 grams of garlic and chop 1 cup of white onions.

In a mixing bowl, combine the sliced sirloin with minced garlic, chopped onions, 1 tsp of sesame seeds, 1 tsp of marjoram, 1 tsp of oregano, and 1 tsp of ground black pepper. Mix well to ensure the beef is evenly coated with the seasonings.
Heat 1 tsp of sesame oil and 1 tsp of olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
Once the oils are hot, add the beef mixture to the skillet. Stir-fry for about 5-7 minutes or until the beef is browned and cooked to your desired doneness.
Season the sukiyaki with 0.5 tsp of salt during the last couple of minutes of cooking.
Serve the Herbed Beef Sukiyaki hot, garnished with additional sesame seeds if desired.

schema.description: Indulge in a Healthyfied version of Herbed Beef Sukiyaki, embracing the essence of low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar eating. This recipe brings out the robust flavors of lean sirloin, infused with a symphony of herbs and spices, making it a must-try dish for those who cherish Healthy Recipes.

schema.name: Sesame Soy Chicken Enoki Mushroom
recipeIngredient: 0.50 tbsp(s), Seeds, sesame seeds, whole, dried

recipeInstructions.text: Start by rinsing the Golden Mushroom under cold water and draining thoroughly.
Dice the Red Onion and mince the Garlic.
Cut the chicken into small, bite-sized pieces.
In a small bowl, mix together the Coconut Amino, ground Spices, pepper, black, Salt, and Sesame Seeds to create the marinade.
Toss the chicken pieces in the marinade and let sit for at least 20 minutes to absorb the flavors.
Melt the Butter in a large skillet over medium heat and add the diced Red Onion and minced Garlic. Sauté until they become translucent and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Increase the heat to medium-high and add the marinated chicken to the skillet. Cook until the chicken is thoroughly cooked, about 10 minutes.
Finally, add the Golden Mushroom to the skillet and stir-fry for an additional 5 minutes, until the mushrooms are tender and the flavors are well combined.

schema.description: This Sesame Soy Chicken Enoki Mushroom dish is a perfect blend of succulence and health, tailored for those on a low-carb, low-sugar diet. It's been crafted with a special focus on healthy living, featuring a delightful mix of sesame seeds, tender chicken, and Golden Mushroom, all flavored with coconut amino and a hint of spices. A dish that doesn't just satisfy your taste buds but also aligns with your health-conscious lifestyle.

schema.name: Sarsiadong Kamatis

recipeInstructions.text: Thinly slice the 3 medium tomatoes, 1 medium red onion, 1 large white onion, and mince the 5 cloves of garlic.
Heat 1 tbsp of organic olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
Sauté the minced garlic, sliced onions, and tomatoes in the pan until they start to soften, about 5 minutes.
Season the vegetable mixture with 1 tsp of ground black pepper and a pinch of salt. Stir well to combine.
Crack the medium egg into the pan and lightly scramble it with the vegetable mixture until the egg is fully cooked, about 3 minutes.
Serve the Sarsiadong Kamatis hot as a delightful and healthy side dish or main course.

schema.description: Sarsiadong Kamatis is a delightful and healthy recipe perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a low-carb, low-sodium culinary experience. This dish brings together the freshness of tomatoes, onions, and garlic, all seasoned perfectly with salt and ground black pepper, and is then beautifully enriched with a whisked egg. It's an excellent choice for those seeking healthful recipes without sacrificing flavor.

schema.name: Balsamic Chicken Tomato Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Season the chicken breast with salt and white pepper.
Grill the chicken breast over medium heat until fully cooked, approximately 10 minutes.
Rinse the Ice Berg Lettuce under cold water and chop it.
Boil the tomato for about 5 minutes, then allow to cool before chopping.
In a large bowl, combine the grilled chicken, chopped lettuce, and tomato.
Drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette and toss to combine.
Sprinkle the All-Bran Regular on top of the salad for an added crunch.

schema.description: This Balsamic Chicken Tomato Salad is a perfect choice for anyone looking for a healthy, low-carb, and low-sugar meal option. Its fresh ingredients and light dressing make it an ideal recipe for those who are health-conscious but still crave delicious flavors.

schema.name: Dory Blossom Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Wash and chop the romaine lettuce. Peel and slice the carrot. Dice the cucumber, yellow bell pepper, and green bell pepper.
Cut the tomatoes into wedges. Prepare the extra firm tofu by cutting it into small cubes.
Season the cream dory fillet with dried basil leaves, salt, and pepper to taste.
Preheat a pan over medium heat and cook the dory fillet until it's golden and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes each side.
Prepare the banana blossom/flower by slicing it thinly and soaking it in water mixed with a bit of vinegar to prevent browning.
In a large bowl, combine the chopped romaine lettuce, sliced carrot, diced cucumber, yellow bell pepper, green bell pepper, tomato wedges, and tofu cubes.
