Add the cooked cream dory fillet and sliced banana blossom/flower to the salad mixture.
Toss everything gently to combine. Optionally, you can add your favorite salad dressing or a squeeze of lemon juice for extra flavor.

schema.description: Dive into the freshness with our Dory Blossom Salad, a melody of crisp greens, colorful vegetables, and tender cream dory fillet, all coming together for a low-carb, low-sugar, high-fiber delight. Perfect for those looking for a heart-healthy option that doesn't skimp on flavor. This salad brings together the best of both worlds, combining nutritional benefits with mouth-watering tastes. Ideal for anyone on a healthful journey looking for healthy, delicious recipes.

schema.name: Balsamic Vinaigrette

recipeInstructions.text: Mince 1 clove of garlic.
In a bowl, whisk together the minced garlic, 0.06 tsp of ground white pepper, 93.75 ml of extra virgin olive oil, 0.25 cup(s) of balsamic vinegar, and 0.06 tsp of rock salt until well combined.
Taste the vinaigrette and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
Store the vinaigrette in a sealed container in the refrigerator until ready to use.

schema.description: This Balsamic Vinaigrette is a perfect concoction for those looking to enjoy a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar dressing without sacrificing flavor. Blended with healthy ingredients, it's an excellent choice for a health-conscious diet.

schema.name: Greek Yogurt Vinaigrette

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and mince the garlic clove.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the Greek yogurt, minced garlic, and cane vinegar until well combined.
Taste the vinaigrette, and adjust seasoning if necessary. If the dressing is too thick, you can thin it out with a little bit of water or more vinegar to achieve your desired consistency.
Transfer the vinaigrette to an airtight container and refrigerate until ready to use.

schema.description: This Greek Yogurt Vinaigrette is a health-conscious choice for those looking for a tasty, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar dressing option. Perfect for adding a delicious zest to your salads while keeping things light and healthy!

schema.name: Rainbow Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your vegetables: Wash and dice 60 g of red, 60 g of yellow vegetables, and 30 g of green capsicum. Thinly slice 15 g of red onion. Mince 10 g of garlic.
Cut 250 g of chicken (drained if in brine) into bite-sized pieces. Season with 0.25 tsp of ground pepper.
In a large pan, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and sliced onion, cooking until they start to soften and become fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Increase the heat to medium-high and add the chicken pieces to the pan. Cook until the chicken is browned and nearly cooked through, about 7 minutes.
Add the diced vegetables to the pan with the chicken. Stir everything together and continue to cook until the vegetables are tender but still crisp, about 5 minutes.
Serve the Rainbow Chicken hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

schema.description: This Rainbow Chicken recipe is a vibrant, high-protein, and low-carb delight. Perfect for those on a health-conscious journey, it mixes the crunch and freshness of various colored veggies with juicy chicken, seasoned to perfection. Ideal for anyone looking to enjoy a flavorful dish that's both nutritious and satisfying.

schema.name: Kangkong In Coconut Cream
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the water spinach thoroughly under cold water.
Peel and mince the garlic, then peel and finely chop the red onion.
In a pan, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat and sauté the garlic and onion until they're softened and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add the water spinach to the pan, cook for 5 minutes until it begins to wilt.
Pour in the coconut cream, add salt and black pepper. Stir well to combine and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve the kangkong hot, optionally garnished with some finely chopped red pepper for color and a slight spicy kick.

schema.description: Indulge in the essence of health and flavor with our Kangkong In Coconut Cream recipe. Perfect for those following a low-carb and low-sugar lifestyle, this dish combines the nutritional goodness of water spinach with the rich, creamy texture of coconut cream. Tailored for the health-conscious, this recipe promises to be a delightful addition to your healthy eating habits.

schema.name: Buttered Potato And Carrot

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Baby Potatoes under cold water and scrub any dirt off their skins.
Peel the Carrots and then slice them into rounds about 1/4 inch thick.
In a medium pot, bring salted water to a boil and add the Baby Potatoes. Cook them for about 15 minutes until tender.
Add the sliced Carrots to the pot with the Baby Potatoes and cook for an additional 10 minutes until the carrots are tender.
Drain the water from the pot and return the cooked Potatoes and Carrots to the pot.
Add the Butter and dried Thyme leaves to the Potatoes and Carrots. Stir over low heat until the vegetables are evenly coated with the butter and herbs.
Serve warm as a side dish to your favorite main course.

schema.description: This Buttered Potato and Carrot recipe is a perfect addition to your healthy meal plan. It's low in sodium and sugar, making it an excellent choice for those who are mindful about their health. Enjoy a delicious, healthified dish that doesn't compromise on flavor.

schema.name: Chicken Tomato

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the onion and mince the garlic.
Cut the thigh boneless chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Season the chicken pieces with ground pepper.
In a skillet over medium heat, sauté the diced onion and minced garlic for 3 minutes or until they become translucent.
Add the chicken pieces to the skillet and cook for 10 minutes, or until they are golden brown on all sides.
Stir in the tomato puree and coco sugar, mixing well to ensure the chicken is evenly coated. Reduce the heat and let simmer for 25 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.

schema.description: Indulge in a flavorful and health-conscious journey with our Chicken Tomato recipe. Perfect for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet, this dish is a testament to the belief that healthy eating doesn't have to compromise on taste. Let this standout recipe from our collection of Healthyfied Recipes elevate your home-cooked meals.

schema.name: Adlai Carrot Fried Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, about 20 minutes, then set aside.
Peel and dice the carrots into small pieces.
Crack the egg into a bowl, beating it lightly with a fork.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add the coconut. Wait until it is hot, then add the diced carrots. Cook for about 5 minutes until they start to soften.
Push the carrots to one side of the pan, and pour in the beaten egg on the other side. Let it set for a minute before scrambling it and mixing with the carrots.
Add the cooked Adlai Rice to the pan. Season with salt. Stir everything together and cook for an additional 5 minutes, making sure the rice is heated through.

schema.description: This Adlai Carrot Fried Rice is a perfect harmony of health and taste, ideal for those following a low-carb and low-sugar diet. Infused with wholesome ingredients like Adlai Rice, fresh carrots, and coconut, it's a healthy twist to your traditional fried rice that does not compromise on flavor. A great addition to your healthy recipes collection, this dish is packed with nutrients and easily fits into your health-conscious lifestyle.

schema.name: Soy Chocolate Collagen
recipeIngredient: 45 ml, Double Belgian Chocolate with Pistachio Milk

recipeInstructions.text: Measure 0.25 cup of Double Belgian Chocolate.
Measure 45 ml of Double Belgian Chocolate mixed with Pistachio Milk.
Measure 20 grams of Vital Proteins, equal to two scoops.
Blend the Double Belgian Chocolate with the Pistachio Milk until well combined, about 2 minutes.
Add the vital proteins to the mixture and continue blending until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute.
Serve the Soy Chocolate Collagen beverage in a tall glass and enjoy.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthy treat with our Soy Chocolate Collagen recipe. Perfect for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet, this delightful beverage combines the richness of double Belgian chocolate with the nutty flavor of pistachio milk and the health benefits of vital proteins. A must-try for anyone looking to enjoy a delicious, guilt-free refreshment.

schema.name: No oil French Toast

recipeInstructions.text: Crack the large egg into a bowl and whisk thoroughly.
Add 1 tsp of honey to the egg and continue to whisk until well combined.
Dip each slice of sugar free wheat bread into the egg mixture, making sure both sides are well coated.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Place the bread slices on the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown.

schema.description: This No oil French Toast recipe is perfect for those who are on a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. Healthyfied to ensure you can enjoy a classic breakfast option without compromising on your health goals. Easy to make and deliciously satisfying, this recipe is a great way to start your day the healthy way!

schema.name: Avocado Oat Shake

recipeInstructions.text: Mash or puree the avocado until smooth.
In a blender, combine the mashed avocado, water, oat milk, and Stevia sachet.
Blend on high speed for 2 minutes or until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
Pour the shake into a glass and enjoy immediately.

schema.description: This Avocado Oat Shake is a perfect blend for those seeking a healthy yet delicious drink. It's crafted with low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar ingredients, making it an ideal choice for anyone looking to indulge in a guilt-free treat. Dive into the healthified world with this nutrient-packed recipe that promises to refresh and revitalize your day.

schema.name: Pesto Tomato Potato

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the Yellow Baby Potatoes thoroughly and cut them into halves.
Peel and finely chop the White Onion and Red Onion.
Dice the Tomatoes into small pieces.
Bring a pot of water to boil and cook the Yellow Baby Potatoes until tender, about 15 minutes.
In a skillet, sauté the chopped onions over medium heat until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the diced tomatoes to the skillet and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.

Stir in the Pesto Sauce and add the boiled Yellow Baby Potatoes. Mix well until the potatoes are fully coated with the pesto and tomato mixture. Cook for an additional 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.

schema.description: This Pesto Tomato Potato recipe is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a delicious, healthy meal without compromising on taste. Featuring low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar ingredients, it's an ideal choice for health-conscious foodies. Dive into a dish that aligns with your wellness goals while tantalizing your taste buds with the rich flavors of pesto, fresh tomatoes, and tender baby potatoes.

schema.name: No Bake Eggplant Lasagna

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the eggplant and tomatoes, then slice the eggplant into thin rounds.
Thinly slice the tomatoes and set aside.
Finely chop the red onion and garlic.
In a small bowl, mix together marjoram, oregano, smoked paprika, thyme, and rosemary.
Layer a slice of eggplant on a plate, followed by a slice of tomato. Sprinkle some of the herb mixture over the tomato.
Add a small amount of chopped onion and garlic on top, then a couple of slices of cheddar cheese.
Repeat the layers until all ingredients are used, finishing with a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese on top.
In a small saucepan, melt butter over low heat and add the remaining herb mixture. Stir in water, salt, and pepper, and simmer for 5 minutes to create a herb-infused sauce.
Pour the herb sauce gently over the assembled lasagna. Allow it to sit for a few minutes so the flavors meld together.

schema.description: Dive into a healthy culinary experience with our No Bake Eggplant Lasagna! This dish is perfect for those seeking a low-carb and low-sugar option without sacrificing flavor. Packed with fresh vegetables, aromatic herbs, and a mix of sharp cheddar and Parmesan cheese, it's a delicious way to indulge in healthy eating. Whether you're following a health-conscious diet or simply looking for a flavorful meal, this eggplant lasagna is a must-try.

schema.name: Dory Blossom Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by washing all the vegetables - romaine, carrot, cucumber, yellow bell pepper, and green bell pepper. Pat them dry.
Chop the romaine, peel and cut the carrot into thin slices, and thinly slice the cucumber, yellow bell pepper, and green bell pepper.
Dice the tomatoes and set aside.
Season the cream dory fillet with a pinch of salt and pepper, according to your taste.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and cook the cream dory fillet until golden and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes each side.
Let the fillet cool for a few minutes, then flake it using a fork.
In a large bowl, combine the chopped romaine, sliced carrot, cucumber, bell peppers, diced tomatoes, flaked dory, and extra firm tofu (cut into cubes).
Sprinkle dried basil over the salad and gently toss to combine.
Serve the salad fresh and enjoy a burst of health in every bite.

schema.description: Indulge in a healthy and refreshing Dory Blossom Salad, perfect for those following a low-carb and low-sugar diet without compromising on flavor. This salad combines the succulence of cream dory with the crunch of fresh vegetables and the aromatic touch of basil, making it a must-try dish.

schema.name: Banana Blossom In Coconut Milk

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the ingredients: peel and finely mince the garlic, peel and finely chop the red onion, and trim the banana blossom, removing the tough outer layers and slicing the tender parts.
Heat a large pan over medium heat and sauté the garlic and red onion until they are soft and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add the sliced banana blossom to the pan, stir to combine with the garlic and onion, and cook for an additional 10 minutes until the banana blossom has softened.
Pour in the coconut cream, reduce the heat to low, and simmer the mixture gently for 20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld and the sauce to slightly thicken.
After simmering, remove the pan from heat and let the dish rest for a few minutes before serving. This allows the banana blossom to absorb the flavors fully.

schema.description: Dive into a heart-healthy journey with this Banana Blossom in Coconut Milk recipe, perfectly tailored for a low-carb, low-sodium, low-sugar, and high-fiber diet. Embrace a healthier lifestyle without sacrificing flavor with this exquisite dish that joins the ranks of Healthyfied Recipes. A delightful choice for anyone looking to enjoy delicious, nutritious meals.

schema.name: Pumpkin Carrot Spinach Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and dice the carrot.
Wash and roughly chop the spinach leaves.
Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add diced white onion to the pot and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the diced carrot and cook for another 5 minutes.
Stir in garlic powder, salt, pepper, and fresh thyme, cooking for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the boiled pumpkin and water to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add the evaporated milk and spinach leaves to the pot. Stir well and continue cooking for an additional 5 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth. If you prefer a chunkier soup, blend only half of the soup.

schema.description: This wholesome Pumpkin Carrot Spinach Soup is a perfect blend for those who enjoy low-carb, healthy recipes. With a high-sodium kick, minimal sugar, and packed with nutritious ingredients, it caters to anyone looking for a healthified twist to their meals. Whether you're looking for something warm during the colder months or a light and comforting meal, this soup will not disappoint.

schema.name: Mashed Sweet Potato

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the sweet potatoes and cut them into chunks.
Place the chunks into a pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes.
Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot.
Mash the sweet potatoes until smooth.
Stir in the shredded Parmesan cheese until well combined and cheese is melted.

schema.description: This Mashed Sweet Potato recipe is perfect for those looking for a healthy and delicious side dish. With its low sodium and low sugar profile, it's a guilt-free addition to any meal. Perfect for anyone following a healthy lifestyle, these mashed sweet potatoes are enriched with Parmesan cheese, offering a tasty twist on a classic favorite.

schema.name: Toasted Squash Green Beans

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
Wash and cut the Kabocha squash into small cubes.
Trim the ends off the Baguio beans and cut them in half if they are too long.
Cut the red bell peppers and eggplant into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, mix the prepared squash, beans, bell peppers, eggplant, salt, and black pepper. Squeeze the lemon over the mixture and toss until everything is evenly coated.
Spread the vegetables out in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast in the oven for 25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly browned, stirring halfway through the cooking time.

schema.description: This Toasted Squash Green Beans recipe is a perfect blend of health and flavor. Packed with high-fiber ingredients, it's part of our Healthyfied collection that transforms traditional recipes into healthier versions. Ideal for anyone looking to add nutritious yet delicious dishes to their diet.

schema.name: Raspberry Mango Yogurt

recipeInstructions.text: Place the Greek live yogurt into a mixing bowl.
Add the frozen raspberries, flaxseeds, chia seeds, and raw mango pieces to the bowl.
Mix all the ingredients thoroughly until well combined.
Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve the yogurt in a bowl or glass of your choice.

schema.description: This Raspberry Mango Yogurt is a delightful mix of tangy raspberries and sweet mangoes blended into creamy Greek yogurt. Perfect for those following low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diets, this healthy recipe is an excellent choice for anyone looking to enjoy a nutritious and delicious treat.

schema.name: 2018/11/08 Dinner Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the cabbage and carrots thoroughly under cold water.
Thinly slice the cabbage and grate the carrots, then combine in a large salad bowl.
Mince the garlic.
In a small bowl, mix together Greek yogurt, minced garlic, coco sugar, salt, and pepper until well combined.
Pour the yogurt dressing over the cabbage and carrot mixture. Toss until all ingredients are well coated with the dressing.

schema.description: Delight in the fresh, high-fiber essence of our 2018/11/08 Dinner Salad. A harmonious blend of raw cabbage and carrots, seasoned with a twist of salt, pepper, and a hint of coco sugar. Infused with the creamy richness of Greek yogurt and the pungent kick of raw garlic, this salad is a testament to healthy, yet scrumptious dining. Perfect for anyone on a quest for Healthy Recipes that do not compromise on flavor, this Healthified salad will invigorate your meal with its nutritious goodness.

schema.name: 2018/10/16 Beef Steak Failed

recipeInstructions.text: Thinly slice the red onion and set aside.
Marinate the beef sukiyaki meat with calamansi juice, salt, and ground pepper. Ensure each piece is well-coated. Let it sit for at least 15 minutes.
Heat a pan over medium heat and cook the marinated beef for about 3-4 minutes on each side or until it reaches your desired doneness.
Remove the beef from the pan and let it rest for a couple of minutes.
In the same pan, add the sliced red onion and sauté until translucent and slightly caramelized, about 5 minutes.
Serve the beef topped with the sautéed red onion.

schema.description: This beef steak recipe brings a healthy twist to your meal, making it perfect for those following a low-carb and low-sugar diet. It's part of our Healthified Recipes, ensuring you get both flavor and nutrition in every bite.

schema.name: Potato Carrot in Coconut Oil

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the baby potatoes thoroughly and peel the carrots.
Dice the carrots into small pieces.
In a pan, heat the extra virgin coconut oil over medium heat.
Add the baby potatoes to the pan and cook for 10 minutes until they start to become tender.
Add the diced carrots to the pan with the potatoes and cook for an additional 15 minutes, stirring occasionally until both are fully cooked and slightly golden.

schema.description: This Potato Carrot in Coconut Oil recipe is a perfect representation of low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar eating that doesn't compromise on taste. Ideal for anyone looking to enjoy healthy yet delicious meals, it's a testament to how simple ingredients can create a nutritious dish that's both satisfying and health-conscious.

schema.name: Creamy egg bellpepper sesame

recipeInstructions.text: Thoroughly wash the yellow and red bell peppers under cold water.
Slice the yellow and red bell peppers into thin strips.
In a bowl, beat the eggs with salt and ground pepper until well combined.
Heat the sesame oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add the sliced bell peppers to the pan and sauté for about 5 minutes, until they are soft.
Pour the beaten egg mixture over the sautéed peppers. Let it cook without stirring for 2-3 minutes, until the eggs start to set.
Gently stir the mixture, ensuring the eggs are fully cooked and creamy, about 2 more minutes.

schema.description: Indulge in a savory and healthy meal with our Creamy Egg Bell Pepper Sesame recipe. Tailored for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet, this dish emanates a perfect blend of nutritious ingredients. It promises a delightful culinary experience, making it an excellent choice for health-conscious individuals seeking flavorful yet wholesome meals.

schema.name: Carrot Adlai Garlic Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, typically around 20 minutes, then set aside.
Peel and dice the carrots into small cubes.
Peel and mince the garlic.
Heat a pan over medium heat and add the minced garlic and diced carrots. Cook until the carrots are softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Combine the cooked Adlai Rice with the sautéed garlic and carrots. Stir well.

schema.description: This Carrot Adlai Garlic Rice recipe is a wholesome, healthified dish perfect for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. With its harmony of savory garlic, sweet carrots, and nutty Adlai rice, it's a nutritious side dish that doesn't skimp on flavor. Ideal for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes without compromising on taste.

schema.name: Adlai Bellpepper Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, then set aside.
Dice the red bell pepper and green capsicum.
In a pan, heat a tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat and sauté the diced bell peppers for about 5 minutes until they're softened.
Combine the cooked Adlai Rice with the sautéed bell peppers. Stir until well combined.

schema.description: Dive into a bowl of Adlai Bellpepper Rice, a perfect blend of wholesome Adlai Rice paired with the rich colors and flavors of red and green bell peppers. Ideal for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet, this recipe promises not only to nourish your body but also to delight your taste buds with its healthy and vibrant ingredients. Whether you're looking to add a new healthy recipe to your collection or just want to enjoy a delicious and nutritious meal, this Adlai Bellpepper Rice suits all your needs.

schema.name: Shirataki Cashew Pesto

recipeInstructions.text: Soak cashews in hot water for 20 minutes, then drain.
Rinse shirataki noodles under cold water for 2 minutes then boil for 3 minutes. Drain and set aside to dry.
In a blender, combine the cream cheese fluff, unsweetened vanilla almond milk, pesto sauce, and soaked cashews. Blend until smooth.
Toss the shirataki noodles with the cashew pesto mixture until evenly coated.

schema.description: Indulge in the guilt-free pleasure of our Shirataki Cashew Pesto, a perfect blend for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. This healthified recipe brings together the creamy softness of cream cheese fluff with the nutty crunch of cashews, all mixed into shirataki noodles for a deliciously healthy meal.

schema.name: Mushroom Salmon Tomato Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the vegetables by dicing the red onion, capsicum (green, yellow, and orange), and slicing the brown beech mushrooms.
Mince the garlic.
In a saucepan over medium heat, add the passata, diced vegetables, minced garlic, and salt. Stir well to combine.
Let the sauce simmer on low heat until the vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
While the sauce simmers, slice the smoked salmon cuts into smaller pieces.
Once the vegetables are tender, add the sliced smoked salmon to the sauce. Stir gently and let it cook for an additional 5 minutes to infuse the flavors.
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Serve hot.

schema.description: This Mushroom Salmon Tomato Sauce recipe is perfect for anyone who's looking for a hearty, low-carb, and low-sugar meal. Brimming with the goodness of fresh vegetables like capsicum, mushrooms, and onions, and enriched with smoked salmon cuts, this dish perfectly aligns with healthy-living goals. Whether you're trying to eat better or just love the sound of a healthified recipe, this is bound to become a new favorite.

schema.name: Colorful Mixed Vegetables

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the vegetables by washing the eggplant, carrots, cucumber, and baby corn under cold water.
Cut the eggplant into 1-inch cubes, chop the carrots, slice the cucumber, and halve the baby corn.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the eggplant and carrots to the skillet, and sauté for about 5 minutes, until they start to soften.
Add the cucumber and baby corn to the skillet, and continue to sauté for another 5 minutes, until all vegetables are tender but still crisp.
Season with a pinch of salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm as a colorful side dish.

schema.description: This Colorful Mixed Vegetables recipe is a delightful blend of flavors and textures, perfect for those seeking a low-carb, low-sodium, and high-fiber meal option. Incorporated into both healthy and healthified recipes, these vibrant vegetables not only offer nutritional benefits but also add a splash of color to your table.

schema.name: 2018/09/25 Dinner

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the eggplant, okra, and tomatoes under cold water. Chop the eggplant and okra, and dice the tomatoes.
Peel and devein the shrimps, if not already done so.
In a bowl, mix together coconut amino and coconut vinegar to create the marinade.
Marinate the shrimps in the prepared sauce for 10 minutes.
In a skillet over medium heat, sauté the marinated shrimps for 5 minutes or until they are fully cooked. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the chopped eggplant and okra. Cook for about 5 minutes.
Add the diced tomatoes to the skillet and cook for an additional 3 minutes.
Return the cooked shrimps to the skillet, stirring to combine all the ingredients. Heat through for 2 minutes.
Serve hot and enjoy your delicious, healthified dinner.

schema.description: This high-protein, low-carb meal is perfect for those who are looking for a healthy yet delicious dinner option. With a hint of high-sodium and low-sugar ingredients, this recipe brings out the best in healthy eating. Featuring nutritious vegetables such as eggplant, okra, and tomatoes, paired with succulent shrimps, all seasoned with coconut amino and vinegar for an extra flavor kick. Perfect for anyone who loves healthy recipes with a gourmet twist.

schema.name: 2018/11/07 Lunch Garlic Sesame Asparagus
recipeIngredient: 1 tbsp(s), Seeds, sesame seeds, whole, dried

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the asparagus by washing it thoroughly under cold water. Trim the ends of the asparagus spears.
In a mixing bowl, toss the asparagus with 1 tbsp of Extra Virgin Olive Oil, ensuring the spears are evenly coated.
Preheat a grill pan or skillet over medium heat.
Place the asparagus in the pan and cook for 7 minutes, turning occasionally to ensure even cooking.
While the asparagus is cooking, toast the sesame seeds in a dry pan over low heat until they're golden brown, which should take about 3 minutes. Remove from heat.
Finely mince the garlic.
Once the asparagus is tender and charred to your liking, add the minced garlic and toasted sesame seeds, tossing everything together in the pan for another 2 minutes.

schema.description: Indulge in a delightful, healthy side dish with our Garlic Sesame Asparagus recipe. This low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar recipe is perfect for those looking to enjoy a nutritious meal without compromising on flavor. Perfect for a health-conscious lifestyle, this recipe brings a fresh twist to your table.

schema.name: Buttered Herbed Corn And Carrot

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the Baby Corn and Carrots under cold water.
Slice the carrots into thin rounds.
Slice the Baby Corn into halves.
Bring a pot of water to a boil and blanch the Baby Corn and Carrots for 3 minutes, then drain and set aside.
In a pan, melt 1 tbsp of Butter over medium heat.
Add the blanched Baby Corn and Carrots to the pan and sauté for 5 minutes, or until they are slightly softened and coated with butter.
Serve hot as a delicious and nutritious side dish.

schema.description: This Buttered Herbed Corn and Carrot recipe is perfect for those who are looking for a healthy, low-carb, and low-sugar side dish. Its simple yet delicious flavors will complement any main course, making it a must-try for healthy recipe enthusiasts.

schema.name: Banana Blossom Fresh Spring Rolls

recipeInstructions.text: Thinly slice the chicken thigh, carrots, yellow bell pepper, red bell pepper, garlic, and white onion.
Shred the banana blossom and prepare lettuce leaves.
Bring a pot of water to a boil, add the chicken thigh slices, and cook for about 10 minutes or until fully cooked. Remove and set aside to cool.
In a pan over medium heat, sauté the garlic and onion for about 5 minutes or until fragrant and translucent.
Add the sliced carrots, yellow bell pepper, and red bell pepper to the pan and sauté for another 5 minutes.
Combine the chicken, sautéed vegetables, and shredded banana blossom in a mixing bowl.
Soak a spring roll wrapper in warm water for a few seconds until pliable.
Place a lettuce leaf on the softened wrapper, then add a portion of the chicken and vegetable mixture. Roll tightly, tucking in the edges as you go.
Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.

schema.description: Dive into the world of healthy eating with our Banana Blossom Fresh Spring Rolls. This delightful recipe is perfect for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, low-sugar diet. Made with chicken thigh, a variety of fresh vegetables, and the unique ingredient, banana blossom, each bite offers a burst of freshness. Perfect for health-conscious individuals looking for delicious, healthified recipes.

schema.name: Eggplant Bellpepper Pesto

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 200°C (392°F) and prepare a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Wash the eggplant and red bell pepper, then cut the eggplant into cubes and the bell pepper into strips.
Peel and finely chop the red onion and garlic.
Place the eggplant, bell pepper, red onion, and garlic on the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil (not listed in ingredients, please adjust) and toss to coat evenly.
Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until they are nicely caramelized and tender.
Remove the vegetables from the oven and let them cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine the roasted vegetables with 2 tablespoons of pesto. Mix well until all the vegetables are evenly coated with the pesto.
Serve the Eggplant Bellpepper Pesto warm or at room temperature. Enjoy your healthy and flavorful dish!

schema.description: This Eggplant Bellpepper Pesto recipe is perfect for those looking for a delightful, health-conscious meal. With its low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar elements, it suits a variety of dietary needs. Embrace a healthier eating style with this delicious combination of eggplant, bell pepper, and rich pesto.

schema.name: Taragon Tuna
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the fresh tuna by patting it dry with paper towels to remove any excess moisture.
Season the tuna evenly with 1 tsp of dried tarragon, 0.25 tsp of salt, and 1 tsp of ground black pepper.
Preheat a skillet over medium-high heat.
Place the seasoned tuna in the skillet and sear each side for 2-3 minutes for medium-rare, or adjust the cooking time to your preferred level of doneness.
Remove the tuna from the skillet and let it rest for a couple of minutes before slicing.

schema.description: This Taragon Tuna recipe is perfect for those following a healthy lifestyle and seeking low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar meal options. Its blend of dried tarragon with fresh tuna is not only healthy but deliciously satisfying, making it a great choice for health-conscious individuals who don't want to compromise on flavor.

schema.name: 2018/11/02 Lunch Vegetables

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare all vegetables: wash and cut the eggplant into slices, trim the ends off the enoki mushrooms, and dice the capsicum.
Steam the 400g of vegetables until fully cooked and tender, about 15 minutes.
While the vegetables are steaming, season them with 0.25 teaspoon of salt and a quarter teaspoon of ground pepper.
Once the vegetables are steamed, transfer them to a large bowl.
Add the 3 tablespoons of tomato puree to the steamed vegetables. Mix well to ensure all the vegetables are coated evenly.

schema.description: This low-carb, high-fiber lunch featuring steamed vegetables, enoki mushrooms, tender eggplant, crisp capsicum, and rich tomato puree is not only a healthy choice but also aligns with Healthyfied Recipes. It's designed to nourish your body while satisfying your cravings for a wholesome meal.

schema.name: Bokchoy Shitake Veggies

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Chinese Bokchoy under cold water and chop into bite-sized pieces.
Peel the carrot and slice it into thin circles.
Cut the young baby corn into small rounds.
Slice the Shitake mushrooms into thin pieces.
Finely chop the red onion and mince the garlic cloves.
In a large pan over medium heat, add the mushrooms, onions, and garlic. Sauté for 5 minutes until softened.
Add the bokchoy, carrot, and baby corn to the pan. Stir in the salt and black pepper. Cook for an additional 8 minutes, until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.

schema.description: Delight in the healthy and flavorful Bokchoy Shitake Veggies recipe, perfect for those seeking a nutritious yet delicious meal. With low-carb and low-sugar ingredients, this dish fits splendidly into health-conscious diets.

schema.name: pesto potato

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Garlic Marble Potatoes under cold water until clean.
Boil the potatoes in a pot of salted water until they are fork-tender, about 15 minutes.
Drain the potatoes and let them cool slightly. Once cool enough to handle, cut them in half.
In a mixing bowl, gently toss the halved potatoes with the All Purpose Pesto until evenly coated.
Serve the potatoes warm as a delightful side dish.

schema.description: This pesto potato recipe is a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar marvel, perfect for those following a health-conscious diet. It turns humble ingredients into a delicious side dish that pairs well with a variety of mains. Ideal for those seeking healthy recipes to enrich their culinary repertoire.

schema.name: Mango Ensalada

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the tomatoes, dice the yellow pepper and red onion, and peel and cube the cucumber and mango.
In a large bowl, combine the chopped tomatoes, diced yellow pepper, cubed cucumber, cubed mango, and sliced red onion.
Drizzle the salad with 4 tablespoons of cane vinegar and toss well to coat all the ingredients evenly.
Allow the salad to marinate for at least 15 minutes before serving to enhance the flavors.

schema.description: This Mango Ensalada is a healthful delight, embodying all things fresh and nutritious. Tagged as low-carb and low-sodium, it's perfect for those seeking a healthier twist on classic recipes. Dive into the freshness of tomatoes, mango, cucumber, and more in this vibrant and healthy dish.

schema.name: Broccoli White Beech Mushrooms
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the broccoli under cold water and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Clean the white beech mushrooms by gently wiping them with a damp cloth.
Finely chop the red onion and mince the garlic.
In a large pan, heat some water over medium heat and steam the broccoli for about 5 minutes until they are bright green and tender. Remove from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, lightly sauté the chopped red onion and minced garlic for about 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the white beech mushrooms to the pan and cook for another 5 minutes, or until they are soft.
Return the steamed broccoli to the pan. Sprinkle the ground black pepper and drizzle the coconut amino over the top. Stir well to combine all the ingredients and cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve hot as a healthy and delicious side dish or a main course.

schema.description: This Broccoli White Beech Mushrooms recipe is a testament to healthy eating, perfectly aligning with a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar dietary preference. Ideal for those looking to enjoy a nutritious yet delicious meal, this dish brings together the fresh flavors of broccoli and white beech mushrooms, seasoned with coconut amino, black pepper, and a hint of garlic for an extra kick. A must-try for anyone seeking healthified recipes that don't compromise on taste!

schema.name: Zucchini Corn Radish Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the vegetables: Slice 1 medium zucchini, cut the kernels off 1 ear of corn, and thinly slice 50g of raw Daikon radish.
In a pan, melt 3 tsp of butter over medium heat.
Add the corn kernels to the pan and sauté for about 5 minutes, until slightly softened and golden.
Mix in 0.25 tsp of virgin coconut oil with the corn and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the sautéed corn, sliced zucchini, sliced radish, and 0.50 cup of chopped red onion.
Drizzle the salad with 1 Tbsp of cane vinegar, gently toss to combine all the ingredients.

schema.description: This Zucchini Corn Radish Salad is a perfect blend of flavors and textures, tailored for those following a healthy lifestyle. With its low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar ingredients, it's an ideal choice for a nutritious and refreshing meal. Whether you're looking for a healthy recipe to add to your collection or seeking to maintain a balanced diet, this salad is a delightful choice.

schema.name: Yellow Pepper With Sunflower Seeds

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the yellow pepper and red onion under cold water.
Dice the yellow pepper into small pieces, ensuring to remove the seeds and inner membrane.
Thinly slice the red onion.
In a pan over medium heat, lightly toast the sunflower seeds for about 3 minutes until they're golden and fragrant.
Add the diced yellow pepper and sliced red onion to the pan, sautéing for about 8 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Combine the vegetables and toasted sunflower seeds in a salad bowl, tossing gently to mix.

schema.description: This delightful Yellow Pepper with Sunflower Seeds recipe offers a health-centric twist on traditional flavors, perfectly aligning with a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. Ideal for those seeking healthy recipes or reimagined classics with a nutritious boost, it's sure to become a cherished staple in your culinary repertoire.

title: 2018/11/07 Red Cabbage And Bellpepper In Tomato Puree

schema.name: 2018/11/07 Red Cabbage and Bellpepper in Tomato Puree

recipeInstructions.text: Thinly slice the 200g of red cabbage.
Cut the 57g of orange bell pepper into thin strips.
Grate the 15g of cheddar cheese and set aside.
In a skillet over medium heat, cook the cabbage and bell pepper with the 0.25 cup of tomato puree until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.
Serve hot, garnishing with the grated cheddar cheese on top.

schema.description: This delicious recipe for Red Cabbage and Bellpepper in Tomato Puree is perfect for those looking for a healthy, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar meal. It's a wonderful addition to your collection of healthy recipes, designed to bring vibrant colors and flavors to your table while keeping your nutrition in check.

schema.name: Salad Stop Create Your Own
recipeIngredient: 10.00 g, Lentils - Cooked, boiled, with salt

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the beans, and mushrooms under cold water.
Chop the lettuce, turnip, raw red cabbage, bell peppers, and broccoli into bite-sized pieces.
Halve the olives and peel and segment the pomelo.
Combine all the prepared vegetables, beans, mushrooms, olives, lentils, and pomelo in a large salad bowl.
Toss the salad to ensure an even mix of all ingredients. Serve with breadsticks on the side. Enjoy your custom, nutritious salad!

schema.description: This 'Salad Stop Create Your Own' recipe is perfect for those who seek a health-conscious meal without compromising on taste. With a focus on low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar ingredients, this salad is a delightful combination of freshness and nutrition, making it ideal for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes with a delicious twist.

schema.name: Teryaki Onion

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the white onion into small pieces.
In a pan over medium heat, sauté the diced onion until they become translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add 1 tbsp of Teryaki Sauce to the pan and stir well, ensuring the onions are evenly coated. Cook for another 2 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly and the onions absorb the flavor.

schema.description: Indulge in a deliciously Healthyfied Teryaki Onion recipe that aligns perfectly with a low-carb and low-sugar diet. This dish captures the essence of health-conscious cooking without compromising on taste, making it a staple for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes.

schema.name: Coconut Carrots

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the carrots and slice them into uniform pieces.
In a pot, bring water to a boil and blanch the carrot pieces for about 3 minutes to soften them slightly.
Drain the carrot pieces and set them aside.
In a pan over medium heat, lightly toast the teaspoon of coconut until golden brown, about 1 minute.
Add the blanched carrot pieces to the pan and toss with the toasted coconut, cook for an additional 5 minutes to infuse the flavors.

schema.description: Our Coconut Carrots recipe is a perfect blend of simplicity and flavor, designed to suit a healthy lifestyle. Ideal for those on low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diets, this dish brings out the natural sweetness of carrots, enhanced by a hint of coconut. Dive into a plate of these healthy and delicious carrots to boost your daily vegetable intake in the most delightful way!

schema.name: Roast Turkey Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your vegetables: chop the cabbage, dice the onion, slice the cucumber, and chop the carrots.
In a large bowl, combine the chopped cabbage, diced onion, sliced cucumber, and chopped carrots.
Cut the roasted turkey breast into bite-sized pieces and add to the bowl with the vegetables.
Toss all the ingredients together until well mixed. If desired, add your favorite low-carb dressing to enhance the flavor.

schema.description: This Roast Turkey Salad is the perfect combination for anyone looking for a healthy, low-carb, and low-sugar meal. Full of freshness and flavor, it brings together the best of healthified recipes to create a dish that's not only delicious but also good for you.

schema.name: Green Bellpepper and Carrot

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your vegetables by washing them under cold water. Then, thinly slice the 98.00 g of Capsicum - Green and peel and slice the 180.00 g of Carrots, raw into thin strips or rounds, as preferred.
Heat 1 tsp of Extra Virgin Coconut Oil in a pan over medium heat.
Once the oil is hot, add the sliced bell pepper and carrot to the pan and sauté for about 10 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.

schema.description: This Green Bellpepper and Carrot recipe is a perfect choice for anyone looking to enjoy a healthy, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar meal. Crafted with fresh green capsicum and carrots, and lightly sautéed in extra virgin coconut oil, it's not only healthy but deliciously satisfying. Ideal for those seeking healthified recipes that don't sacrifice flavor for nutrition.

schema.name: Enoki Carrots

recipeInstructions.text: Wash and peel the carrots. Slice them into thin strips.
Cut the base off of the Enoki mushrooms and separate them gently.
In a pan over medium heat, add the carrots and sauté for approximately 5 minutes, until they start to soften.
Add the Enoki mushrooms to the pan with the carrots and sauté together for an additional 3 minutes, until the mushrooms are tender and the carrots are cooked through.

schema.description: This Enoki Carrots recipe is perfect for anyone looking for a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar option to incorporate into their healthy eating habits. It combines the crunchy sweetness of carrots with the delicate texture of Enoki mushrooms, making it a delightful addition to the 'Healthy Recipes' and 'Healthified Recipes' collections.

schema.name: Coconut Amino Garlic Broccoli

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the broccoli under cold water and cut into florets.
Peel and mince the garlic.
In a pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat and sauté the minced garlic until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Add the broccoli florets to the pan and sauté for 5 minutes.
Pour the coconut aminos over the broccoli, stir well, and cook for another 5 minutes until the broccoli is tender but still crisp.

schema.description: This Coconut Amino Garlic Broccoli is a delightful dish for anyone looking to enjoy a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar meal. Perfect for those seeking healthy, healthified recipes that don't compromise on flavor.

schema.name: Refreshing Salsa
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp(s), Seeds, sesame seeds, whole, dried

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and yellow bell pepper into small, even pieces.
Combine the diced vegetables in a large mixing bowl.
Add the sesame seeds, ground black pepper, and rock salt to the vegetables.
Gently mix all the ingredients until evenly distributed.
Allow the salsa to sit for 5 minutes, letting the flavors meld together.
Serve the salsa chilled or at room temperature for the best flavor experience.

schema.description: This Refreshing Salsa recipe is perfect for those on a healthy eating journey. With its low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar ingredients, it's an ideal addition to your collection of healthy recipes. The combination of crisp cucumber, sweet cherry tomatoes, zesty red onion, crunchy sesame seeds, spicy black pepper, and vibrant yellow bell pepper makes this salsa not just healthy but also bursting with flavor. Whether you're looking for a nutritious topping for your grilled dishes or a vibrant side that brings life to your meals, this salsa has got you covered.

schema.name: Zucchini Chips

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 220 degrees Celsius.
Slice the steamed zucchini into thin, chip-sized pieces.
In a bowl, toss the zucchini slices with the extra virgin coconut oil until evenly coated.
Arrange the zucchini slices in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, then flip the chips and bake for another 10 minutes or until crisp and golden brown.

schema.description: Indulge in our Zucchini Chips for a low-carb, low-sugar snack option. Perfect for those on a health journey, these chips are not only delicious but are a part of our Healthy Recipes collection, ensuring you can enjoy a crisp, guilt-free treat anytime.

schema.name: Garlic Lemony Caulirice
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the cauliflower, red onion, and yellow bell pepper under cold water.
Chop the cauliflower into florets, dice the red onion, and chop the yellow bell pepper.
Mince the garlic.
In a food processor, pulse the cauliflower florets until they reach a rice-like consistency.
In a large skillet over medium heat, sauté the diced red onion and chopped yellow bell pepper for about 5 minutes, until softened.
Add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for an additional 1 minute, until fragrant.
Stir in the cauliflower rice, and continue to sauté for about 8 minutes, until the cauliflower is tender.
Season with salt and ground black pepper to taste.
Stir in the lemon juice and cook for an additional 2 minutes.

schema.description: Discover the delightful flavors of Garlic Lemony Caulirice, a perfect dish for anyone seeking a healthy and vibrant meal. This low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar recipe brings together the freshness of cauliflower, red onion, yellow bell pepper, and garlic, with a zesty twist of lemon. It's an ideal choice for those looking for nourishing healthified recipes that don't sacrifice taste.

schema.name: Colorful Ensalada

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by juicing the lemon until you have the required amount of lemon juice.
Chop the tomatoes, yellow bell pepper, green capsicum, and red onion into small, bite-sized pieces.
Mince the garlic cloves finely.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped tomatoes, yellow bell pepper, green capsicum, red onion, and minced garlic.
Add the lemon juice and black pepper to the bowl. Toss all ingredients until they are well mixed and evenly coated with the dressing.

schema.description: This Colorful Ensalada is a vibrant, healthy meal perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar option. Bursting with the fresh flavors of tomatoes, bell peppers, and a tangy lemon dressing, it's a delicious way to enjoy Healthyfied Recipes!

schema.name: Camomile Cranberry Green Milk Tea

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the mug of water until hot but not boiling.
Steep the Twinings tea bag and Cranberry Green Tea bag in the hot water for about 3-5 minutes depending on desired strength.
Remove the tea bags and stir in the milk powder until fully dissolved.
Serve the Camomile Cranberry Green Milk Tea immediately while warm.

schema.description: This Camomile Cranberry Green Milk Tea combines the soothing qualities of camomile with the tangy kick of cranberry and the rich creaminess of milk powder for a comforting and health-conscious beverage. Perfect for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet, this tea is a delightful addition to any healthy lifestyle.

schema.name: Tomato Mushrooms
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Brown Beech mushrooms under cold water and slice them.
Mince the garlic and chop the red onion.
In a pan over medium heat, sauté the garlic and red onion until they become translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the sliced Brown Beech mushrooms to the pan and cook until they are soft and have released their moisture, about 8 minutes.
Stir in the tomato puree, salt, and black pepper. Continue cooking for another 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.

schema.description: This Tomato Mushrooms recipe is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a tasty, healthy meal without overloading on carbs, sodium, or sugar. Its low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar ingredients make it an ideal choice for health-conscious individuals. Featuring a delicious blend of brown beech mushrooms, garlic, red onions, and a touch of tomato puree, it's a Healthyfied delight that's sure to satisfy both the body and the taste buds.

schema.name: Eggplant Egg

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the eggplant thoroughly under cold running water.
Slice the eggplant into 1/2 inch thick rounds.
In a large skillet, heat a small amount of olive oil over medium heat. Add the eggplant slices and cook for 5 minutes on each side or until they become tender.
Crack the egg into a bowl and beat lightly.
Pour the beaten egg over the cooked eggplant in the skillet. Cook for an additional 3 minutes or until the egg is fully set.
Serve the eggplant egg hot. Enjoy your nutritious and delicious meal.

schema.description: This Eggplant Egg recipe is a healthy, delicious, and easy-to-make dish perfect for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. Embrace the essence of healthy eating with this delightful recipe that's sure to become a staple in your culinary collection.

schema.name: Herbed Broccoli and Cauliflower

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the cauliflower and broccoli under cold water and pat dry.
Cut the cauliflower and broccoli into florets.
In a bowl, mix together salt and ground pepper.
Sprinkle the salt and pepper mix over the cauliflower and broccoli florets, ensuring they are evenly coated.
Steam the cauliflower and broccoli until tender, about 7 minutes.
Serve the steamed herbed cauliflower and broccoli warm as a delicious, healthy side dish.

schema.description: This Herbed Broccoli and Cauliflower recipe is a delightful and healthy addition to your meal plan. Perfect for anyone following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet, this dish is not only nutritious but also packed with flavors. A part of our Healthy Recipes collection, it's been 'healthified' to ensure you enjoy a delicious yet health-conscious meal.

schema.name: Cucumber Ensalada

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the cucumber into thin rounds.
In a bowl, combine the coconut amino and coconut vinegar with honey, stirring until well mixed.
Add the sliced cucumber to the bowl and gently toss to coat evenly with the dressing.
Let the Cucumber Ensalada marinate for 10 minutes to absorb the flavors.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

schema.description: Indulge in a refreshing and health-conscious Cucumber Ensalada, perfect for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. This simple yet delightful recipe bridges the gap to a healthier lifestyle with its use of coconut amino and coconut vinegar with honey, making it an essential addition to your healthy recipes collection.

schema.name: Eggplant in Caramelized Tomato

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by slicing the 200g of raw eggplant into rounds or strips, depending on your preference.
Finely chop 60g of red onion and 10g of raw garlic, setting them aside for later use.
In a non-stick skillet over medium heat, sauté the chopped onion and garlic until they start to soften and become fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add the sliced eggplant to the skillet and cook until the eggplant is tender and slightly browned, approximately 8 minutes.
Pour 0.25 cup of tomato puree over the cooked eggplant. Stir well to ensure the eggplant slices are fully coated with the tomato puree.
Continue cooking the eggplant in the tomato puree, allowing the mixture to simmer until the puree has caramelized onto the eggplant, about 7 minutes.
Remove from heat and let it sit for a couple of minutes before serving. Enjoy your Eggplant in Caramelized Tomato hot or at room temperature.

schema.description: This Eggplant in Caramelized Tomato recipe is a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar delight that fits perfectly into a healthy lifestyle. Considered among healthy recipes, this dish is packed with flavors that are sure to please anyone looking to eat well without sacrificing taste.

schema.name: Zucchini Tomato Thyme Skillet
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp, ground (2.3 g), Black Pepper - Ground

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare your vegetables by slicing the zucchini into thin rounds and chopping the tomatoes.
Season the sliced zucchini with salt, ground black pepper, and fresh thyme.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and add a dash of coconut aminos to prevent sticking.
Arrange the seasoned zucchini slices in the skillet and let them cook for about 5 minutes until they are slightly tender.
Add the chopped tomatoes to the skillet and cook for an additional 5 minutes until the tomatoes are just softened and the zucchini is fully cooked.
Sprinkle the dish with additional thyme before serving warm.

schema.description: The Zucchini Tomato Thyme Skillet is a vibrant, low-carb and low-sugar dish perfect for those looking to enjoy healthy yet flavorful options. With the freshness of thyme and the tanginess of tomatoes, it's a healthified recipe that doesn't compromise on taste.

schema.name: Ensaladang Kamatis
recipeIngredient: 0.50 medium (approx 2-3/4" long, 2-1/2" dia), Peppers, sweet, green, raw

recipeInstructions.text: Begin by preparing your ingredients: finely chop the red onions, dice the green peppers, and slice the tomatoes into wedges.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped red onions, diced green peppers, and tomato wedges.
In a small bowl, mix together 2 teaspoons of coconut sugar with 2 tablespoons of cane vinegar until the sugar is completely dissolved.
Pour the vinegar and sugar mixture over the vegetables and gently toss to combine, ensuring all the ingredients are evenly coated.
Allow the salad to sit for about 10 minutes to marinate, enhancing the flavors of the ingredients.
Serve the Ensaladang Kamatis chilled or at room temperature as a refreshing side dish.

schema.description: Ensaladang Kamatis is a delightful, refreshing salad perfect for those adhering to low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diets. This Healthified recipe is not only simple to make but brings a burst of flavors that perfectly complement any meal, making it ideal for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes without sacrificing taste.

schema.name: Ginisang Upo

recipeInstructions.text: First, prepare the ingredients: Finely chop the tomatoes, onion, and garlic. Set aside.
In a pan, heat a bit of oil over medium heat. Add the chopped garlic and onion, cooking until they become fragrant and slightly translucent, about 3 minutes.
Add the chopped tomatoes to the pan and cook until they are soft, about 5 minutes.
Cut the uncooked upo (bottle gourd) into bite-sized pieces and add them to the pan. Stir well to combine with the tomato mixture.
Season with salt. Cover the pan and let it simmer until the upo is tender, approximately 10 minutes.

schema.description: Ginisang Upo is a delightfully healthy and low-carb dish that fits perfectly into any health-conscious diet. Its low sodium and sugar content make it an excellent choice for anyone looking to maintain a balanced lifestyle. This dish is part of our Healthy Recipes collection, designed to offer nutritious yet delicious options to your meals.

schema.name: Orange Amino Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the oranges and remove all the white pith and seeds.
In a blender, blend the peeled oranges until smooth.
Strain the orange juice through a fine mesh sieve to remove any remaining pulp.
Pour the orange juice into a small saucepan and add the coconut amino. Stir to combine.
Bring the sauce to a simmer over low heat, stirring occasionally, until it thickens to your desired consistency.

schema.description: Indulge in the tangy and sweet essence of our Orange Amino Sauce, perfectly crafted for those pursuing a healthy lifestyle. This low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar recipe aligns with your nutritional goals while tantalizing your taste buds. Ideal for adding a zestful twist to your meals, this sauce is a must-try for anyone looking to enhance their culinary creations without compromising on health.

schema.name: Kale Chips

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
Wash the kale and thoroughly dry it with a salad spinner or a clean towel.
Tear the kale leaves into bite-sized pieces, discarding the thick stems.
In a large bowl, massage the kale with olive oil and salt to evenly coat the leaves.
Spread the kale in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 10-15 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned and the kale is crisp. Keep a close eye to prevent burning.
Let the kale chips cool on the sheet for a few minutes before serving to crisp up further.

schema.description: Indulge in a guilt-free snack with these Kale Chips. Perfect for those following a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet, these chips offer a healthy alternative without compromising on taste. Enjoy the crunchy goodness of kale transformed into a delightful snack that fits perfectly into your health-conscious lifestyle.

schema.name: Adobong Sitaw

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the fresh string beans by trimming the ends and cutting them into 2-inch lengths.
In a pan, heat a tablespoon of oil over medium heat.
Add the prepared string beans to the pan and sauté for about 5 minutes, or until they start to soften.
Season the string beans with soy sauce, ground black pepper, and salt. Stir well to combine.
Continue to cook the string beans for another 5 minutes until they are fully cooked and the flavors are well blended.

schema.description: Adobong Sitaw offers a healthy twist on a traditional Filipino favorite, ideal for those on a low-carb, low-sugar diet but who don't mind a bit of a sodium kick. This dish is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy classic flavors in a healthified way.

title: Young Corn In Coconut Aminos And Orange Juice

schema.name: Young Corn in Coconut Aminos and Orange Juice

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the young corn under cold water and set aside.
In a bowl, mix the coconut amino and orange juice together until well combined.
In a pan over medium heat, add the young corn and pour the coconut amino and orange juice mixture over it. Cook for 10 minutes, occasionally stirring until the corn is tender and glazed.

schema.description: This Young Corn in Coconut Aminos and Orange Juice recipe is a delightful twist on a healthy, low-carb, and low-sugar meal. Its unique blend of flavors satisfies the taste buds while adhering to health-conscious dietary choices. Perfect for those seeking healthy recipes without sacrificing taste.

schema.name: Shirataki black olives noodles

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Shirataki Noodles under cold water for about 1 minute.
Bring a pot of water to boil, add the Shirataki Noodles and cook for 2-3 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Chop the Black Olives into small pieces.
In a mixing bowl, combine the Coconut Aminos and Black Olives with the Shirataki Noodles. Toss everything together until the noodles are well coated.

schema.description: This Shirataki black olives noodles dish is a healthful delight, perfect for those on a low-carb, low-sodium, low-sugar, and high-fiber diet. Embrace a healthy lifestyle without sacrificing flavor with this simple yet elegant noodle dish. Ideal for anyone looking for healthy recipes to add to their culinary repertoire.

schema.name: Rainbow Salsa

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the yellow bell peppers and tomatoes under cold water.
Dice the yellow bell peppers and tomatoes into small pieces.
Finely chop the thyme.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the diced yellow bell peppers, tomatoes, and chopped thyme. Mix gently to combine.
Let the salsa sit for about 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

schema.description: This Rainbow Salsa celebrates a vibrant medley of healthy ingredients, perfect for anyone keen on a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar diet. Dive into this culinary masterpiece and embrace a healthy lifestyle with our collection of healthified recipes.

schema.name: Buttered Garlic Asparagus

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the asparagus by washing them and trimming off the tough ends.
Thinly slice the garlic.
Bring a pot of water to a boil, add salt, then blanch the asparagus for 2-3 minutes until tender but still crisp. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the sliced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the blanched asparagus to the pan. Sprinkle with salt to taste, and toss to coat evenly with the garlic butter. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.

schema.description: This Buttered Garlic Asparagus recipe is a delightful addition to any meal, perfect for those following a low-carb and low-sugar diet. It's part of our Healthy Recipes collection, designed to enhance your meals with a touch of green and a burst of flavor while keeping health in mind.
